f.d: [31. sa bcu'i le'u]
BOOK TWENTY-SIX. The Ten Stages
bam po bzhi bcu rtsa lnga pa/

de nas bcom ldan 'das lha'i rgyal po dbang sgyur gyi gnas kyi nor bu rin po che dam pa'i khang pa na/ byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun chen po thams cad kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dang / gzhan nas 'dus pa sha stag kun kyang byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi yul dang spyod yul thams cad rab tu thob pas gnas pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi yul la 'jug cing gzhol ba'i spyod yul ma gtang ba; 'gro ba thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul bar bya ba'i dus bzhin du thogs pa med pa'i byin gyi rlabs rnam pa tha dad pas bya ba thams cad yang dag par ston pa la mkhas pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam thams cad mngon par bsgrub cing bskal pa dang / zhing dang / dus su spyod pa la gnas pa'i rgyun mi gcod pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams dang / ye shes dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs shing 'gro ba thams cad nye bar 'tsho ba mi zad pa la rab tu zhugs pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab dang / thabs thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dam pa thob pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pas 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgo yang dag par bstan cing / shin tu bsgrub pa'i rgyun mi gcod pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / rig pa dang / ye shes la rnam par rol pa'i mngon par shes pas bya ba thams cad yang dag par ston pa la mkhas pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul dang / stobs dang / dbang thams cad thob cing mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i sems skad cig gis/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du 'dong ba la sngon du 'dren pa'i gtam gyi skyes bu dam pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo yang dag par gzung ba dang / sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang / rim gro rgya chen po bya ba'i don du mngon par brtson pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i las thams cad yang dag par blang ba mnyam pa nyid kyis sbyor bas/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du lus kyi gzugs brnyan rab tu 'byung ba/ chos kyi dbyings thams cad du chags pa med pa'i dbyangs rab tu sgrog pas/ dus gsum thams cad du chags pa med pa'i sems dang ye shes kyi yul rgyas par 'gengs pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan dang / nan tan yongs su rdzogs pa thams cad bskal pa brjod du med par rgyun mi 'chad par yang dag par bstan pa la yon tan bsngags shing / brjod pa zad mi shes pa sha stag ste/ 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdo rje'i snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rin po che'i snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pad+mo'i snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dpal gyi snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pad+mo dpal gyi snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nyi ma'i snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gtsang ba'i snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa'i snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zla ba dri ma med pa'i snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rgyan rnam par dgod pa thams cad rab tu snang bar ston pa'i snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ye shes rnam par snang ba'i snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dpal yid du 'ong ba'i snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tsan dan dpal gyi snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po me tog dpal gyi snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po me tog rgyas pa'i dpal gyi snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dpal lha'i snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsod nams dpal gyi snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes rnam par dag pa dpal gyi snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yon tan dpal gyi snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mthu chen dpal gyi snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dri ma med pa'i snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dri ma dang bral ba'i snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spobs pa sna tshogs rgyan gyi snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'od zer gyi dra ba chen po rab tu snang ba'i snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'od dri ma med pa'i dpal gyi gzi brjid bzang po'i snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gser bzang po dri ma med pa'i dbyig gis spras pa'i gzi brjid mdzes pa'i snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mtshan thams cad kyis brgyan pas rnam par dag pa'i dpal gyi snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dpal gyi be'u rdo rje 'od 'phro bas brgyan pa'i snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'od 'bar zhing 'phro ba'i dpal gyi snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skar ma'i rgyal po 'od rab tu snang ba'i snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i mdzod ye shes bsgribs pa med pa'i snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor bsgribs pa med cing nga ro snyan pa'i snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzungs kyi snying po yon tan gyis 'gro ba thams cad kyi smon lam yang dag par 'dzin pa'i snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rgya mtsho'i rgyan gyi snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ri rab dpal gyi snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yon tan thams cad rnam par dag pa'i snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas dpal gyi snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam par grol ba'i zla ba dang / de dag la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshad med pa/ gzhal du med pa/ grangs med pa/ bsam gyis mi khyab pa/ mtshungs pa med pa/ dpag tu med pa/ kun tu mtha' yas pa/ mu med pa/ sa mtshams med pa/ brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdo rje'i snying po la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs nas 'dus pa sha stag dang thabs gcig tu zhugs so/ /

THUS HAVE I HEARD. Once the Blessed One was sojourning in the heaven of control of others’ emanations. Not long after his perfect enlightenment—the second week—he was in the palace of the king of that heaven, a shining, radiantly pure treasury of jewels, together with a large group of enlightening beings, all of them beyond regression and bound to become perfectly enlightened in one lifetime, who had come from different worlds. Those enlightening beings were abiding in the sphere of knowledge of all enlightening beings; their sphere of action was that of ceaseless penetration into the entries of the realm of knowledge of all enlightened ones; they were skilled in showing all feats of power appropriately timed for the development and liberating guidance of all sentient beings; in order to fulfill all the great vows of enlightening beings, in all worlds and times, all ages, and all lands they diligently cultivated practices unceasingly; they had fulfilled the inexhaustible stores of virtue, knowledge, and occult powers of all enlightening beings, for the benefit of all worldly beings; having attained the highest ultimate reaches of transcendental knowledge and expedient liberative means of enlightening beings, they showed entries into mundane existence and nirvana, while not interrupting the application of means of practices of enlightening beings; sporting freely in the meditations, liberations, concentrations, attainments, and mystic knowledges of enlightening beings, they were skilled in the demonstration of all feats of mystic knowledge; having attained the occult powers and command of enlightening beings, going without effort in a single mental instant to the circles of all buddhas, they acted as leading interlocutors; holding the wheels of teachings of all buddhas, they had gone to make offerings to and wait on many buddhas; they had realized the manifestation of bodies in all worlds engaged in the undertaking of the deeds of all enlightening beings; their voices sounded in all realms without obstruction, and the sphere of knowledge of the mind unobstructed in all places and times was revealed to them; they had thoroughly fulfilled the attainments of qualities of all enlightening beings, and their qualities could never be exhaustively explained even in untold eons. Their names were Diamond Matrix, Jewel Matrix, Lotus Matrix, Matrix of Glory, Matrix of Lotuslike Splendor, Solar Matrix, Sun Matrix, Earth Matrix, Matrix of Lunar Purity, Matrix of Manifestation of All Arrays of Adornments, Matrix of Illumination of Knowledge, Matrix of Radiance, Matrix of Blossoming Glory, Matrix of Blue Lotus Splendor, Matrix of Celestial Qualities, Matrix of Splendor of Virtue, Matrix of Purity of Unobstructed Knowledge, Matrix of Godlike Majesty, Matrix of Purity, Matrix of Nondefilement, Matrix of Adornment of Varied Eloquence, Matrix of Radiance of Great Webs of Light Beams, Matrix of Radiance of Power of Splendor of Undefiled Light, Matrix of Pure Radiance of Accumulated Gold, Matrix of Pure Splendor Adorned by All Characteristics of Enlightening Beings, Matrix of Glorious Adornments of Diamond Flames, Matrix of Beauty of Flames of Light, Matrix of Light of Majesty of the Stars, Matrix of Unhindered Knowledge of the Treasury of the Sky, Matrix of Sweet Sounds with Unobstructed Spheres of Resonance, Matrix of Spells Supporting the Aspirations of All Beings, Matrix of Adornments of the Ocean, Matrix of Majesty of the Polar Mountain, Matrix of Purity of All Qualities, Matrix of Splendor of Those Who Realize Thusness, Matrix of Majesty of the Enlightened, and Moon of Liberation. The Buddha was with innumerable enlightening beings assembled from various buddha-lands, led by Diamond Matrix, these being the main ones.

de nas de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdo rje'i snying po sangs rgyas kyi mthus theg pa chen po rab tu snang ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so/ / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdo rje'i snying pos/ byang chub sems dpa' ting nge 'dzin theg pa chen po rab tu snang ba de la mnyam par bzhag ma thag tu/ de nas de'i tshe phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi phyogs re re'i 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi pha rol nas/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kun kyang mtshan rdo rje'i snying po zhes bya bar mthun pa sha stag gis zhal mngon par bstan te/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis de la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to/ / rigs kyi bu/ de ltar khyod byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin theg pa chen po rab tu snang ba la snyoms par zhugs pa legs so/ / legs so/ / 'di ltar rigs kyi bu khyod la phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kun kyang mtshan rdo rje'i snying po zhes bya bar mthun pa sha stag gis/ bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad 'di'i sngon gyi smon lam gyi byin gyi rlabs dang / khyod nyid kyi ye shes kyi khyad par gyis byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi chos snang ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa rab tu brjod cing / ye shes kyi sa la 'jug par bya ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par bsdu ba dang; sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rab tu dbye ba la mkhas par bya ba dang / chos thams cad la ye shes shin tu yangs par bya ba dang / shin tu legs par gnas pa'i chos rab tu bstan pa dang / ye shes tha mi dad pa rnam par sbyang ba dang / 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad kyis gos pa med par bya ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su dag par bya ba dang / ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul khong du chud par bya ba nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul gyi bar du khong du chud par bya ba dang / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu brtsams pa rab tu thob par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa ma nor bar rnam par dgod pa shin tu bstan pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la yang dag par dmigs par bya ba dang / zag pa med pa'i chos kyi bye brag rnam par bsgom pa dang / rnam par dbye ba shin tu rnam par phye ba'i shes rab kyi snang ba chen po la mkhas pa'i ye shes kyi rgyan thob par bya ba dang / shin tu brtags pa'i ye shes kyi sgo la 'jug par bya ba dang / gnas kyi rnam pa ci rigs su brjod pa dang / spobs pa'i snang ba dma' ba med par thob par bya ba dang / tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa chen po'i sa shin tu rtogs par bya ba dang / byang chub kyi sems la dran pa nyams pa med par bya ba dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / thams cad du song ba'i blo rnam par gdon mi za ba la mkhas pa rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir byin gyis brlab pa mdzad do/ / de bas na rigs kyi bu khyod kyis chos kyi sgo rab tu dbye ba la mkhas par 'gyur ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes snang ba'i byin gyi rlabs kyis rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su dag par bya ba dang / chos kyi dbyings shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad la phan gdags pa dang / chos kyi sku'i ye shes kyi lus la 'jug par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyis dbang bskur ba yang dag par blang ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du shin tu 'phags pa'i lus 'byung bar bya ba dang / 'jig rten gyi lam gyi rgyud thams cad las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi tshul yongs su dag par bya ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir spobs pa skyed cig /

At that time Diamond Matrix, by the power of Buddha, entered the concentration called Light of the Great Vehicle, and as soon as he had done so there appeared to him as many buddhas as atoms in ten billion buddha-lands from beyond as many worlds as atoms in ten buddha-lands in each of the ten directions, all of whom were alike named Diamond Matrix. Those buddhas said, “It is good that you have entered this concentration of enlightening beings’ Light of the Great Vehicle. In this you are supported by the Buddhas numerous as atoms in ten billion buddha-lands beyond worlds as numerous as atoms in ten billion buddha-lands in the ten directions, and by the power of the ancient vow of Vairocana Buddha, and it is also due to the excellence of your virtue and knowledge, so that all enlightening beings may enter the stages of knowledge of the illuminating power of the inconceivable Buddha teachings, to attain all roots of goodness, for skill in analyzing all Buddha teachings, for breadth of knowledge of things, for the exposition of well-constructed teachings, for the purification of holistic knowledge, so as to be unstained by worldly things, for the purification of supramundane roots of goodness, for the discovery of particulars of the sphere of inconceivable knowledge, and for the realization of the sphere of omniscient knowledge: that is to say, it is for the sake of the undertaking and attainment of the ten stages of enlightening beings, for the sake of correct explanation of skill in setting up the stages of enlightening beings, for the sake of proper focusing on the teachings of the buddhas, to distinguish undefiled phenomena, for skill with the light of great wisdom with knowing discernment, for entry into complete definitive adaptive knowledge, for the light of eloquence to explain without hesitation or obstruction in accord with differences in capability and station, to fulfill the stage of great discursive knowledge, to never forget the determination for enlightenment, to develop all beings to perfection, and to attain skill in discernment in all situations. Furthermore, you should explain this teaching, skill in differentiation of means of revealing truth, by the power of the Buddha, by the aid of the light of knowledge of the Buddha, for the perfect purification of your own roots of goodness, for the thorough purification of the cosmos, for the protection of sentient beings, for the body of knowledge of the body of reality, to receive the anointment of all buddhas, for the manifestation of the most exalted being in all worlds, to completely transcend all worldly paths, to purify the path to the supramundane, to fulfill omniscience.”

de nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po la zil gyis mi non pa'i lus nye bar bsgrub pa mdzad do/ / thogs pa med pa'i spobs pas shin tu ston pa nye bar bsgrub pa mdzad do/ / shin tu sbyangs pa'i ye shes rnam par phye ba la 'jug pa nye bar bsgrub pa mdzad do/ / dran pa nyams pa med pa'i byin gyi rlabs nye bar bsgrub pa mdzad do/ / blo gros shin tu nges par rtogs pas mkhas pa nye bar bsgrub pa mdzad do/ / thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i blo'i rjes su 'gro ba nye bar bsgrub pa mdzad do/ / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi stobs thub pa med pa nye bar bsgrub pa mdzad do/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa che zhing zhum pa med pa nye bar bsgrub pa mdzad do/ / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pas rnam par dbye ba'i chos kyi tshul shin tu rtogs par bya ba nye bar bsgrub pa mdzad do/ / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rgyan shin tu rnam par phye ba mngon par bsdu ba nye bar bsgrub pa mdzad do/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de ni ting nge 'dzin de nyid kyi chos nyid rab tu thob pa dang / sngon gyi smon lam gyis mngon par bsgrubs pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa shin tu rnam par sbyangs pa dang / ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor shin tu sbyangs pa dang / tshogs shin tu bsags pa dang / yongs su sbyangs pa shin tu byas pa dang / dran pa'i snod tshad med pa dang / mos pa rnam par dag cing 'od shin tu gsal ba dang / gzungs kyi sgo tha dad pa med par thob pa dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi phyag rgyas shin tu btab pa'i phyir ro/ /

Then those buddhas gave the enlightening being Diamond Matrix physical invincibility, the ability to teach with unhindered presence of mind, pure knowledge of differentiation, the power of unfailing recollection, skill with certain intellect, unfailing understanding in all situations, the invincible power of the perfectly enlightened, indomitability of power and expertise of a buddha, attainment of discernment and teaching by the discursive knowledge of the omniscient, and gave him the well-arrayed physical, verbal, and mental adornments of all buddhas. Why? Because of his attainment of the reality of this concentration in accord with its name; because of the upshot of his past vows; because of his thoroughly pure determination; because of his purification of his sphere of knowledge; because of his having stored well the provisions for the Path; because of his having accomplished well what he had to do; because of his being an immeasurable vessel of remembrance; because of his having purified clear faith; because of his having mastered the method of concentration spells without corruption; because of his being perfectly stamped with the seal of self-knowledge; and because of his being perfectly stamped with the seal of knowledge of the realm of reality.

de nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis de dag na bzhugs bzhin du rdzu 'phrul gyis mthus so so nas phyag g.yas pa brkyang ste/ byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po'i mgo la byug pa mdzad do/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po la reg ma thag tu de nyid kyi tshe ting nge 'dzin de las langs nas/ byang chub sems dpa' de dag la smras pa/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag / byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam 'di ni shin tu rnam par gdon mi za ba ste/ tha mi dad pa/ ltar med pa/ chos kyi dbyings kyis klas par yangs pa/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthar thug pa/ phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad du rgyas par khyab pa/ 'gro ba thams cad yongs su skyob pa; de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyi brlabs pa ste/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'das pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ye shes kyi sa la yang rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ro/ / ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ye shes kyi sa la yang rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ro/ / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ye shes kyi sa la yang rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ro/ /
kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de la bcu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi sa rnams te/ gang la bsams te bdag gis de skad du smras pa de dag ni 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis gsungs so/ / gsung ngo/ / gsung bar 'gyur ro/ / bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po dang / dri ma dang bral ba zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa'i sa gnyis pa dang / 'od byed pa zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa'i sa gsum pa dang / 'od 'phro ba can zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa'i sa bzhi pa dang / rgyal bar dka' ba zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga pa dang / mngon sum pa zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa dang / ring du song ba zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa dang / mi g.yo ba zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa dang / legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa'i sa dgu pa dang / chos kyi sprin ces bya ba byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu pa ste/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu ste/ de ni 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis gsungs so/ / gsung ngo/ / gsung bar 'gyur ro/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /bdag gis ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang na'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu po 'di dag mi gsung ba de lta bu ma mthong ngo/ /

Then those buddhas, by their occult power, extended their right hands from where they were and rubbed the head of Diamond Matrix, at which point the enlightening being arose from that concentration and said to the other enlightening beings, “Perfectly sure, O blessed offspring of the Victorious, is the vow of enlightening beings, unadulterated, impossible to see in its entirety, vast as the cosmos, including all space, eternal, rescuing all beings, wherein alone the blessed enlightening beings enter the stage of knowledge of the past buddhas, enter the stage of knowledge of the future buddhas, and enter the stage of knowledge of the present buddhas. There are ten stages of enlightening beings that enter into the stage of knowledge of the buddhas. And what are these ten stages of enlightening beings that have been, will be, and are being explained by the buddhas of the past, future, and present? Having meditated on them, I will now tell you.
They are the enlightening beings’ stage called Extreme Joy, that called Purity, that called Refulgence, that called Blazing, that called Difficult to Conquer, that called Presence, that called Far-Going, that called Immovable, that called Good Mind, and the stage of enlightening beings called Cloud of Teaching. These are the ten stages of enlightening beings that have been, will be, and are expounded by the buddhas of the past, future, and present. I have never seen any buddha-land where the buddhas do not elucidate these ten stages of enlightening beings.

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i lam yongs su sbyong ba'i chos snang ba'i sgo 'di ni yang dag phul zhes bya ba yin te/ 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnam par dgod pa shin tu bstan pa'o/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /gnas 'di ni bsam gyi mi khyab pa ste/ 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis shes pa'o/ /

Why? This is the supreme light of teaching method to purify the path of enlightening being—that is the definition of the specifics of the ten stages. Inconceivable is this realm of knowledge of the ten stages.”
de nas de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu po 'di dag ming tsam zhig brjod de/ cang mi zer bar 'dug nas de las rab tu phye ste ma bshad pa dang /
Then Diamond Matrix, having mentioned the names of these ten stages, fell silent and gave no further definitions.

de nas byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor de dag thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu po de dag gi ming tsam zhig thos nas/ rab tu phye ste ma brjod pas skom par gyur nas/ de dag 'di snyam du sems te/ de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu po de dag gi ming tsam zhig brjod de cang mi zer bar 'dug na/ de las rab tu phye zhing mi ston pa de la rgyu ni gang / rkyen ni ci zhig yod snyam pa dang / de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' 'khor 'dus pa de na/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam par grol ba'i zla ba zhes bya ba 'dus shing 'dug 'dug ste/ de nas byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor de dag gi sems kyi yongs su rtog pa sems kyis yongs su shes nas/ byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po la glu'i dbyangs kyis tshigs su bcad de don de dris so/ /

Thereupon the assembly of enlightening beings became anxious, having heard only the names of the stages, their definition not having been explained. They wondered why Diamond Matrix remained silent after mentioning only the names of the ten stages and did not analyze them further.
At that time there was among the assembly of enlightening beings an enlightening being named Moon of Liberation who knew what was on the minds of the assembly of enlightening beings and who asked Diamond Matrix in verse,

ci phyir rtog pa rnam dag cing / / dran dang ye shes ldan pa yis/ / sa yi mchog ni brjod byas te/ / mkhas pas rnam par phye mi bshad/ /
'di kun nges par rtogs pa ste/ / byang chub sems dpa' grags chen yin/ / ci phyir khyod ni sa brjod de/ / rab tu phye ba bshad mi bgyi/ /
rgyal sras 'jigs med 'di dag ni; ; kun kyang shin tu nyan par 'dod/ / sa yi don tshul yang dag tu/ / rnam par phye ste bshad par mdzod/ /
'khor 'di shin tu rnam dang ste/ / le lo med cing dge dang ldan/ / dag pa'i mchog la gnas pa ste/ / yon tan ye shes ldan pa yin/ /
phan tshun gcig la gcig lta zhing / / kun kyang rim gro bcas par gnas/ / sbrang rtsi ji ltar spang min pa/ / de ltar bdud rtsi mchog kyang 'dod/ /

O ye of pure intent, mindfulness, knowledge, and virtue, Having mentioned the supreme stages, why do you not explain them?
All these honored enlightening beings are sure in mind; Why, having mentioned the stages, do you not define them?
These experienced offspring of buddhas want to hear— Please explain the meanings and ways of the correct stages.
This assembly is quiet, free from sloth, pure; Purified, steadfast, full of virtue and knowledge.
All stand there gazing respectfully, Desirous, as bees for honey, for the ultimate ambrosia.
rdo rje'i snying po 'jigs med pa/ / shes rab chen pos de thos nas/ / 'khor rnams dga' bar bya ba'i phyir/ / bde bar gshegs pa'i sras la smras/ /
Having heard this, the wise, experienced Diamond Matrix spoke to please the assembly:

sangs rgyas sku rab yang dag 'byung bas na/ / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rab bstan cing / / sa rgyu dam pa rnam par dbye bya ba/ / de ni rmad byung mchog tu dga' ba yin/ /
phra zhing blta dka' rnam par rtog pa spangs/ / sems kyi sa dang bral bas bsgrub par dga'/ / mkhas pa rnams kyi zag med spyod yul te/ / 'gro ba rnams kyis de thos mos par 'gyur/ /
rdo rje lta bur bsam pa rab bzhag ste/ / sangs rgyas ye shes mchog la mos byas shing / / bdag med pa yi sems kyi sa shes na/ / ye shes dam pa 'di gzod mnyan par nus/ /
ji ltar bar snang tshon ris bri ba dang / / nam mkha'i dbyings la rlung gnas ji bzhin du/ / de ltar ye shes zag pa med pa yang / / shin tu lta dka' thub pas rnam par phye/ /
de la bdag gi sems ni 'di snyam byed/ / sangs rgyas ye shes dam pa bsam yas la/ / 'gro ba gang rnams dang bar byed dkon zhes/ / de yi phyir na ma smras ma bshad do/ /

Difficult, supreme is this, rare, the revelation of enlightening beings’ practice. Supreme is the discernment of the practices of the stages whence buddhahood is attained.
Subtle, hard to see, beyond thought, beyond the ground of mind, hard to approach, It is the realm of the wise with untainted minds, hearing which confuses the worldly.
Keeping the mind as stable as diamond, believe in the supremacy of buddha-knowledge: Knowing the mind-ground is selfless, then one can hear this subtle knowledge.
Like colors painted in the sky, like the wind in space— So is this undefiled knowledge of Buddha hard to see, though it be defined.
Such is my understanding of that — it’s hard to find anyone in the world who knows it, Or even believes in it — thus I cannot explain this ultimate.

de skad ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po la 'di skad ces smras so/ /
kye; rgyal ba'i sras / 'khor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'di dag la bsam pa shin tu sbyangs pa/ kun tu rtog pa yongs su sbyangs pa/ spyad par bya ba shin tu spyad pa/ tshogs shin tu bsags pa/ sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong shin tu bsnyen bkur ba/ yon tan dang ye shes tshad med pa dang ldan pa/ the tshom dang nem nur med pa/ nyon mongs pa dang / bral ba/ mos pa dang lhag pa'i bsam pa la rab tu gnas pa/ gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa sha stag tshogs pas yongs su dag pa yin gyi/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyis legs par bshad pa mdzod cig dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag thams cad ni rnam par 'di lta bu'i gnas zab mo la mngon sum du gnas pa sha stag go /

This having been said, the enlightening being Moon of Liberation said to Diamond Matrix, “Pure is this assembly that has gathered, enlightening beings with thoroughly purified aspiration, thoroughly purified will, who have done their work well, who have attended hundreds of thousands of billions of buddhas, who have thoroughly gathered the provisions for the Path, who have attained immeasurable knowledge and virtue, who are free from folly and confusion, free from affliction, impurity, and attachment, who are firm in determination and faith, whose undivided attention is on these buddhas’ teachings. Speak, therefore, for the enlightening beings directly witness this realm.”
de nas byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas don 'di nyid gsal bar bzlas pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po la tshigs su bcad de smras pa/

byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa bla med pa/ / sa rnams rab phye rnam dgod brtags pa yi/ / ye shes sbyong zhing byang chub 'thob byed pa/ / mchog dang dam pa zhi ba'i chos rnams shod/ /
'khor 'di dag pa nyon mongs med pa'i mchog / mos dang bsam pa shin tu sbyangs pa ste/ / sangs rgyas bye ba mang la spyod pa spyad/ / sa 'di brtag la yid ches ldan pa yin/ /

de nas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla ba la 'di skad ces smras so/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras/ 'khor 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos kyi rnam pa 'di lta bu'i gnas zab mo la bsam pa shin tu sbyangs pa/ kun tu rtog pa yongs su sbyangs pa/ spyod pa shin tu spyad pa; tshogs shin tu bsags pa/ sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong la dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu bsags pa/ yon tan dang ye shes tshad med pa dang ldan pa/ the tshom dang nem nur med pa/ nyon mongs pa dang bral ba/ mos pa dang lhag pa'i bsam pa la rab tu gnas pa/ gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa sha stag tshogs pas shin tu dag pa yang yin na/ 'on kyang sems can mos pa chung ngu gzhan dag gis zab mo'i rnam pa 'di lta bu bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas dag thos par gyur la/ thos nas kyang the tshom dang yid gnyis su gyur na; de dag la yun ring por gnod pa dang / don med pa dang / mi bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur bas/ 'di lta zhig tu snying brtse ba'i phyir/ bdag ni cang mi zer bar 'dug pa nyid du mos so/ /

Diamond Matrix said, “What though this assembly of enlightening beings is pure, with thoroughly purified aspirations and will, having done their work well, having well attended countless buddhas, having attained immeasurable virtue and knowledge, free from folly and delusion, undefiled, with well-established determination and zeal, with undivided attention on these teachings of buddhas, yet because of the lack of benefit and the suffering in the long night of ignorance for those others who would give rise to dissent and doubt upon hearing of such inconceivable states, it is out of compassion for them that I want to remain silent.”
de nas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos don 'di nyid gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /

'khor 'di rnam dag shes rab yangs pa ste/ / zab cing gsal ba'i spyod ldan rtogs shes shing / / gzhan dring mi 'jog ri rgyal bzhin mi g.yo/ / bsam rtog mi 'khrug rgya mtsho chen po 'dra/ /
'on kyang ma rtogs mi shes ma spyad pa/ / rnam shes yul gnas don la shes med pas/ / thos shing ma ches 'phral du ngan song lhung / / de dag snying brtses ye shes sa ma bshad/ /

de nas byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas/ yang byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po la gsol ba btab pa/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras/ legs par bshad pa mdzod cig dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyis rnam pa 'di lta bu bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas 'di dag kyang gzhan du mi 'gyur ba dang / legs par yid ches par 'gyur ro/ /
Then Moon of Liberation again asked Diamond Matrix for this doctrine: “Very well, explain by the power of the Enlightened—these inconceivable stations will be well protected and believed in.

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras/ don 'di ltar sa shin tu bstan pa 'di bshad pa'i tshe chos nyid rab tu thob pas/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang dgongs par 'gyur/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyang ye shes kyi sa 'di yongs su bsrung ba'i don du rab tu brtson par byed do/ /
Why? Because that naturally occurs when these stages are being explained: this is what all buddhas keep in mind, and all enlightening beings are intent on the protection of this knowledge.

de yang ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'di ni spyod pa'i sa dang po ste/ 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par 'grub pa'i gzhi yin no/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ yi ge dang 'bru 'grangs pa ji snyed du bstan pa de dag thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro ba'ang yi ge'i phyi mo'o/ / tha mar yang yi ge'i phyi mo la thug ste/ yi ge'i phyi mo bstan pas ma khyab pa de lta bu'i yi ge dang 'bru 'grangs pa bstan pa ni gang yang med do/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyang spyod pas rab tu 'grub pas sa sngon du 'gro'o/ / rang byung gi ye shes kyi mthar thug par 'gyur bas sa'i mthar thug pa'o/ / de bas na/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras/ shod cig dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyang yongs su bsrung ba'i phyir byin gyis rlob pa mdzad do/ /

Why? This is the fundamental practice, and this is the fulfillment of the Buddha teachings. It is like the instruction of combinations of letters — it begins and ends with the basic characters; there is nothing expressed by combinations of letters without indication of the basic characters. In the same way all the Buddha teachings are based on the stages and their practices are fulfilled thereby. The consummations of the stages lead to the attainment of the knowledge of the independent. Therefore speak; the realized ones, the saints, the perfectly enlightened ones will protect and support you.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas don 'di nyid gsal bar bzlas pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po la tshigs su bcad de smras pa/
sa dang spyod 'jug byang chub 'gyur ba ye shes sgrub byed pa/ / spyod pa rnam dag thams cad mkhyen pa'i sras kyis legs par shod/ / phyogs bcu'i rgyal ba bde gshegs kun mgon 'dren pa ji snyed pa/ / khyu mchog de kun ye shes 'byung gnas ston la dgongs pa mdzad/ /
'di ni dang po zhugs pa'i shes spyod 'di yi mthar thug ste/ rgyal ba'i ches rab gzhal yas ji snyed de dag 'byung gnas 'di/ / yi ge 'grangs pa'i phyi mo'i rjes 'gro sngon du de 'gro ltar/ / de bzhin sa mchog blo yi yul du tha ma thug par 'dod/ /
de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad kyis dbyangs kyi nga ro gcig tu glu'i dbyangs kyis tshigs su bcad de/ byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po la don 'di nyid kyi phyir gsol ba btab pa/
At this point those enlightening beings uttered verses in one voice asking Diamond Matrix for this teaching:

blo yangs dam pa'i phul mnga' ba/ / spobs pa mtha' yas rnam par dbye ba rtogs mkhyen pas/ / yid du 'ong ba'i gsung dbyangs kyis/ / kun la phan don dam pa bshad pa mdzod/ /
dran dang dga' bas spyod dag pa/ / stobs bcu'i stobs kyi shugs sogs yon tan ldan pa yi/ / sa yi dam pa mchog gi rnams/ / tha dad yang dag don mkhyen spyod pas shod/ /
zhi sdom bsgrub pa'i yid ldan pa/ / nga rgyal dregs dang lta ba'i nyon mongs zhir gyur pas/ / 'khor 'dir the tshom bral ba ste/ / khyod kyis legs par bshad du re zhing sdod/ /
skom pa bsil ba'i chu 'dod bzhin/ / bkres pa kha zas nad pa sman rab 'dod pa dang / / bung ba sbrang rtsi 'dod pa ltar/ / de bzhin 'khor 'di khyod kyi tshig la sdod/ /
de bas shin tu blo yangs pas/ / rdul med rnams la sa yi dam par 'jug pa shod/ / chags med stobs bcu'i tshogs gyur pa/ / bde gshegs spyod pa ma lus bshad par mdzod/ /

O ye of supreme wisdom and boundless eloquence, Speak the finest words, in accord with ultimate truth.
With recollection, steadfastness, pure knowledge, pure resolve to attain the ten powers, And discerning intellect, explain these ten supreme stages.
Tranquil, disciplined, with accumulated goodwill, free from afflictions, delusion, pride, and views, Free from doubt, this assembly hopes for your explanation.
As the thirsty desire cool water, the hungry food, the sick medicine, And bees honey, so does this assembly desire your words.
Therefore, ye of pure knowledge, speak of the exalted stages, free from taint, Joined to the ten powers, unobstructed, producing all good states.

At that time a radiance called “light of power of enlightening beings” emanated from the circle of hair between the eyebrows of Shakyamuni Buddha, accompanied by innumerable rays of light, illuminating all worlds in all ten directions, stopping all evils and suffering, eclipsing all realms of demons, illuminating the circles of innumerable buddhas, revealing the features, occult powers, and mystic transfigurations in the inconceivable realm of the buddhas, illuminating the enlightening beings empowered to teach in the circles of all buddhas in all worlds in the ten directions; having shown the inconceivable mystical power of the Buddha, it formed a great tower of networks of clouds of light up in the sky and remained there.
In the same way, lights called “light of power of enlightening beings” emanated from the circle of hair between the eyebrows of the other buddhas, accompanied by innumerable beams of light, illuminating all worlds in the ten directions, stopping all evils and suffering, eclipsing all realms of demons, illuminating the circles of innumerable buddhas, revealing the features, occult powers, and mystic transfigurations in the inconceivable realm of buddhas, illuminating the enlightening beings empowered to teach in the circles of all buddhas in all worlds in the ten directions; having revealed this inconceivable mystic power of buddhas, and having illuminated the circle of Shakyamuni Buddha and the body of the enlightening being Diamond Matrix, in the same way the beams formed a great tower of webs of clouds of light up in the sky and remained there.
Thus by means of the light beams emanated from the circle of hair between the eyebrows of Shakyamuni Buddha, those worlds and those circles of buddhas and the bodies and sitting places of their enlightening beings were clearly illumined. By the lights emanated by those other buddhas, this world system, the circle of Shakyamuni Buddha, and the body and sitting place of Diamond Matrix were seen clearly illumined.
de nas 'od zer stug po'i sprin gyi dra ba'i khang pa brtsegs pa chen po de dag nas sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis sgra'i rnam pa 'di lta bu 'di byung ngo/ /
Then, from the great tower of webs of clouds of light, by the power of the Buddha, this sound emerged:

mi mnyam mnyam dang mnyam pa mkha' dang mnyam pa dag / stobs bcu'i khyu mchog mthu ldan tshad med yon tan can/ / 'jig rten kun mchog mi yi dam pa phul gyi rnams/ / shAkya seng ge'i chos la byin rlabs dam pa mdzad/ /
bde gshegs sras po 'dren pa'i byin gyis bshad par gyis/ / chos rgyal khyu mchog rnams kyi mdzod kyi dam pa phye/ / sa yi ye shes rnam phye spyod mchog rab yangs pa; ; stobs bcu'i byin gyis ma thogs myur du bstan pa gyis/ /
gang gis rna lam bsam par chos dam rin chen 'di/ / song bar gyur pa de dag bde gshegs byin gyis brlabs/ / rdul med sa kun rim gyis rab tu rdzogs byas nas/ / stobs bcu ldan pa'i rgyal ba dam par 'grub par 'gyur/ /
rgya mtsho'i chu byung gyur cing bskal pa'i mes gdungs kyang / / gal te snod gyur sems can de dag 'di la nyan/ / gang rnams the tshom za zhing yid gnyis byed pa ni/ / de dag rna bas rnam pa kun tu thos mi 'gyur/ /
de phyir sa yi ye shes lam mchog bstan par gyis/ / gnas dang rgyud dang 'phro ba rim gyis rab tu shod/ / spyod dang yul dang chos dang ye shes tshul rnams kyi/ / chos kyi tshul yang 'gro ba kun la phan phyir shod/ /

By those with the ten powers, peerless, equal to space, with boundless virtues, By the teachings of Shakyamuni, by those beyond all men and gods, is this miraculous display made.
By the power of the buddhas, open the storehouse of the Kings of Truth And reveal the supreme practice and stages of knowledge distinctly.
Those who hear this supreme teaching will also be Empowered and supported by the buddhas and enlightening beings,
Who will cause them to attain buddhahood once they attain the ten powers, After having gradually fulfilled the undefiled ten stages.
Even sunk in the ocean or thrown into the holocaust, They will be able to hear this teaching, without doubt.
But those stuck to folly, suspicious and unreceptive, Will never get to hear it.
The path of knowledge of the stages, supreme, from entry, station, and attainment, Please explain in order, including the practice and sphere of action.
de nas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos phyogs bcur bltas nas 'khor thams cad de bas kyang dad par bya ba'i phyir/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so; ;
Then Diamond Matrix, looking over the ten directions, in order to increase the purity of this assembly, at this juncture spoke these verses:

phra la shes dka' drang srong chen po'i lam/ / mi rtog rtog yul ma yin blta bar dka'/ / rang bzhin zhi zhing 'gag med 'byung ba med/ / mkhas gsal shes pas khong du chud pa yin/ /
ngo bo nyid stong zhi zhing sdug bsngal zad/ / rgyud las rnam grol mnyam par mya ngan 'das/ / mtha' dang dbus med tshig gis brjod du med/ / dus gsum grol ba nam mkha' 'dra zhing mtshungs/ /
bde gshegs spyod yul zhi zhing nye bar zhi/ / smra ba'i lam rnams kun gyis brjod par dka'/ / de dag sa dang spyod pa de 'dra bas/ / smra bar dka' na bstan par ga la nus/ /
de ni bsam yas sems lam rnam par spangs/ / ye shes mngon bsgrubs rgyal ba'i spyod yul te/ / phung po skye mched khams kyis bskyed pa min/ / sems kyis mi shes yid kyis rnam ma brtags/ /
ji ltar bar snang gnas kyi bya yi rjes/ / shin tu smra dka' bstan par mi nus pa/ / de ltar bde gshegs sras kyi sa rnams kyang / / yid dang sems kyi yul gyis shes mi nus/ /
'on kyang byams dang snying rje'i smon lam gyis/ / de las phyogs tsam rim pa'i tshul bzhin du/ / bshad par bya ste sems kyi spyod yul min/ / ye shes tshul gyis rdzogs par bya ba'o/ /
de 'dra'i spyod yul phra zhing blta dka' ba/ / rang rig yin pas brjod par ma nus kyang / / 'on kyang bde bar gshegs pa'i mthus brjod kyi/ / thams cad mthun par nan tan gyis te nyon/ /
ye shes sa dang spyod 'jug ci 'dra ba/ / bskal pa bye bar zad par mi nus te/ / yang dag don dngos gzhan min gnas pa las/ / mdo tsam bshad kyi de dag mnyan par gyis/ /
mthun zhing nan tan yod par sta gon gnas/ / bde gshegs byin gyis bdag gis bshad par bya/ / dpe ldan 'thad la yi ge mnyam pa yi; ; chos sgra dam pa bdag gis brjod par bya/ /
'di ni tshig gis brjod par shin tu dka'/ / de ltar tshad med bde gshegs mthu dag las/ / chu thigs gcig 'dra bdag gi lus 'di la; ; de ring zhugs kyi bshad pa mnyan par gyis/ /

Subtle and hard to know is the path of the great sages, Nonconceptual, beyond conception, most difficult to contact. It is pure, known only to the wise, Its nature is quiescent, without extinction or origination. Inherently empty, utterly tranquil, nondual, inexhaustible, Liberated from all states, impartially reaching nirvana, Without extremes or mean, not expressed by words, Outside of time, like the sky, Quiescent, ultimately silent, realized by the enlightened, Most difficult to express by any manner of speaking: Such are the stages and their practice— Most difficult to speak of, more difficult to hear.
Beyond thought and the path of mind, Elicited by knowledge, realized by the highest sages, Not revealed by the elements of matter and sense, Unattainable by mind, intellectually inconceivable: Just as the tracks of a bird in the sky Cannot be described or seen even by the enlightened, In the same way all the stages Cannot be told of, much less heard.
I will tell just the beginning, then, Out of kindness, compassion, commitment: I will tell of them in order; yet not by spheres of thought But by knowledge are they to be fulfilled as one wishes.
Such a realm is hard to see, impossible to tell of— It just rests in one’s own mind; But I will speak out by the power of Buddha— It should be heard with concentration and respect.
This entry of knowledge, being as such, Cannot be explained even in eons: I will now give a summary, According to the meaning of the teaching as it is.
Attend respectfully, blessed ones; I will speak by the power of Buddha. I will utter the voice of the highest teaching, In appropriate words, with examples.
Though it is difficult to express in speech, Yet mine is the power to do so, By the immeasurable power of Buddha and the power of the body of light That have entered into me.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de la sems can dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu bsags pa/ spyad pa shin tu spyod pa/ tshogs shin tu bsags pa; ; sangs rgyas byung ba shin tu bsnyen bkur ba/ chos dkar po shin tu bsdus pa/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis shin tu bzung ba/ bsam pa yongs su dag pa/ lhag pa'i bsam pa shin tu rgya chen po can/ mos pa rgya chen po dang ldan pa/ snying rje dang snying brtse ba mngon du gyur pa/ sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la mngon par mos pa rnams rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la mos pa dang / stobs bcu'i stobs thob par bya ba dang / mi 'jigs pa chen po thob par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos mnyam pa nyid thob par bya ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab par bya ba dang / snying brtse ba dang snying rje chen po yongs su dag par bya ba dang / phyogs bcu ma lus par thogs pa med pa'i ye shes mngon du 'gyur ba bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma lus pa thams cad thogs pa med par yongs su sbyang bar bya ba dang / dus gsum thams cad skad cig gcig gis khong du chud par bya ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo chen po rab tu bskor ba la khyu mchog gi mthu dbyung ba rgya chen po thob par bya ba'i phyir/

“Now then, in beings who have well-developed roots of goodness, who have done their tasks well, who have accumulated provisions for the Path, who have attended buddhas in the world, who have consolidated pure practices, who are in the care of spiritual friends, who have thoroughly purified their intentions, who have great determination, who are endowed with supreme zeal, and who actualize pity and compassion, the aspiration for enlightenment is aroused, for the quest of enlightened knowledge, for the attainment of the ten powers, for the atttainment of great expertise, for the attainment of the enlightened quality of impartiality, for the salvation of all beings, for the purification of great mercy and compassion, for the attainment of knowledge of all in the ten directions, for the unobstructed purification of all buddha-lands, for awareness of past, present, and future in a single instant, and for expertise in turning the wheel of the great Teaching.

byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba/ shes rab dang ye shes kyi dbang du gyur pa/ thabs mkhas pas yongs su bzung ba/ bsam pa dang lhag pa'i bsam pas rab tu brtan pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs tshad med pa dang ldan pa/ sems can gyi stobs dang / blo'i stobs rnam par dbye bar bya ba/ shin tu rnam par phye ba/ chags pa med pa'i ye shes mngon du gyur pa/ rang byung gi ye shes dang mthun pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos la shes rab dang / ye shes kyi man ngag yang dag par tshol ba/ sangs rgyas byung ba thams cad las gdams ngag yang dag par blangs pa/ chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i mthar thug par gnas pa/ phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug par skye bar 'gyur te/

“This intention of enlightening beings, furthermore, is aroused and guided by great compassion, controlled by wisdom and knowledge, sustained by skill in means, stabilized by will and determination, immeasurable as the power of buddhas, clearly distinguishing the power of sentient beings and the power of Buddha, focused on unfragmented knowledge, in accord with spontaneous knowledge, completely receptive to the guidance of wisdom and knowledge of all Buddha teachings; it is as ultimate as the cosmos, as enduring as space, abiding forever.

sems bskyed pa de bskyed ma thag tu/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po so so'i skye bo'i sa las rab tu 'das pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa shin tu non pa yin/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin/ rigs brjod pa la kha na ma tho ba med pa yin/ 'jig rten gyi lam thams cad las phyir log pa yin/ 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam shin tu non pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dgod pa la rab tu gnas pa yin/ dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi rjes su song ba yin/ rdzogs pa'i byang chub la shin tu gzhol bas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su nges pa yin/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /chos kyi rnam pa 'di lta bu la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba la mi g.yo ba'i tshul gyis rab tu gnas so/ /

“With this arousing of the mind the enlightening being is beyond the stage of mundane beings, has entered the rank of enlightening beings, is born in the family of the enlightened, cannot be slandered by any racial slur, has left all mundane paths and has entered the transmundane Path, is stationed in the reality of enlightened beings, is properly established in the abode of enlightening beings, has attained equanimity, is established in the lineage of buddhas of past, present, and future, certain to become perfectly enlightened. Established in these things, the enlightening being is established in the first stage of enlightening beings, that of Extreme Joy, by attainment of imperturbability.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag / de la byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rab tu dga' ba mang ba yin/ yid bde ba mang ba yin/ mos pa mang ba yin/ rangs pa mang ba yin/ mgu ba mang ba yin/ spro ba mang ba yin/ 'tshe ba med pa mang ba yin/ khro ba med pa mang ba yin/

“Here, standing on the stage of Extreme Joy of enlightening beings, one is filled with extreme joy, filled with calm, filled with happiness, filled with ebullience, filled with exaltation, filled with delight, greatly invigorated, most uncontentious, most harmless, and free from anger.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams rjes su dran zhing rab tu dga' ba yin/ sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams rjes su dran zhing rab tu dga' ba yin/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams rjes su dran zhing rab tu dga' ba yin/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rjes su dran zhing rab tu dga' ba yin/ pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa rjes su dran zhing rab tu dga' ba yin/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i khyad par rjes su dran zhing rab tu dga' ba yin/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul mi 'phrogs pa rjes su dran zhing rab tu dga' ba yin/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdams ngag dang lung rjes su dran zhing rab tu dga' ba yin/ sems can gyi don rab tu thob par bya ba rjes su dran zhing rab tu dga' ba yin/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes la 'jug pa'i thabs rjes su dran zhing rab tu dga' ba yin/ yang de 'di snyam du sems te; bdag ni 'gro ba thams cad kyi yul las phyir log go zhes rab tu dga' ba bskyed do/ / bdag ni sangs rgyas kyi sa dang nye bar gyur to zhes rab tu dga' ba bskyed do/ / bdag ni byis pa'i sa las ring du gyur to zhes rab tu dga' ba bskyed do/ / bdag ni ye shes kyi sa dang nye bar gyur to zhes rab tu dga' ba bskyed do/ / bdag ni ngan song dang ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pa thams cad rgyun chad do zhes rab tu dga' ba bskyed do/ / bdag ni sems can thams cad kyi gnas su gyur to zhes rab tu dga' ba bskyed do/ / bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ba dang nye bar gyur to zhes rab tu dga' ba bskyed do/ / bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yul la yang dag par 'byung ngo zhes rab tu dga' ba bskyed do/ / bdag ni byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid dang ldan par gyur to zhes rab tu dga' ba bskyed do/ / bdag ni 'jigs pa dang / bag tsha ba dang / dngangs pa dang / skyi g.ya' ba thams cad dang bral lo zhes rab tu dga' ba bskyed do/ /

“Thus is the enlightening being extremely joyful when stationed in the enlightening beings’ stage of joy; one becomes extremely joyful thinking of the buddhas, of the Buddha teachings, of the enlightening beings, of the practices of enlightening beings, of the purification of the transcendent ways, of the eminence of the stages of enlightening beings, of the indestructibility of enlightening beings, of the teachings of the buddhas, and of the ability to benefit beings; and, thinking of the means of entry into the knowledge of all buddhas, the enlightening being is imbued with extreme joy. ‘Detached am I from all mundane objects; I have entered the vicinity of buddhahood; I have left behind the stage of infantile ignorance and drawn near to the stage of knowledge; I am cut off from all evil and states of misery; I am a refuge for all beings; I am near to the vision of all buddhas; I am born in the realm of all buddhas; I have reached equality to all enlightening beings; gone from me are all fears and terrors’—thus thinking, the enlightening being gives rise to extreme joy.

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba'di thob ma thag tu 'jigs pa'i rnam pa 'di dag 'di lta ste/ 'tsho ba med pas 'jigs pa'am/ mi bsngags pas 'jigs pa'am/ 'chi bas 'jigs pa'am/ ngan song gis 'jigs pa'am/ 'khor du bag tsha bas 'jigs pa de dag thams cad de la med pa yin/

Why? Because that is what happens to all fears with the enlightening being’s attainment of the stage of joy—fears such as fear of not surviving, fear of ill repute, fear of death, fear of states of misery fear of intimidation by groups—all these fears leave.

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'di ltar de ni bdag gi 'du shes dang bral bas/ de la bdag phangs par sems pa'ang med na/ yo byad thams cad la phangs par sems ba lta ga la yod de/ de'i phyir de la 'tsho ba med pas 'jigs pa med do/ / de ni su las kyang rim gror bya ba cung zad tsam yang re ba med la/ gzhan du na bdag nyid kyis sems can de dag la yo byad mang po thams cad kyis bstud par bya'o snyam du sems pas de'i phyir de la mi bsngags pa'i 'jigs pa med do/ / de bdag tu lta ba dang bral bas de la bdag gi 'du shes med de/ de'i phyir de la 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa med do/ / bdag shi nas kyang gdon mi za bar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dag dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur ro zhes de'i phyir de la ngan song gis 'jigs pa med do/ / de 'di snyam du sems te/ bdag gi bsam pa dang 'jig rten na mtshungs pa'ang su yang med na/ lhag pa lta ga la yod ces de'i phyir de la 'khor du bag tsha ba med do/ /

Why is that? Inasmuch as the very concept of self is gone, there is no self-love, much less any love for material things; therefore there is no fear of not surviving. One does not seek any honor from anyone, but rather thinks one should provide others with sufficient means of subsistence, therefore there is no fear of ill repute. And because one has no view of self, one has no concept of self and therefore no fear of dying. Thinking that when one is dead, one will certainly not be separated from the buddhas and enlightening beings, one therefore has no fear of states of misery. Thinking that there is no aspiration in any world equal to, much less greater than, one’s own aspiration for enlightenment, there is no fear of intimidation by groups. Thus all fears and terrors are removed.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de ltar 'jigs pa dang / dngangs pa dang / bag tsha ba dang / skyi g.ya' ba med pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro bas lhag pa'i bsam pa ma nyams shing mi dma' bas de bas kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par bsdu ba'i phyir rab tu brtson par byed do/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de dad pa la dbang sgyur ba dang / mos pa mang ba dang / yid ches pa shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / rtog pa mang ba dang / snying brtse ba dang / snying rjes mngon par sgrub pa dang / byams pa chen po dang ldan pa dang / yid skyo ba med pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa'i rgyan dang / bzod cing nges pa dang ldan pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi bstan pa la rim gro dang / bkur sti dang / ri mo yod pa dang / nyin mtshan du mi ngoms par dge ba'i rtsa ba gsog pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsten pa dang / chos kyi dga' bas dga' bar gnas pa dang / mi ngoms par mang du thos pa tshol ba dang / ji skad du thos pa'i chos la tshul bzhin du rtog pa dang / gnas med pa'i yid dang / 'thob pa dang / bkur sti dang / bsngags pa la chags pa med pa dang / yo byad thams cad la phangs par sems shing chags pa med pa dang / sems bskyed pa rin po che lta bus ngoms pa med par mngon par bsgrub pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sa la mngon par mos pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs yongs su tshol ba dang / sgyu dang g.yo yongs su spangs pa dang / ji skad du smras pa de ltar byed pa dang / rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par bden pa'i tshig gi rjes su srung ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la skyon du 'gyur bar mi byed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa mi gtong pa dang / ri'i dbang po'i rgyal po che po ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems mi sgul ba dang / 'jig rten gyi bya ba thams cad la mngon par dga' ba med pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i lam dang ldan pa dang / mi ngoms par byang chub kyi yan lag gi tshogs rab tu bsags pa dang / rtag tu rgyun mi chad par gong nas gong du khyad par du 'bogs pa'i lam tshol ba dang /

“Furthermore, the enlightening being, due to having made great compassion foremost, strives all the more with an indestructible, extraordinary will, for the fulfillment of all roots of goodness, by mastery of perfect faith, by purity of intention, by wealth of true understanding, by having developed mercy and compassion, by having attained great kindness, by indefatigability of mind, by adornment with conscience, by attainment of joy in tolerance, by honor and respect for the teachings of the completely enlightened, by tireless collection of roots of goodness night and day, by service to good spiritual friends, by enjoyment of true teaching, by insatiable search for learning, by correct contemplation of the teachings as they are heard, by mental nonattachment, by absence of craving for gain, honor, or fame, by absence of desire for goods, by tireless production of a jewel-like mind, by seeking the stage of omniscience, by concentration on the powers, expertise, and unique buddha-qualities of all enlightened ones, by unattached seeking of the transcendent ways, by abandonment of all deception and dishonesty, by acting in accord with one’s words, by constant preservation of truthful speech, by not allowing the family of the enlightened to die out, by not abandoning the teachings of enlightening beings, by mountainlike imperturbability of mind, by discerning knowledge of all mundane doings, by attainment of the transmundane path of relinquishment, by constant seeking of the supreme ultimate.

sa yongs su sbyong ba'i chos kyi rnam pa 'di lta bu dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa yin te/ de byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba de la shin tu gnas shing / rnam pa 'di lta bu'i smon lam chen po dang / brtson pa chen po dang / mngon par bsgrub pa chen po 'di dag mngon par sgrub ste/ 'di ltar sangs rgyas thams cad ma lus pa lhag ma med pa mtha' dag la mchod cing rim gro bya ba'i phyir/ rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa/ mos pa rgya chen pos rnam par dag pa/ chos kyi dbyings kyis klas par rgya che ba/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthar thug pa/ phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa bskal pa 'grangs pa thams cad du sangs rgyas skye ba 'grangs pa la rim gro dang / mchod pa chen po bya ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i smon lam chen po mngon par sgrub bo/ / 'di lta ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsungs pa'i chos kyi tshul yang dag par gzung ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub yang dag par blang ba dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bstan pa yang dag par bsrung ba'i phyir/ chos kyi dbyings kyis klas par rgya che ba nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthar thug pa/ phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa/ bskal pa 'grangs pa thams cad kyi sangs rgyas 'byung ba 'grangs pa'i dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i smon lam chen po mngon par sgrub bo/ / 'di lta ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa thams cad ma lus pa'i sangs rgyas skye ba thams cad kyi dga' ldan gyi pho brang dam pa na bzhugs pa la sogs te/ 'pho ba dang / gshegs pa dang / dku na bzhugs pa dang / skye ba dang / gzhon nu'i rol pa dang / btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang na bzhugs pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang / dka' ba spyad pa dang / snying po byang chub tu gshegs pa dang / bdud gdul ba dang / mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dang / gsol ba gdab pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo chen po bskor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ston pa'i drung du 'gro zhing mchod pa dang / rim gro bya ba dang / dam pa'i chos yang dag par gzung ba'i sbyor ba la sogs pa thams cad dus gcig tu mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir/ chos kyi dbyings kyi klas par rgya che ba/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthar thug pa/ phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa bskal pa 'grangs pa thams cad du sangs rgyas 'byung ba 'grangs pa'i drung du 'gro ba nas/ mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i bar gyi drung du 'gro ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i smon lam chen po mngon par sgrub bo/ / 'di lta ste/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgya chen po shin tu yangs pa/ tshad med pa/ mi 'phrogs pa/ tha mi dad pa/ pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyis yang dag par bsdus pa/ sa yongs su sbyang ba'i yan lag dang / nye ba'i yan lag tu bcas pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang / mtshan nyid dang / bye brag gi mtshan nyid du bcas pa dang / 'grub pa dang / 'jig pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod par gtogs pa thams cad dang / sa ji lta ba bzhin dang / ji lta bur bstan pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyang ba la gdams ngag dang / man ngag sbyin pas nye bar brtan pa'i sems bskyed pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir/ chos kyi dbyings kyis klas par rgya che ba/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthar thug pa/ phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa bskal pa 'grangs pa thams cad du spyod pa 'grangs pa sems bskyed pas mngon par bsgrub pa/ rgyun mi 'chad pa'i smon lam chen po mngon par sgrub bo/ / 'di lta ste/ sems can gyi khams thams cad ma lus pa/ lhag ma med pa mtha' dag gzugs yod pa dang / gzugs med pa dang / 'du shes yod pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang / 'du shes yod pa'ang ma yin pa dang / 'du shes med pa'ang ma yin pa dang / sgo nga las skyes pa dang / mngal nas skyes pa dang / drod gsher las skyes pa dang / rdzus te byung ba khams gsum du gtogs pa/ 'gro ba drug tu 'dus pa/ skye ba thams cad du gtogs pa'i sems can gyi khams thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos la gzud pa dang / lam gyi rgyud 'grangs pa thams cad rgyun gcad pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la dgod pa'i phyir/ chos kyi dbyings kyis klas par rgya che ba/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthar thug pa/ phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa/ bskal pa 'grangs pa thams cad dang / sems can 'grangs pa thams cad du sems can gyi khams yongs su smin par bya ba la rgyun mi 'chang pa'i smon lam chen po mngon par sgrub bo/ / 'di lta ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams yangs pa dang / dogs pa dang / rgya chen po dang / tshad med pa dang / phra ba dang / che ba dang / snrel zhi dang / spyi'u tshugs su rgyu ba thams cad ma lus pa lhag ma med pa/ mtha' dag gzhi mnyam par yang dag par 'jug pa khong du chud par bya ba dang / mig 'phrul gyi rnam pa ltar phyogs bcu'i rnam pa tha dad pa ma lus pa'i rnam pa la 'jug pa/ rnam par phye ba'i ye shes khong du chud cing / mngon du 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings kyis klas par rgya che ba/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthar thug pa/ phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa/ bskal pa 'grangs pa thams cad du 'jig rten gyi khams 'grangs par 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad la 'jug cing / yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir/ smon lam chen po mngon par sgrub bo/ / 'di lta ste/ zhing thams cad zhing gcig tu yang dag par gzhol bar bya ba dang / zhing gcig zhing thams cad du yang dag par gzhol bar bya ba dang / yongs su sbyang ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing tshad med pa 'od mang po'i rgyan gyis rab tu brgyan par bya ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad bsal bas yongs su dag pa'i lam dang ldan pa dang / sems can ye shes kyi 'byung gnas tshad med pas yongs su gang ba'i sangs rgyas kyi yul rgya chen po la yang dag par gzhol zhing khong du chud par bya ba dang / bsam pa'i tshul bzhin du sems can rnams la yang dag par bstan cing shin tu tshim par bya ba'i phyir/ chos kyi dbyings kyis klas par rgya che ba/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthar thug pa/ phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa/ bskal pa 'grangs pa thams cad du zhing 'grangs par sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba la rgyun mi 'chad pa'i smon lam chen po mngon par sgrub bo/ / 'di lta ste/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang bsam pa gcig pa'i sbyor ba dang / ltod pa med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bsags pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang dmigs pa gcig cing mnyam pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par 'grogs shing mi 'bral ba dang / sangs rgyas 'byung ba ci dgar bstan pa dang / rang gi sems bskyed pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yul dang / mthu dang / ye shes khong du chud par bya ba dang / ma nyams shing rjes su 'brang ba'i mngon par shes pa rab tu thob par bya ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rnam par rgyu bar bya ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du gzugs brnyan 'byung ba yang dag par bstan pa dang / skye ba'i skye gnas thams cad du rang gi lus rjes su 'gro bar bya ba dang / theg pa chen po bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad spyad pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings kyis klas par rgya che ba/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthar thug pa; phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa/ bskal pa 'grangs pa thams cad du spyod pa 'grangs par theg pa chen po mngon par bsgrub pa la rgyun mi 'chad pa'i smon lam chen po mngon par sgrub bo/ / 'di lta ste/ phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo la yang dag par gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad pa dang / lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las don yod par bya ba dang / mthong ma thag tu sangs rgyas kyi chos gdon mi za bar thob par bya ba dang / dbyangs brjod ma thag tu ye shes khong du chud par bya ba dang / dad par gyur ma thag tu nyon mongs pa phyir mi ldog par bya ba dang / bsam pa sman gyi rgyal po chen po lta bur rab tu thob par bya ba dang / lus yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu thob par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa thams cad spyad pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings kyis klas par rgya che ba/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthar thug pa/ phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa/ bskal pa 'grangs pa thams cad du phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo 'grangs par spyod pa thams cad 'bras bu yod pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i smon lam chen po mngon par sgrub bo/ / 'di lta ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dang / skra'i sbubs gcig dang tha mi dad pa'i skra'i sbubs thams cad du tshe dang / skye ba dang / gzhon nu rol pa dang / btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang na bzhugs pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang / rnam par 'phrul pa dang / snying po byang chub tu gshegs pa dang / bdud 'dul ba dang / mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dang / gsol ba gdab pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo chen po bskor ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba chen po bstan pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi yul dang mthu dang ye shes chen po khong du chud par bya ba dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang / skad cig gcig tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dang / rab tu zhi ba thob par bya ba yang dag par bstan pa dang / mngon par 'tshang rgya ba gcig gis chos kyi dbyings thams cad 'phrul bas rgyas par dgang ba dang / dbyangs gcig brjod pas sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi sems dang / bsam pa shin tu tshim par bya ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa chen po yongs su bstan pa dang / spyod pa rnams rgyun mi 'chad par bya ba dang / theg pa chen po'i sa la chos thams cad rnam par dgod pa yang dag par bstan pa dang / chos shes pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi sgyu dang / mngon par shes pa dang / dbang gis chos kyi dbyings thams cad sprul bas rnam par dgang ba'i phyir/ chos kyi dbyings kyis klas par rgya che ba/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthar thug pa/ phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa/ bskal ba 'grangs pa thams cad du mngon par 'tshang rgya ba 'grangs par ye shes chen po'i mngon par shes pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i smon lam chen po mngon par sgrub bo/ /

“Imbued with these ways of purifying the stages, enlightening beings are well established in the stage of Extreme Joy. Once established in this stage, enlightening beings undertake great vows, great resolutions, great undertakings such as the following: They undertake a first great vow to make offerings to each and every buddha, in the best of forms, with the highest purity of faith, as extensively as the cosmos, to the furthest reaches of space, throughout all time. They undertake a second great vow to maintain the eye of the teachings spoken by all buddhas, to associate with all buddhas and enlightening beings, to preserve the teachings of all complete buddhas, to take in all truths, to the extent of the cosmos, to the furthest reaches of space, throughout all time, without ceasing, in all eons for as many buddhas as appear in the world. They undertake a third great vow to go to all places in all worlds where buddhas appear—from their existence in the heaven of satisfaction, descending into the human world, entry into the womb, abiding in the womb, birth, youthful enjoyments, married life, renunciation, practice of austerities, conquering demons, enlightenment, being requested to teach, setting the wheel of the great teaching in motion, and entry into great absolute nirvana—to go to all places at once, taking the lead in making offerings, receiving the teaching, and applying it in practice, to the extent of the cosmos, to the farthest reaches of space, throughout all time, without ceasing in all eons for as many buddhas as appear in the world, until the attainment of great absolute nirvana. They undertake a fourth vow to bring forth the determination to disseminate instruction in the accomplishment of means of purification of the ways of transcendence, accurate explanation of the path of the stages, the practices of all enlightening beings, bringing forth their total and particular aspects, with consideration of their common and distinctive features, as they are formed and dissolved, the many extensive immeasurable holistic practices of all buddhas and enlightening beings contained in the ways of transcendence, purifying all the stages of enlightening beings, vowing to call forth this aspiration to the extent of the cosmos, to the furthest reaches of space, throughout all time. They undertake a fifth great vow to fully develop all beings, corporeal or immaterial, thinking, nonthinking, or neither, born of eggs, wombs, moisture, or spontaneously, in all realms contained in the worlds of desire, forms, and formlessness, bound to the six paths of mundane existence in all places of birth, caught up in names and forms—to develop them to lead them into the Buddha teaching, to free them from all mundane groupings, to establish them in omniscience, to develop and mature all beings forever, to the extent of the cosmos, throughout the reaches of space, for all time, for as many eons and beings as there be. They undertake a sixth great vow for direct knowledge of the innumerable distinctions in all the worlds of the ten directions, variously reflecting one another, subtle and gross, upside-down, inverted, and upright, their appearance and consolidation—they vow to comprehend the distinctions of worlds, to the extent of the cosmos, throughout the reaches of space, for all time. They undertake a seventh great vow, to show all beings the purification of all lands in one land and one land in all lands, the adornment of innumerable buddha-lands with arrays of light, entering into the supreme realm of buddhas from which all afflictions are removed, completely purified and filled with wise beings, showing this to all beings to please them in accord with their mentalities, vowing to thoroughly purify all buddha-lands, to the extent of the cosmos, to the farthest reaches of space, throughout all time, unceasing for as many eons and buddha-lands as there may be. They undertake an eighth great vow, to work with the same one determination as all enlightening beings, to build up roots of goodness without opposition, to be equally focused on the same one object as all enlightening beings, to be in concert with all enlightening beings, to manifest appearances of Buddha as desired, to attain the knowledge of the powers of the Enlightened at will, to attain ever-present mystic knowledge, to travel to all worlds, to appear in the circles of all buddhas, to adapt to all situations, to attain realization of the inconceivable great vehicle, to continue to carry out the practices of enlightening beings, vowing to enter the great vehicle, to the extent of the cosmos, to the furthest reaches of space, throughout all time, unceasing for as many eons and practices as there may be. They undertake a ninth great vow to carry out the practice of enlightening beings, riding on the wheel that never rolls backward, by means of fruitful words, thoughts, and deeds, so that those who see them will surely realize buddhahood, those who hear what they say will attain knowledge, and so that those who have pure faith will be freed from afflictions—they vow to attain a state like a master physician, to attain embodiment of magical fulfillment of aspirations, to carry out the practices of enlightening beings as extensively as the cosmos, to the farthest reaches of space, throughout all time, unceasing for as many eons and as many practices as there be, that their deeds not be in vain. They undertake a tenth great vow, to awaken completely to unexcelled perfect enlightenment in all worlds, to show at every point—without leaving one place—birth, leaving home, transfiguration, austere practice, conquering demons, sitting at the pinnacle of enlightenment, turning the wheel of the teaching, and final absolute nirvana, to attain the knowledge of power of the vast realm of buddhahood and in each instant show all sentient beings the emergence of a buddha in accordance with their mentalities so that they may attain enlightenment and perfect peace, to universally realize the nirvana of all phenomena by one pefect enlightenment, to please all beings according to their mentalities with a single utterance, to show great ultimate nirvana without cutting off the power of practice, to show the construction of all teachings of the stages of great knowledge, to pervade all worlds by the mystic power of the knowledge of truth and the mystic knowledge of illusoriness, vowing to bring forth great knowledge to the extent of the cosmos, to the farthest reaches of space, throughout all time, never ceasing for all eons, for all true enlightenments.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de ltar rnam pa 'di lta bu'i smon lam chen po dang / brtson 'grus chen po dang / mngon par bsgrub pa chen po'i smon lam gyi sgo bcu po 'di dag la sogs pa/ smon lam brgya stong grangs med pa phrag bcu tshang ba dag /byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas thob bo/ / mngon par sgrub bo/ / smon lam de dag kyang mthar thug pa'i gnas bcus mngon par sgrub ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ sems can gyi khams kyi mthar thug pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mthar thug pa dang / nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar thug pa dang / chos kyi khams kyi mthar thug pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i khams kyi mthar thug pa dang / sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i khams kyi mthar thug pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi khams kyi mthar thug pa dang / sems kyi dmigs pa'i khams kyi mthar thug pa dang / ye shes mngon par bsgrub pa'i khams kyi mthar thug pa dang / 'jig rten gyi rgyud dang / chos kyi rgyud dang / ye shes kyi rgyud kyi khams kyi mthar thug pa dag go/ //

“Thus, having brought to the fore such great aspirations, great purposes, great undertakings, through ten great vows, enlightening beings stationed in the stage of Extreme Joy undertake countless consummate vows, which they undertake in ten ultimate terms: that is, to the ultimate extent of living beings, to the ultimate extent of worlds, to the ultimate extent of space, to the ultimate extent of the cosmos, to the ultimate extent of the realm of nirvana, to the ultimate extent of the emergence of buddhas, to the ultimate extent of enlightened knowledge, to the ultimate extent of realms of mental objects, to the ultimate extent of entries of knowledge into the sphere of buddhas, to the ultimate extent of the courses of worlds, the courses of teachings, and the courses of knowledge.
bam po bzhi bcu drug pa/

de ltar smon lam chen po 'di dag sems can gyi khams kyi mtha' gang du thug pa de'i mthar thug par gyur cig /smon lam chen po 'di dag 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mtha' gang du thug pa dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i khams dang / sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i khams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi khams dang / sems can gyi dmigs pa'i khams dang / ye shes mngon par bsgrub pa'i khams dang / 'jig rten gyi rgyud dang / chos kyi rgyud dang / ye shes kyi rgyud kyi khams kyi mtha' gang du thug pa de'i mthar thug par gyur cig /'di ltar sems can gyi khams mthar thug pa med pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i khams dang / sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i khams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi khams dang / sems kyi dmigs pa'i khams dang / ye shes mngon par bsgrub pa'i khams dang / 'jig rten gyi rgyud dang / chos kyi rgyud dang / ye shes kyi rgyud kyi khams mthar thug pa med pa de bzhin du smon lam chen po 'di dag kyang mthar thug pa med par gyur te/ bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di dag kyang mthar thug pa med par gyur cig /ces de ltar smon lam shin tu bsgrubs shing / phan pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ 'jam pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ las su rung ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ zhi ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ dul ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ nye bar zhi ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ gnyen pa'i sems dang
