ldan pa/ byams pa'i sems dang ldan pa; 'khrugs pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ glong ba med pa'i sems dang ldan pa de ni legs par rtog pa mang zhing dad pa dang ldan pa yin te/ de ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi sngon gyi mtha'i spyod pa mngon par bsgrubs pa'i rgyud la yid ches pa yin/ pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par bsdu ba la yid ches pa yin/ sa yang dag par bsgrub pa dang / khyad par du 'gyur ba la mngon par yid ches pa yin/ stobs yongs su 'grub pa la mngon par yid ches pa yin/ mi 'jigs pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba la mngon par yid ches pa yin/ sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa mi 'phrogs pa la mngon par yid ches pa yin/ sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa la mngon par yid ches pa yin/ sangs rgyas kyi yul mtha' dang dbus med pa mngon par bsgrub pa la mngon par yid ches pa yin/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul tshad med pa'i rjes su song ba'i rjes su 'jug pa la mngon par yid ches pa yin/ 'bras bu yongs su grub pa la mngon par yid ches pa yin/ mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa sa dang / ye shes kyi bar du shin tu bstan pa'i byin gyi rlabs la mngon par yid ches pa yin no/ / yang de 'di snyam du sems te/ sangs rgyas kyi chos 'di dag de ltar rgya che zhing de ltar zab la de ltar dben zhing de ltar zhi ba ste/ de ltar stong la de ltar mtshan ma med cing / de ltar smon pa med la/ de ltar chags pa med de/ de ltar gos pa med cing / de ltar tshad med la/ sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag de ltar rlabs che na 'on kyang byis pa so so'i skye bo 'di dag lta ba ngan par lhung ba'i rgyud dang / ma rig pa'i mun nag dang / rab rib kyi thibs pos kun nas khebs pa'i yid dang / nga rgyal gyi rgyal mtshan shin tu bsgreng ba'i yongs su rtog pa dang / sred pa'i dra bas mngon par ye rngam pa'i yid la bya ba dang / sgyu dang g.yo'i thibs po la rjes su spyod pa'i sems dang / bsam pa dang / phrag dog dang / 'jungs pa can gyi kun nas 'khor bas lam gyi rgyud du skye ba'i kun tu 'brel ba dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la spyod pa'i las shin tu bsags pa dang / khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pas 'bar ba byas pa'i sems kyi me lce dang / phyin ci log dang bcas pa'i las mngon par bsgrub pa dang / 'dod pa dang / srid pa'i ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / kun tu zag pa'i bag chags mtshams 'brel ba'i sems dang / yid dang rnam par shes pa'i sa bon gyis 'di lta ste/ khams gsum du ming dang gzugs lhan cig tu skyes shing tha mi dad par byung ba'i yang skye ba'i sdug bsngal gyi myu gu mngon par bskyed do/ / ming dang gzugs de rnam par 'phel nas/ skye mched drug gi tshogs 'byung bar 'gyur ro/ / skye mched rnams byung bas phan tshun reg pa dang / phrad cing 'dus pas tshor ba mngon par 'byung ngo/ / tshor ba myong ba de nyid la yang dang yang mngon par dga' bas sred pa dang / nye bar len pa rnam par 'phel lo/ / nye bar len pa rnam par 'phel bas srid pa kun tu 'byung ngo/ / srid pa kun tu byung bas skye ba dang / rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams kyang 'byung bar 'gyur te/ de ltar sems can de dag gi sdug bsngal gyi phung po bdag dang bdag gi med pa/ gsob/ gsog/ stong pa/ byed pa med pa/ sems med pa/ rtswa dang / shing dang / rtsig pa dang / sgang sgong dang / mig g.yor lta bu mngon par 'byung yang de ltar khong du mi chud do/ / ces de la byang chub sems dpas sems can de dag de ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po dang 'bral mi myong ba mthong nas/ de'i phyir de'i snying rje chen po rgyas pa 'byung ste/ sems can 'di dag ni bdag gis yongs su bskyab par bya ba dag go /yongs su dgrol bar bya ba dag go /shin tu bde ba la dgod par bya ba dag go snyam ste/ de'i phyir de'i byams pa chen po rgyas pa 'byung ngo/ /

Enlightening beings vow that their undertakings shall be coterminous with living beings, worlds, space, the cosmos, nirvana, the emergence of buddhas, enlightened knowledge, mental objects, entries of knowledge into the sphere of buddhas, the courses of worlds, the courses of teachings, and the courses of knowledge; and that just as all of these are endless, so shall the enlightening beings’ roots of goodness be endless.
“In those who have taken such vows upon themselves, the workable mind and the gentle mind are incorruptibly pure. The enlightening beings have faith in the perfectly enlightened buddhas’ attainments of past practices, their realization of the transcendent ways, their consummate attainment of the stages, their consummate attainment of the powers, their complete fulfillment of expertise, the indestructibility of unique qualities of buddhahood, the inconceivability of buddhahood, the attainment of the sphere of buddhas, which is infinitely various, the attainment of immeasurable knowledge, the complete entry into the realm of those who arrive at Thusness. Enlightening beings believe in the consummation of the fruits; in sum, they believe in the practice of enlightening beings, including all that upon which is based the teaching of the stage of knowledge of enlightened ones.
“Furthermore, it occurs to the enlightening beings that these qualities of buddhahood are so profound, so detached, so peaceful, so empty, so signless, so desireless, so undefiled, so vast, so immeasurable, so supreme, so hard to approach.
“What is more, enlightening beings reflect, ignorant creatures, because of continually slipping into erroneous views, because of minds shrouded by the darkness of ignorance, because of being puffed up with pride, because of conceptions, because of mental fixations of desires caught in the net of craving, because of hopes pursued by actions in the tangle of deceit and falsehood, because of deeds connected with envy and jealousy producing mundane states, because of accumulation of actions rife with passion, hatred, and folly, because of the flames of mind ignited by anger and resentment, because of undertakings of actions bound up with delusion, because of seeds in the mind, intellect, and consciousness bound to the flows of lust, existence, and ignorance, therefore produce sprouts of subsequent life in the world. That is to say, name and form are born together, inseparable; and by the development of name and form, the assembly of six sense mediums takes place; once the mediums are formed, from their mutual contact sensation comes to be; and that sensation being enjoyed and sought more and more, the operation of craving grows; craving being developed, existence comes to be; once there is existence, birth, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, sadness, and anxiety appear. Thus does the mass of suffering of sentient beings arise. Seeing these beings’ inability to escape from this mass of suffering—not realizing it is without self or anything pertaining to self, that it is unreal, insubstantial, void, inert, ineffective, insensate as wood and stone, like a reflection—the enlightening beings develop great compassion to rescue them and free them from their miseries, and develop great kindness to bring them to endless bliss and nirvana.

kye/ rgyal ba'i sras dag /de ltar byang chub sems dpa' snying rje dang / byams pa de lta bu'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po la gnas pa'i tshe/ dngos po thams cad la phangs par sems pa'i sems yongs su spangs nas/ sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la mos pa dang / dad pa rlabs po che'i blos sbyin pa chen po la rab tu brtson par byed de/ de 'di ltar 'di lta ste/ nor dang 'bru'i mdzod dang / bang ba yongs su gtang bar bya ba dag gam/ gser dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bai DUr+ya dang / rin po che shI la dang / byi ru dang / dngul dang / sa le sbram yongs su gtang bar bya ba dang / rin po che'i rgyan dang lhab lhub yongs su gtang ba'am/ rta dang / glang po dang / shing rta dang / rkang thang dang / bzhon pa yongs su gtang ba'am/ bran pho dang bran mo yongs su gtang ba'am/ grong dang grong khyer dang / ljongs dang / pho brang 'khor dang / rgyal po'i gnas yongs su gtang ba'am/ bza' shing gi ra ba dang / dka' thub kyi nags tshal dang / gtsug lag khang yongs su gtang ba'am/ chung ma dang / bu dang bu mo yongs su gtang ba'am/ sdug cing yid du 'ong ba'i dngos po thams cad yongs su gtang ba'am/ mgo dang / rna ba dang / rkang lag dang / mig dang / yan lag gi dam pa dang / lus thams cad yongs su gtang ba'am/ gtang bar bya ba'i dngos po de dag thams cad la chags pa med par byas nas/ sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la dad pa dang / mos pa'i blos yongs su gtong ste/ de ltar de byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po 'di la gnas pa'i tshe/ gtod pa chen po rab tu byed do/ /

“Thus, abiding in the first stage, by sympathy and kindness and by supreme will the enlightening beings, relinquishing all things with an equanimous mind, cultivate great relinquishments in a spirit of most urgent quest for enlightened knowledge. These relinquishments are: relinquishment of goods, food, stores, houses, gold, jewels, all kinds of treasure and money, jewelry and adornments, animals and vehicles, pleasant ponds, parks, forest retreats and monasteries, servants and employees, spouses and children, home, city, town, society, homeland, metropolis, and all parts of the body. Thus, having become indifferent to these, the intellect most ardently seeking enlightened knowledge relinquishes all things. Thus does the great relinquishment of those in the first stage of enlightening beings come to be.

de de ltar byams pa dang / snying rje dang / gtong ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pas sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir yang dang yang 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don yongs su tshol zhing don du gnyer to/ / de de ltar yongs su tshol zhing don du gnyer ba'i tshe yongs su skyo ba'i sems mi skye ste/ de'i phyir de'i yongs su mi skyo ba'i sems mngon par 'byung ngo/ / yongs su skyo ba med pas gtsug lag thams cad la 'jigs pa med pa yin/ de'i phyir gtsug lag thams cad la rab tu shes pa yin te/ de de lta bu'i gtsug lag dang ldan pas bya ba dang / mi bya ba shin tu rtogs pa'i blos sems can rab dang / 'bring dang / tha ma la dad pa'i tshul ji lta ba dang / ci 'os pas ci nus su snying thag pa nas yang dag pa nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir brtson par byed do/ / nan tan du byed do/ / de'i phyir de 'jig rten shes pa yin te/ 'jig rten shes pas dus dang tshod du ran par spyod cing ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pas bsam pa shin tu brgyan pas/ bdag dang gzhan gyi don du rab tu brtson par byed de/ de'i phyir ngo tsha shes shing khrel yod pa yin/ sbyor ba de dag la'ang 'byung bar spyod pa yin/ phyir mi ldog cing phyir mi ldog pa'i brtson 'grus dang / stobs kyis shugs kyang rab tu thob pa yin te/ de ltar de dga' ba'i stobs dang shugs yongs su skyes pa yin/ dga' ba'i stobs dang shugs rab tu thob pas/ de bzhin gshegs pa mchod cing rim gror bya ba la rab tu brtson zhing bstan pa la'ang nan tan shin tu byed do/ / de ltar de'i sa yongs su sbyong ba'i chos 'di lta ste/ dad pa dang / snying rje dang / byams pa dang / gtong ba dang / skyo ba med pa dang / gtsug lag shes pa dang / 'jig rten shes pa dang / khrel yod cing ngo tsha shes pa dang / dga' ba'i stobs kyi shugs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mchod cing rim gro bya ba'i nan tan yongs su skyes pa yin no/ /

“Thus, based on compassion, kindness, and relinquishment, the enlightening beings, for the sake of the salvation and liberation of all beings, more and more seek mundane and transcendental benefits for them, and while seeking arouse an unwearying mind. Thus do the enlightening beings become indefatigable and, being indefatigable, become expert in all learning. Thus in possession of learning, by intelligent consideration of what should and should not be done, the enlightening beings arrive at what is variously appropriate for inferior, mediocre, and superior beings, according to their power and endowments, thus attaining knowledge of the world and humanity. And the enlightening beings, knowing the world, acting in accord with time and measure, adorned with constant modesty and conscience, strive for the benefit of self and others. Thus the enlightening beings become modest and conscientious. And in those efforts the enlightening beings become uninterested in mundane satisfactions and attain nonreceding, undiminishing power; hence the arising of enlightening beings’ stable support of power. Thus stably empowered, the enlightening beings work on service to buddhas and receive their instructions. Hence arise in the enlightening beings the elements that purify the ten stages—faith, compassion, kindness, relinquishment, indefatigability, knowledge of the teachings, knowledge of the world and humanity, modesty and conscience, stable power, and attendance on buddhas.

de de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba'di la gnas pa'i tshe/ lta ba rgya chen po dang / smon lam gyi stobs kyis sangs rgyas mang po rab tu snang bar 'gyur te/ lta ba rgya chen po dang / smon lam gyi stobs kyis sangs rgyas brgya phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas brgya stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas bye ba brgya stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas khrag khrig mang po dang / sangs rgyas khrag khrig brgya phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas khrag khrig stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas khrag khrig brgya stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag mang po rab tu snang bar 'gyur ro/ / des de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag mthong nas/ bsams pa rgya chen pos rim gro byed do/ / bkur sti byed do/ / bsti stang byed do/ / mchod pa byed do/ / na bza' dang / bsod snyoms dang / gzims cha dang / snyun gyi rkyen sman dang / yo byad dag kyang 'bul zhing / byang chub sems dpa'i bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyang yongs su 'bul lo/ dge 'dun gyi tshogs rnams la yang yang dag par mchod par byed de/ dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“Enlightening beings in this stage of Joy get to see many buddhas, by broad vision and by the power of vows seeing many hundreds of buddhas, many thousands of buddhas, many hundreds of thousands of buddhas, many millions, many billions, many trillions of buddhas. Having seen those buddhas, those saints, those completely enlightened ones, by broad vision and the power of vows, the enlightening beings honor and serve them with supreme zeal, presenting them with the necessities of life, such as food, clothing, drink, vessels, bedding, and medicines, and they also bring comforts for enlightening beings, and they also respect and support the religious community. These supreme roots of goodness the enlightening beings dedicate to consummate enlightenment.

de ltar des sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag mchod pas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba mngon par 'grub pa yin/ de bsdu ba'i dngos po sbyin pa dang / ngag snyan pa gnyis kyi shas che bas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do/ / de'i mos pa'i shugs dang / stobs kyis bsdu ba'i dngos po gong ma gnyis kyang yongs su 'grub par 'gyur te/ ma lus par khong du chud par ni ma yin no/ / de'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu las sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i shas che ba yin te/ lhag ma rnams kyang ci tshul ci nus su yang dag par mi sgrub pa ma yin no/ / de ji lta ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la mchod pa byed cing / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la brtson pa dang / sa yongs su sbyong ba'i chos 'di dag yang dag par blangs te gnas pa de lta de ltar de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsdos pa/ de dag de bas kyang shas cher shin tu byang ba dang / yongs su dag pa dang / las su rung bar 'gyur ro/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di lta ste/ dper na/ mgar ba mkhas pas gser gyi sa le sbram ji lta ji ltar mer bsregs pa de lta de ltar shin tu byang zhing yongs su dag pa dang / ci dgar las su rung bar 'gyur ro/ / kye/ rgyal ba'i sras dag /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams ji lta ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la mchod pa byed cing / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la brtson par byed pa dang / sa yongs su sbyong ba'i chos kyi rnam pa 'di lta bu dag yang dag par blangs te gnas pa de lta de ltar de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngos pa de dag shin tu byang ba dang / yongs su dag pa dang / ci dgar las su rung bar 'gyur ro/ /

“From this service of buddhas arise means of development of beings, and the enlightening beings develop sentient beings to maturity by giving and by kind speech, the other two means of salvation helping out by the power of faith, though as yet without complete knowledge and attainment. Of the ten transcendent ways, the transcendent way of giving is foremost; not that the others are not cultivated, but they are practiced according to the enlightening beings’ power and endowment. And as the enlightening beings serve the buddhas and work for the development of sentient beings, practicing to accumulate these elements that purify the stages, thus do the enlightening beings’ roots of goodness, dedicated to universal knowledge, become more and more purified and capable of application as desired. Just as when gold is plunged into fire over and over by a skilled smith, it becomes more and more purified and workable and can be made into various ornaments as desired, in the same way as the enlightening beings attend buddhas and work for the perfection of sentient beings and cultivate the factors that purify the stages, so do their roots of goodness become more and more purified and useful.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /gzhan yang sa dang po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po nyid kyi rnam pa dang / 'thob par bya ba dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen las yongs su btsal zhing yongs su dri bar bya'o/ / sa'i yan lag yongs su bsgrub pa'i phyir yang ngoms mi shes par byas te/ des byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po 'di la gnas pa'i tshe/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dang / lnga pa dang / drug pa dang / bdun pa dang / brgyad pa dang / dgu pa dang / bcu pa'i rnam pa dang / 'thob bar bya ba dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen las yongs su btsal zhing yongs su dri bar bya'o/ / sa'i yan lag yongs su bsgrub pa'i phyir yang ngoms mi shes par bya'o/ / des sa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mkhas par bya'o/ / sa 'grub pa dang / 'jig pa la mkhas par bya'o/ / sa'i rnam pa dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu la mkhas par bya'o/ / sa 'thob par bya ba dang / rnam par bsgom pa la mkhas par bya'o/ / sa'i rnam pa yongs su sbyang ba la mkhas par bya'o/ / sa nas sar 'phar ba la mkhas par bya'o/ / sa dang sa la rnam par gnas pa la mkhas par bya'o/ / sa nas sa'i gnas gzhan du 'pho bar bya ba la mkhas par bya'o/ / sa nas sar yongs su sbyang ba'i khyad par gyi ye shes la mkhas par bya'o/ / sa nas sa thob nas phyir mi ldog pa'i ye shes la mkhas par bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpa'i sa yongs su sbyang bas/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa gnan pa la mkhas par bya'o/ /

“Then the enlightening beings in this stage should ask buddhas, enlightening beings, and spiritual friends about the characteristics and attainments of this first stage and should be tireless in seeking fulfillment of the components of this stage. In the same way, in order to fulfill the components of the stages of enlightening beings up to the tenth, the enlightening beings should become versed in the problems and solutions of the stages, in the formation and dissolution of the stages, in the forms and actions of the stages, in the attainments and cultivation of the stages, in the purification of the elements of the stages, in the progression from stage to stage, in the attainment of each stage without regression, in the purification of all stages of enlightening, and in the accession to the stage of enlightened knowledge.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa'i rnam pa mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas pa ni sa dang po las gyen du ma bskyod par sa bcu'i bar du gnan cing 'thab par bya ba thogs pa med de/ thogs pa med par 'gro ba dang / sa'i ye shes snang bas sangs rgyas kyi ye shes snang ba'ang rab tu thob bo/ / kye/ rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di lta ste/ dper na/ ded dpon chen po mkhas pas lam grogs yongs su gdon pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa/ grong rdal chen po'i sar phyin par bya bar 'dod pa ni thog ma nas lam dang lam gyi yon tan dang / lam las gol ba'i nyes pa dang / lam gyi bar lam gyi khyad par dang / lam gyi bar lam 'khrul na nyes par 'gyur ba dang / lam du bya mi bya dang / brgyags bshams pa yongs su tshol zhing kun tu 'dri'o/ / thog ma'i lam gyi bar lam nas ma 'phags pa nas grong rdal du phyin gyi bar du shin tu mkhas pa yin te/ lam gyi bar lam de nas ma 'phags par de nyid nas shes pas shin tu brtags pa'i blo dang / brgyags kyi tshogs chen po phun sum tshogs pas lam grogs mang po rnams nyam nyes med par grong rdal chen po der phyin par byed de/ mya ngan dang dgon pa'i nyes pas bdag dang lam grogs rnams la gnod par mi 'gyur bar byed do/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras ngag /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ded dpon mkhas pa yang gang gi tshe/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po la gnas shing / sa'i phyogs dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mkhas pa dang / sa 'grub pa dang / 'jig pa la mkhas pa dang / sa'i rnam pa dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu la mkhas pa dang / sa 'thob par bya ba dang / rnam par bsgom pa la mkhas pa dang / sa'i yan lag yongs su sbyang ba la mkhas pa dang / sa nas sar 'phar ba la mkhas pa dang / sa nas sar rnam par gnas pa la mkhas pa dang / sa nas sar khyad par du 'gyur ba'i ye shes la mkhas pa dang / sa nas sa thob pa las phyir mi ldog pa la mkhas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa thams cad yongs su sbyang bas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa gnon pa la mkhas par gyur pa de'i tshe bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po'i brgyags yongs su bzung ba dang / ye shes kyi tshogs chen po la rnam par dbye ba shin tu byas pa dang / sems can gyi lam grogs mang po yongs su gdon pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i grong rdal chen por phyin par bya bar 'dod cing thog ma nas sa'i lam dang / sa'i lam gyi yon tan dang / sa'i lam gol ba'i nyes pa dang / sa'i lam gyi bar lam gyi khyad par dang / sa'i lam gyi bar lam 'khrul na nyes par 'gyur ba dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po'i brgyags bshams shing gsog pa dag kyang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dag dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dag las yongs su tshol zhing yongs su 'dri ste/ de lam gyi bar lam dang po nas gyen du 'phags par thams cad mkhyen pa'i grong rdal chen por phyin par bya ba'i bar du mkhas pa yin/ de de ltar ye shes kyis rnam par rtogs pa'i blo dang / bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs chen po'i brgyags phun sum tshogs pas sems can gyi lam grogs kyi tshogs chen po yongs su smin pa'i tshul bzhin du 'khor ba'i mya ngan dang / dgon pa ba rgal dka' ba las bsgral te/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi grong rdal chen po'i bar du phyin par byed cing / 'khor ba'i mya ngam dang / dgon pa'i nyes pas sems can lam grogs sam/ bdag la gnod par yang mi 'gyur bar byed do/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yongs su skyo ba med pa'i yid kyis sa yongs su sbyang ba'i khyad par la brtson par bya'o/ / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi sa gnon pa'i bar du yang mkhas par bya'o/ /

“There is no cease in the ascent of the enlightening beings who are skilled in fostering the forms of practice of the stages up to accession to the tenth stage; by unceasing progress on the Path and by the light of knowledge of the stages, the enlightening beings attain the light of buddha-knowledge. It is like a skilled caravan leader who, wanting to lead a large caravan to a great city, first finds out about the qualities of the road to be traveled, the defects of the road, the best places to stop along the way, the places not to stop, and what is to be done about provisions for the trip, thus knowing well how to get to the great city, from the beginning to the end of the journey. Thus, by fully preparing for the way by this intelligent consideration, the caravan leader finally reaches the great city along with the caravan, without the caravan or himself being beset by difficulties in desolate places. In the same way the enlightening beings, as clever caravan leaders, when established in the first stage of enlightening beings, become familiar with the issues and solutions of the stages, the formation and dissolution of the stages, the practical aspects of the stages, the attainments and cultivation of the stages, the purification of the elements of the stages, the progression from one stage to another, the consolidation of each stage, the special knowledge of each stage, attainment of each stage without regression, and accession to the stage of buddha-knowledge by means of the quality of purification of all the stages of enlightening beings. Then the enlightening beings, having gotten together provisions of great virtue and knowledge, and having well established a store of knowledge, wishing to lead the great caravan of sentient beings to the city of omniscience, first inquire into and find out the qualities of the path of the stages, deviations from the path of the stages, errors on the path of the stages, the best of stations along the path of the stages, and what is to be done about the provisions of virtue and knowledge for the path of the stages, asking buddhas, enlightening beings, and spiritual friends about this to become versed in how to reach the great city of omniscience. Thus, by intelligent consideration of the way before proceeding and by thus fully preparing provisions of virtue and knowledge, the enlightening beings lead the great caravan of sentient beings according to their maturity across the wasteland of the mundane whirl to the great city of omniscience, without either the caravan or the enlightening beings being beset by the ills of the wasteland. Thus enlightening beings should work tirelessly on the cultivation of stages.

kye/ rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po rab tu dga' ba'i sgor 'jug pa mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o/ / rgya cher ni shin tu bstan pa brgya stong grangs med pa la rnam pa'i mur thug pa med pa ste/ bskal pa grangs med pa'i mthar thug par shin tu bstan pa'i tshul gyi khong du chud par bya'o// de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phal cher 'dzam bu'i gling gi rgyal por 'gyur te/ srid chen po la dbang sgyur ba rab tu thob cing chos kyis yongs su bskyang ba dang / sems can rnams sbyin pa chen pos yongs su bsdu ba la mkhas shing mthu yod pa yin/ sems can rnams kyis 'jungs pa'i dri ma bzlog pa la mkhas pa yin/ sbyin pa chen po rtsom pas yongs su dub par mi 'gyur ba yin/ de sbyin pa'am/ ngag snyan pa'am/ don bsgrub pa'am/ don mthun pas dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ci rtsom yang rung ste/ de thams cad ji ltar na sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur/ gtso bor 'gyur/ thu bor 'gyur/ phul du 'gyur/ dam par 'gyur/ bla na med par 'gyur/ 'dren par 'gyur/ rnam par 'dren par 'gyur/ yongs su 'dren par 'gyur ba nas/ rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la rten pa'i bar du 'gyur snyam ste/ sangs rgyas yid la bya ba dang / chos yid la bya ba dang / dge 'dun yid la bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' yid la bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yid la bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa yid la bya ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa yid la bya ba dang / stobs yid la bya ba dang / mi 'jigs pa yid la bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa yid la bya ba nas/ rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar du yid la bya ba dang mi 'bral ba yin/ de 'dod na skad cig yud tsam thang cig tu/ khyim dang / chung ma dang / srid thams cad yongs su spangs te/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rab tu 'byung ba dang / rab tu byung nas kyang skad cig yud tsam thang cig tu ting nge 'dzin brgya rab tu 'thob cing snyoms par 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas brgya mthong ba dang / de dag gi byin gyi rlabs kyang yang dag par shes pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams brgya bskyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgyar 'gro ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams brgya snang bar bya ba dang / sems can brgya yongs su smin par bya ba dang / bskal pa brgyar gnas par bya ba dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa brgya la rab tu 'jug pa dang / chos kyi sgo brgya rnam par 'byed pa dang / lus brgya yongs su bstan pa dang / lus re re la yang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor brgya yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i brtson 'grus kyi rnam pa de lta bu rtsom mo/ / de yan chad byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam gyi mthu can rnams smon lam gyi khyad par gyis rnam par 'phrul te/ de dag gi lus sam/ 'od dam/ rdzu 'phrul lam/ mig gam/ spyod yul lam/ dbyangs sam/ spyod pa'am/ rgyan tam/ byin gyi rlabs sam/ mos pa'am/ mngon par 'du byed pa dag kyang bskal pa du ma dang / bskal pa brgya phrag du ma dang / bskal pa stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa brgya stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du mas kyang bgrang bar dka'o/ /

“This is a brief explanation of enlightening beings’ entry into the first stage of Extreme Joy. Enlightening beings in this stage are mostly monarchs of a continent, having attained great power and sovereignty, guardians of right, wise and capable, taking good care of beings with great generosity, undertaking unlimited acts of charity to rid beings of the taint of envy and discontent. And whatever acts the enlightening beings undertake, whether by giving, or by kind speech, or by beneficial action, or by cooperation, those acts are never apart from thoughts of Buddha, of the Teaching, of the Community, of enlightening being, of the practices of enlightening beings, of the transcendent ways, of the stages, of the expertise and unique qualities of buddhas, of omniscience complete in all respects. To what purpose? To become the best of beings, unexcelled leaders and guides, and ultimately omniscient refuges.
“Those who seek to be thus undertake the appropriate effort, by which they give up all comforts and go forth in conformity with the teaching of Buddha. Having gone forth, enlightening beings instantly attain a hundred concentrations and see a hundred buddhas and acknowledge their power; they stir a hundred worlds, go to a hundred lands, illumine a hundred worlds, mature a hundred beings, live for a hundred eons, penetrate a hundred eons past and future, contemplate a hundred teachings, and manifest a hundred bodies, each body manifesting a company of a hundred enlightening beings. Then enlightening beings with superior power of commitment, by the quality of excellence of vows, transform their bodies, auras, mystic powers, vision, spheres of operation, voices, conduct, adornments, power, resolutions, and performances in countless ways.”
de nas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos sa'i don 'di nyid yang brtag par bya ba dang / bstan par bya ba'i phyir de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then Diamond Matrix spoke these verses explaining the meaning of this stage:

de dag dkar bo'i chos bsags dge ba phun ldan zhing / / bde gshegs yongs su bsnyen bkur snying rje byams ldan la/ / dad pa rgya che dge sems dang tshul dag ldan pa/ / rgyal ba'i ye shes don du rlabs chen sems kyang bskyed/ /
rgyal ba'i chos rdzogs 'gro ba yongs su bskyab don du/ / thams cad mkhyen pa sangs rgyas stobs sbyong brtan mthu can/ / brtse rab chen pos chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bya bas/ / rgyal ba'i zhing sbyong sems kyi dam pa rab tu bskyed/ /
'gro bar rnam pa sna tshogs dus rnams bstan pa'i phyir/ / 'dren pa kun gyi yon tan thams cad 'dod tshol zhing / / dus gsum skad cig gcig tu mi rtog shes byed pa'i/ / mkha' 'dra shin tu yangs pa'i sems dang ldan par byed/ /
shes rab dbang sgyur snying rje sngon 'gro thabs ldan zhing / / mos dang bsam pa rnam dag stobs kyis tshad med la/ / chags med mngon gyur gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa/ / bde gshegs rnams dang mnyam gyur sems kyi dam pa bskyed/ /
bde gshegs sras sems rin chen yang dag skyes 'phral du/ / byis pa'i spyod bral sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyod dang ldan/ / stobs bcu mnga' rigs kha na ma tho med par skyes/ / bde gshegs mnyam nyid rjes rtogs byang chub mchog tu nges/ /
'di 'dra'i sems dang sa thob lhan cig mngon par skyes/ / bsam pa mi g.yo ri yi rgyal po 'dra bar gnas/ / rab tu dga' zhing spro mang dad dang ldan pa ste/ / mos pa'i shugs yangs rtag par sems kyi mchog dang ldan/ /
'khrug dang 'tshe ba med cing khro ba med pa ste/ / ngo tsha shes shing srid zhu drang ldan shin tu bsdams/ / 'gro ba yongs su bskyab pa'i mtshungs med ye shes dran gyur cing / / 'dod par bya ba'i gnas dang ldan gyur dga' ba bskyed/ /
sa thob gyur ma thag tu 'jigs pa lnga dang bral/ / 'tsho ba med dang 'chi dang mi bsngags ngan 'gro dang / / 'khor gyi 'jigs bral de la bag tsha'i rnam pa med/ / ci'i phyir zhe na de la bdag gi gnas med do/ /
de dag bag chags bral zhing snying rje byams dang ldan/ / bsti stang dang ldan dga' ba phun sum yon tan mang / / nyin dang mtshan du dge ba'i phyogs la sten byed cing / / sems can don du chos brtson 'dod bskyed phyir ma yin/ /
dge ba'i chos thos bsam la mkhas shing gnas med spyod/ / thob sems sred bral byang chub sems la rtag par dga'/ / bde gshegs ye shes 'dod cing gzhan du sems pa med/ / pha rol phyin pa tshol zhing sgyu dang g.yo yang spangs/ /
ci smras de bzhin byed pas bden pa'i tshig la gnas/ / rgyal ba'i rigs skyon mi 'gyur byang chub slob la spyod/ / 'jig rten las kyi bsam bral 'gro ba'i don du brtson/ / dkar pos ngoms pa med par phyir zhing gong du rtsol/ /
de dag 'di 'dra'i chos brtson yon tan don dang ldan/ / rgyal ba blta ba'i don du smon lam mngon par sgrub/ / dam chos yongs su gzung zhing drang srong drung 'gro dang / / spyod pa mchog gi don du smon lam mngon par sgrub/ /
sems can yongs su smin bya sangs rgyas zhing sbyangs te/ / de yi zhing mchog rgyal sras kun gyis gang 'gyur zhing / / rgyal sras rnams dang bsam pa gcig cing don mthun phyir/ / skra sbubs kun tu don gyi dam pa mngon 'tshang rgya/ /
de dag smon lam du ma mngon par sgrub pa byed/ / de dag mtha' yas yangs shing mthar thug med dang ldan/ / nam mkha'i khams dang chos nyid mya ngan 'das khams dang / / 'jig rten mthar thug rgyal ba 'byung dang ye shes sa/ /
sems kyi yul dang ye shes 'jug pa'i mthar thug dang / / rnam gsum rgyud rnams mthar thug 'gro ba'i mur thug pa/ / rnam pa de tshul bdag smon mthar yang thug gyur cing / / de dag mthar thug ji bzhin bdag spyod de 'drar shog /
de ltar mngon bsgrubs 'jam zhing byams pa'i sems ldan pa/ / sangs rgyas yon tan yid ches sems can rnam par lta/ / sems can sdug bsngal nyon mongs bdag gis bskyab ces te/ / rten 'brel 'byung 'jug snying rje byams dang ldan pa ni/ /
de dag don du sna tshogs sbyin pa yang du rtsom/ / rgyal srid mchog dang rin chen sna tshogs glang po rta/ / mgo dang rkang lag mig dang de bzhin bdag gi sha/ thams cad yongs su gtong yang zhum pa'i yid med do/ /
gtsug lag sna tshogs tshol yang yongs su skyo ba med/ / gtsug lag 'jig rten spyod pa'i rjes kyang rab tu snyogs/ / 'jig rten shes dang ldan zhing khrel yod dga' dang ldan/ / bde gshegs gcig min rim gro rjes su mchod pa byed/ /
de ltar mkhas pa nyin mtshan rtag tu brtson pa yi/ / dge ba mer bcug gser bzhin shin tu dag par 'gyur/ / de dag sa rnams bcu po 'di la sbyangs byas shing / / thogs pa med par chags med rab tu thob par 'gyur/ /
ji ltar ded dpon lam grogs mang la phan brtson pa/ / lam gyi yon tan dris shing bde ba'i grong du skyel/ / de bzhin byang chub sems dpa' dang po'i sa gnas pa/ / 'gro ba'i don bshams chags med sa bcu rab tu 'thob/ /
'di gnas yon tan ldan pa mi yi dbang por 'gyur/ / byams pa'i sems kyis sa rnams ma lus yongs su skyong / / 'dzam bu'i rgyal mtshan srid kun rab tu skyong byed cing / / sbyin pas 'gro ba sangs rgyas ye shes mchog la 'god/ /
khyu mchog dam pa 'dod na rgyal srid rab tu gtong / / rgyal ba'i bstan par rab tu byung zhing brtson 'grus rtsom/ ting 'dzin brgya dang sangs rgyas brgya rnams mthong bar byed/ / zhing brgya bskyod cing rab tu snang byed kun tu 'gro /
sems can brgya sbyong chos kyi sgo la 'god pa byed/ / bskal pa brgyar 'jug lus brgya rab tu ston pa byed/ / rgyal ba'i sras kyang brgya yi grangs tshang yongs su ston/ / de yi gong na sman mchog stobs ldan tshad kyang med/ /

Having accumulated pure qualities and attained virtues, Done service, following enlightened kindness and compassion, Embodying supreme faith and pure goodwill, They produce an incomparable mind for enlightened knowledge.
Intent on the power, purification, and energy of the all-knowing buddhas, To attain the state of the Victorious and save the world, The supreme will arises to develop great compassion, Turn the wheel of the teaching, and purify the buddha-lands.
To know all times in an instant without discriminating thought, To clarify good timing in the world in its variety, Seeking, in short, all the qualities of the Guides, This noble mind, immeasurable as space, is born.
Commanded by wisdom, led by compassion, endowed with skill in means, Pure in resolution and intent, measureless in power, Unobstructed, direct, not relying on another’s guidance, Knowledge of the supreme mind equal to the enlightened,
With the birth of this mind-jewel of enlightening beings One transcends the sphere of the ignorant and reaches the sphere of buddhas, Is born in the family of the enlightened, impeccable, Gone to equality with buddhas, certain of highest enlightenment.
Once one produces this mind, one attains this stage, The will immovable as a mountain, Joyful and happy, serene, resolute, and forceful, With a buoyant mind,
Nonviolent, harmless, free from anger, Modest and respectful, with superior honesty, self-controlled; One remembers the immeasurable knowledge that saves the world And becomes joyful in anticipation of that state.
When one attains this stage, five fears depart— Not being able to make a living, dying, reputation, misery, fear of groups— Thus fear is gone: why? Because there is no attachment to self.
Those free from fear and full of compassion and kindness, With faith, respect, and modesty, rich in virtues, Practicing good day and night, seek the teaching for the sake of truth And not for enjoyment of mundane desires.
Considering well the teachings they have heard with unattached minds, Their will for enlightenment directed without desire for gain, Seeking knowledge and power, the purifying teachings of buddhas, They work on the ways of transcendence, free from delusion and conceit.
Acting in accord with their words, steadfast in truthful speech, They do not sully the family of buddhas, carrying out the study of enlightenment; Detached from mundane doings, wishing benefit for the world, Tireless in good works, they climb ever higher.
Thus seeking the truth, intent on the quest for virtue, They undertake the vow to behold the buddhas; To preserve the true teaching and approach the seers, They undertake the vows of those whose acts are supreme.
To develop beings and purify the buddha-land, To populate their land with enlightening beings, With unity of purpose, not in vain, They seek enlightenment everywhere.
They undertake many such vows, which are infinitely extensive, Enduring as space, beings, time, the nature of things, nirvana, The world, the emergence of buddhas, And the ground of knowledge.
They will their vows to last as long as there are mental objects And access to knowledge, endless in the world as long as it operates: “When these end, may my undertakings end too— May I attain practice enduring as these.”
Thus thoroughly dedicated, with harmonious, flexible minds, They put faith in the virtues of buddhas and observe sentient beings: Knowing beings are conditioned, out of compassion they feel They should rescue suffering beings from afflictions.
For that purpose they undertake various kinds of giving— Of kingship, all kinds of treasures, horses and elephants, Their heads, hands, feet, eyes, even their blood and flesh— All they give away, without becoming distressed in mind.
They seek out various teachings, indefatigable; Learned, they accord with the ways of the world. Knowing the world, modest and steadfast, They serve innumerable buddhas with reverence and respect.
Thus they practice constantly, day and night, Their virtue refined as gold in fire; Thus having made the preparations for the ten stages, They attain freedom from hindrance, having destroyed the obstacles.
Just as a caravan leader, for the benefit of the great caravan, Asks about the features of the road and then goes safely, So do enlightening beings in the first stage setting out Reach enlightenment unhindered, by way of the ten stages.
Stationed here, they become virtuous sovereigns, Guiding aright, nonviolent and benevolent; Leaders of the whole continent, they bring all people To relinquishment and the highest buddha-knowledge.
Having boldly abandoned rulership in search of truth, They betake themselves to Buddha’s teaching and begin to practice it; Attaining a hundred concentrations and seeing a hundred buddhas, They shake a hundred lands and travel as illuminators.
They purify a hundred beings, seek out a hundred doors of truth, And penetrate a hundred eons, manifesting a hundred bodies; They manifest a hundred enlightening beings, or even more, The power of their supreme vows immeasurable.

bdag gis don du mdor sdus te/ / sa rnams khyed la bshad pa byas/ / rgya cher bskal pa bye bar yang / / thams cad zad par mi nus so/ /
de ltar sa yi dang po 'di/ / 'jig rten kun la phan sems pa'i/ / byang chub sems dpa' mchog rnams la/ / rgyal ba'i sras kyis bstan pa yin/ /
rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ste/ / byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po/ /
“This is an explanation of the excellent first stage of enlightening beings seeking benefit for all worlds. Such is the first stage of enlightening beings, which is called Extreme Joy.”

sa mchog yid du 'ong ba 'di'i/ / gnas kyi dam pa thos gyur nas/ /
bde bar gshegs pa'i sras kyi rnams/ / yid rtog dang zhing rab tu dga'/ / kun kyang bstan las 'das gyur te/ / nam mkha'i dbyings la mngon 'phags nas/ /
me tog sil ma rab tu 'thor/ / legs zhes bya ba'i tshig kyang brjod/ /

Having heard about the supreme felicitous realm of this stage, the enlightening beings were delighted, their minds and thoughts pure: getting up from their seats and rising into the air, they scattered flowers all around, uttering words of praise:

rdo rje'i snying po 'jigs med pa/ / shes rab chen po legs so legs/ /
byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa ste/ / sa 'di khyod kyis legs par bshad/ / 'khor 'di rnam par dang zhing gsal/ / rnam grol zla ba 'di yang 'dri/ /
rgyal ba'i sras kyi gong du yang / / sa gnyis rab tu brjod pa mjod [*mdzod?]/ / yid kyi rtog pa ci 'dra bas/ / sa gnyis pa ni 'thob 'gyur ba/ /
shes rab chen pos bshad par mdzod/ / rgyal ba'i sras rnams nyan par 'dod/ /

Excellent, Diamond Matrix, replete with great wisdom and expertise; You have explained well this stage practiced by enlightening beings.
The assembly pure in mind, Moon of Liberation asks To hear about the next highest, second stage.
How should the mind be directed to see the second stage? Speak forth, O wise one — the enlightening beings desire to hear.

byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos smras pa/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po la yongs su sbyang ba byas pa de sa gnyis pa la mngon par mos pa yin te/ de'i sems kyi bsam pa bcu 'byung ngo/ / bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste; drang po'i bsam pa dang / 'jam pa'i bsam pa dang / las su rung ba'i bsam pa dang / dul ba'i bsam pa dang / zhi ba'i bsam pa dang / dge ba'i bsam pa dang / ma 'dres pa'i bsam pa dang / mi ltos pa'i bsam pa dang / rlabs po che'i bsam pa dang / bdag nyid che ba'i bsam pa dang / sems kyi bsam pa bcu po 'di dag 'byung ste/ de dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i sa gnyis pa dri ma dang bral ba la gnas pa yin/

The enlightening being Diamond Matrix said, “The enlightening beings who have successfully accomplished the requirements of the first stage and seek the second stage should activate ten mental dispositions: honesty, gentleness, capability, docility, tranquillity, goodness, nondefilement, nonattachment, broad-mindedness, and magnanimity. When these ten dispositions are operative, one is established in the second stage of enlightening beings, the stage of Purity.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de la byang chub sems dpa'i sa dri ma dang bral ba la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gyis srog gcod pa dang bral ba yin te/ dbyig pa spangs/ mtshon cha spangs/ khon du 'dzin pa spangs shing ngo tsha dang ldan pas srog chags su gyur pa thams cad la phan pa dang / bde bas phan 'dogs shing byams pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin te/ de yid kyi yongs su rtog pa tsam gyis kyang srog chags la 'tshe ba mi byed na sems can gzhan la sems can du 'du shes shing ched du bsams te lus la gtse ba chen po bya ba lta ci smos/

“Enlightening beings in the stage of Purity naturally become imbued with ten virtuous ways of acting: they avoid taking life, they abandon weapons and hostility, they have conscience and sympathy and are compassionate and kind to all living beings, wishing for their welfare. They do not harm living beings even in their fantasies, much less injure other beings by gross physical harm with the conception of beings as such.

bdag gis longs spyod kyis chog shes shing gzhan gyi longs spyod la re ba med pas ma byin pa len pa dang bral ba yin te/ de gzhan gyis yongs su bzung ba'i dngos po la gzhan gyis yongs su bzung bar 'du shes shing rku sems nye bar bzhag ste/ chung ngu na dang lo ma yang ma byin par mi len na/ 'tsho ba'i yo byad gzhan lta ci smos/

“The enlightening beings also abandon taking what is not given. They are satisfied with what they have and do not desire others’ possessions. Thinking of things that belong to others as belonging to others, they do not give rise to any intention to steal and do not take even so much as a blade of grass or a leaf that is not given to them, much less take the necessities of life from others.

bdag gi chung mas chog shes shing gzhan gyi chung ma la re ba med pas 'dod pas log par g.yem pa dang bral ba yin te/ de gzhan gyis yongs su bzung ba'i bud med gzhan gyi chung ma rus dang / mtshan ma dang / chos kyis bsrung ba rnams la chags sems kyang mi skyed na gnyis kyis gnyis phrad par bya ba lta ci smos/

“The enlightening beings also abandon sexual misconduct. They are satisfied with their own spouses and do not desire the spouses of others. They do not give rise to desire for others’ spouses, much less have sexual intercourse with them.

yang dag par smra zhing bden par smra ba dang / dus su smra ba dang / tshod du smra ba la ji skad du smras pa de bzhin du byed pas/ rdzun du smra ba dang bral ba yin te/ de chung ngu na rmi lam du yang rdzun gyi tshig mi pa rjod [*brjod?] na ched du bsams te brjod pa lta ci smos/

“The enlightening beings also abandon false speech, speaking truthfully, according to what is so, in a manner appropriate to the time, and acting accordingly. Even in dreams they do not speak falsehood with the intention to deceive by concealing what they see, believe, wish, intend, or desire; they do not tell lies even in dreams, much less consciously.

de sems can gyi dbyen mi byed cing mi 'tshe ba la zhugs pas phra ma'i tshig dang bral ba yin te/ de de dag dbye ba'i phyir/ tshu bi las thos shing pha pir snyod pa ma yin/ pha bi las thos nas tshu bir snyod pa ma yin te/ 'dum pa rnams dbye bar mi byed/ bye ba rnams la dpar bas mi rnon te/ mi 'dum pa la dga' zhing mi 'dum pa la mos pa ma yin pas/ bden nam rdzun yang rung mi 'dum bar bya ba'i tshig mi smra'o/ /

“The enlightening beings also abandon malicious talk and are not divisive or annoying to sentient beings. They do not gossip or tell tales here and there to cause division; they do not break up those who are together or increase the division of those already split. They do not enjoy disunion, do not delight in separation, and do not speak words that cause division, whether they are true or not.

zhe gcod pa'i tshig dang bral ba yin te/ rnyogs pa dang / brlang ba dang / rtsub pa dang / gzhan la gnod pa dang / zhe snad par 'gyur ba dang / nyes pa ngor brjod pa dang / nyes pa ngor brjod pa la gzhol ba dang / grong mi'i tshig dang / ma rabs kyi tshig dang / gzungs su bzung ba ma yin pa dang / rnar mi snyan pa dang / khro ba dang / gshe ba las byung ba dang / snying na bar byed pa dang / yid yongs su gdung bar byed pa dang / mi snyan pa dang / yid du mi 'ong ba dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi sems ma rung bar byed pa'i tshig gi rnam pa de lta bu spangs te/ gang 'di 'jam pa dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / snyan pa dang / gzungs su bzung ba dang / rnar 'ong ba dang / snying du sdug pa dang / pho brang 'khor gyi tshig dang / gtsigs pa dang / gsal ba dang / 'go ba dang / mnyan par 'os pa dang / mi gnas pa dang / skye bo mang po dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / skye bo mang po'i yid du 'ong ba dang / mkhas pas bsngags pa dang / sems can thams cad la phan zhing bde bar 'gyur ba dang / yid bde bar byed pa dang / yid sim par byed pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi sems dang bar byed pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad zhi bar byed pa'i tshig gi rnam pa de lta bu dag brjod do/ /

“The enlightening beings also abandon coarse speech and give up speech that is out of place, crude, dirty, harsh to others, openly or covertly annoying to others, vulgar, worldly or impure, unpleasant to hear, provocative, irritating, outrageous, displeasing, disagreeable, unpleasant, destructive to self or others. Having given up such speech, the enlightening beings speak words that are unabrasive and gentle, agreeable, sweet, causing pleasure, delightful, beneficial, pure, pleasant to the ears, congenial, likable, elegant and clear, understandable, worth hearing, not mixed up, desirable to many people, liked by many people, pleasing to many people, agreeable to many people, enlightening, beneficial and pleasurable to all beings, mentally uplifting, purifying self and others.

tshig kyal ba spangs pa yin te/ legs par lan glon pa'i tshig dang / dus su smra ba dang / bden par smra ba dang / don du smra ba dang / chos su smra ba dang / rig par smra ba dang / dul bar smra ba dang / dus la bab par shin tu go ba'i gtan tshigs dang bcas par smra bas/ de chung ngu na bzhad gad du bya ba tsam gyi tshig la'ang yongs su spang par bya ba yongs su spong na dgos pa don du gnyer cing tshig gis rnam par 'khrug pa lta ci smos

“The enlightening beings also abandon useless speech; they speak prudently, in accord with time, truthfully, meaningfully, rightly, logically, instructively. They speak words with content, carefully considering and guarding their speech, in accord with the occasion, in well-regulated order, reflecting even before telling a joke, and never, of course, chattering at random.

chags sems med pa yin te/ de gzhan gyi nor dang / gzhan gyi 'dod pa dang / gzhan dbang ba'i yo byad gzhan gyis yongs su bzung ba la ji ltar na gang gzhan gyi yin pa de dag bdag gir 'gyur zhes te/ chags sems mi skyed mi re mi smon cing 'dod pa'i sems mi skyed do/ /

“The enlightening beings also become free from covetousness, not even conceiving any craving for others’ wealth, pleasures, enjoyments, goods, and possessions, much less desiring to possess what belongs to others; they do not seek or hope for or desire gain.

gnod sems dang bral ba yin te/ sems can thams cad la byams pa'i sems dang / phan pa'i sems dang / snying brtse ba'i sems dang / bde ba'i sems dang / 'jam pa'i sems dang / 'gro ba thams cad la phan gdags pa'i sems dang / 'byung po thams cad la phan zhing snying brtse ba'i sems dang ldan pas/ gang 'di khro ba dang / mdud par 'dzin pa dang / tha ba dang / dri ma dang / gnod sems dang / khong khro ba la sogs pa de dag spangs te/ gang 'di phan pa dang ldan pa/ byams pa dang ldan pa/ sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i phyir rnam par rtog cing rnam par dpyod pa de dag la rnam par rtog pa yin/

“The enlightening beings also become free from malevolence and anger; they are kind to all beings, desirous of their welfare, sympathetic, solicitous, loving, protective of all, attentive to what is good for them. Giving up everything of the nature of the blemish of anger, resentment, and unfriendliness, opposition, and attack inflamed by ill will and hostility, the enlightening beings are to reflect on what is beneficial, considering what is called for by kindness for the welfare and happiness of all beings.

yang dag par lta ba dang ldan zhing ngo mtshar dang / bkra shis dang / ngang tshul ngan pa'i lta ba sna tshogs dang bral ba yin te/ lta ba drang zhing g.yo med la sgyu med pas/ sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la bsam pa nges pa yin/

“The enlightening beings also come to have right insight and follow the right Path. They give up divination and various misguided views, see rightly, do not practice deception, and set their minds on the Buddha, Teaching, and Community.

de dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag rtag tu rgyun mi chad par srung zhing 'di ltar sems kyi bsam pa mngon par sgrub ste/ sems can rnams kyi ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang / log par ltung ba yod pa gang yang rung ste/ de dag thams cad mi dge ba bcu'i lam yongs su blangs pa'i rgyu las byung gi /bdag gis ni 'di ltar bdag nyid yang dag pa'i nan tan la gnas te/ gzhan yang yang dag pa'i nan tan la dgod par bya'o/ / yang dag pa'i nan tan la gnas par bstan to/ / de ci'i phyir zhi na/ bdag log pa'i nan tan la gnas shing / gzhan yang dag pa'i nan tan la dgod par bya ba 'di ni gnas med skabs med pa ste/ 'di ni mi srid do zhes nas

“As the enlightening beings constantly preserve these ten virtuous ways, they evoke this intent: ‘Whatever ills, states of woe, and pitfalls beset sentient beings, all are caused by practicing nonvirtuous action, so I myself will abide in right action and also lead others to right action. Why? It is impossible to get others to abide in right action as long as one does not abide in right action oneself.’

yang de 'di ltar rnam par dpyod de/ mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag yongs su bzung ba'i rgyus sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi lam gyi rgyud du skye ba rnams yod par gyur to/ / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yongs su bzung bas ni mir skye ba la sogs pa srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du skye ba yod par gyur to/ / de'i gong du dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag nyi tshe ba'i sems dang / khams gsum pas skrag pa'i yid dang / snying rje chen po med pa dang / gzhan las thos pa'i sgra'i rjes su 'brang bas shes rab kyi rnam par yongs su bsgoms na/ nyan thos kyi theg pa yongs su sgrub bo/ / de'i gong du gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa dang / rang mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dang / snying rje chen po dang / thabs mkhas pa med pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab par khong du chud pas yongs su sbyangs na/ rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa yongs su sgrub bo/ / de'i gong du yangs shing tshad med pa'i sems dang / snying brtse zheng snying rje ldan pa dang / thabs mkhas pas yang dag par bzung ba dang / smon lam chen po shin tu btab pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes rgya chen po la dmigs pas yongs su sbyangs na/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa yongs su dag pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa'i spyod pa rgya chen po yongs su sgrub par 'gyur ro/ / de'i gong du dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag nyid rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan par yongs su sbyangs pas stobs bcu'i stobs thob par 'gyur ba dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi thob pa nas rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su 'grub pa yang dag par sgrub bo/ / de lta bas na bdag gis dge ba bcu'i las mngon par bsgrub tu 'dra ba la rnam pa thams cad du yongs su sbyang zhing mngon par bsgrub pa la brtson par bya'o zhes nas

“They also think thus: the realms of hells, animality, and ghosthood are established by the practice of bad ways of action, and the states from humanity up to the highest realm of existence are established by the practice of good ways of action. The ten ways of good action on a higher level practiced by wisdom, due to narrowness, fear of the world, lack of great compassion, and following the speech of another, develop the vehicle of hearers. Purified on a yet higher level, because of not being led by another, because of self-realization without following anyone, because of self-enlightenment without seeking from another, because of lack of great compassion and skill in means, and because of profound understanding of conditionality, they develop the vehicle of individual illuminates. Purified on an even higher level, by immeasurable broadmindedness, sympathy and compassion, absorption of skill in means, undertaking of great vows, not abandoning sentient beings, and focus on the vast knowledge of buddhahood, they make for the breadth of practice to purify the stages of enlightening beings and the ways of transcendence. Purified on a yet higher level, they are conducive to the perfection of all characteristics of enlightenment, up to endowment with the ten powers and the full realization of all qualities of buddhahood. Therefore, by means of these ways of good action, having undertaken them all equally, effort should be made to accomplish the complete purification of all of their aspects.

de 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste/ mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag bsten pa dang / bsgoms pa dang / mang du byas pa'i shas che bas ni sems can dmyal ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro/ / 'bring gis byol song gi skye gnas kyi rgyur 'gyur ro/ / tha mas ni gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi rgyur 'gyur te/ de la srog gcod pas ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do/ / byol song gi skye gnas su khrid do/ / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du khrid do/ / de nas ci ste mir skyes na yang rnam par smin pa gnyis mngon par bsgrub pa 'di lta ste/ tshe thung ba dang / nad mang ba'o/ / ma byin par len pas ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do/ / byol song gi skye gnas su khrid do/ / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du khrid do/ / de nas ci ste mir skyes na yang rnam par smin pa gnyis mngon par bsgrub pa 'di lta ste/ longs spyod chung ba dang / thun mong gi longs spyod du 'gyur ba'o/ / 'dod pas log par g.yem pas ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do/ / byol song gi skye gnas su khrid do/ / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du khrid do/ / de nas ci ste mir skyes na yang rnam par smin pa gnyis mngon par bsgrub pa 'di lta ste/ ltod pa dang bcas pa'i chung ma dang / g.yog 'khor mi srun pa'o/ / brdzun du smra bas ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do/ / byol song gi skye gnas su khrid do/ / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du khrid do/ / de nas ci ste mir skyes na yang rnam par smin pa gnyis mngon par bsgrub pa 'di lta ste/ skur pa mang ba dang / gzhan gyis bslu ba'o/ / phra mas ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do/ / byol song gi skye gnas su khrid do/ / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du khrid do/ / de nas ci ste mir skyes na yang rnam par smin pa gnyis mngon par bsgrub pa 'di lta ste/ g.yog mi 'dums pa dang / g.yog ngan par 'gyur ba'o/ / zhe gcod pa'i tshig gis ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do/ / byol song gi skye gnas su khrid do/ / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du khrid do/ / de nas ci ste mir skyes na yang rnam par smin pa gnyis mngon par bsgrub pa 'di lta ste/ yid du mi 'ong ba thos pa dang / 'thab mo'i tshig go /tshig kyal pas ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do/ / byol song gi skye gnas su khrid do/ / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du khrid do/ / de nas ci ste mir skyes na yang rnam par smin pa gnyis mngon par bsgrub pa 'di lta ste/ tshig mi btsun pa dang / spongs pa ma brtags pa'o/ / chags sems kyis ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do/ / byol song gi skye gnas su khrid do/ / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du khrid do/ / de nas ci ste mir skyes na yang rnam par smin pa gnyis mngon par bsgrub pa 'di lta ste/ chog mi shes pa dang / 'dod pa che ba'i/ / gnod sems kyis ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do/ / byol song gi skye gnas su khrid do/ / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du khrid do/ / de nas ci ste mir skyes na yang rnam par smin pa gnyis mngon par bsgrub pa 'di lta ste/ gnod par glags lta ba dang / pha rol gyis mnar ba'o/ / log par lta bas ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do/ / byol song gi skye gnas su khrid do/ / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du khrid do/ / de nas ci ste mir skyes na yang rnam par smin pa gnyis mngon par bsgrub pa 'di lta ste/ lta ba ngan par ltung ba dang / g.yo sgyu can no/ / de ltar na mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po che zhing tshad med pa sdud par 'gyur gyi/ mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag bdag gis spangs te/ chos la dga' zhing mos pas dga' bar gnas par bya'o zhes te/

“They also realize this: bad actions at their worst, when developed and done a lot, are the cause of hell; at a middling degree, they are the cause of animality; at their least they are the cause of the underworld. Taking life leads to hell, to animality, to the underworld, but if one is born human, it brings about two consequences: a short life and much sickness. Stealing leads to hell, to animality, to the underworld, but if one is born human, it brings about two consequences: material poverty and common possession of property. Sexual misconduct leads to hell, to animality, to the underworld, but if one is born human, it brings about two consequences: an unruly society and an unfaithful spouse. Lying leads to hell, to animality, to the underworld, but if one is born human it brings on two consequences: much slander and unreliability. Divisive talk leads to hell, to animality, to the underworld, but if one is born human it brings about two consequences: a broken home and a wretched family. Harsh talk leads to hell, to animality, to the underworld, but if one is born human it brings about two consequences: hearing what is displeasing, and argumentativeness. Confused, senseless talk leads to hell, to animality, to the underworld, but if one is born human it brings about two consequences: one’s words will not be believed and one’s speech will be unclear. Covetousness leads to hell, to animality, to the underworld, but then if one is born human it brings about two consequences: dissatisfaction and ambitiousness. Anger leads to hell, to animality, to the underworld, but then if one is born human it brings on two consequences: falling into bad views and becoming tricky and deceitful. Thus these ten bad ways of action tend to the formation of an immeasurably great mass of misery—so let us leave behind these ten bad ways of action and enjoy the delights of the garden of righteousness.

de mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag spangs nas dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la gnas shing gzhan yang de nyid la rab tu gzhog go /de sems can rnams la sngon pas kyang phan pa'i sems dang / bde ba'i sems dang / byams pa'i sems dang / snying rje'i sems dang / snying brtse ba'i sems dang / phan gdags pa'i sems dang / yongs su bsrung ba'i sems dang / slob dpon gyi sems dang / ston pa'i sems dang / mnyam pa'i sems bskyed cing /

“Having abandoned these ten bad ways of action, they live by the ten good ways of action and also lead others to them. Even more do the enlightening beings arouse toward all sentient beings desire for their welfare and happiness, with kindness, sympathy, compassion, and desire to care for them and protect them, thinking of all beings as equal to themselves, thinking of them as examples and teachers.

de 'di snyam du sems te/ kye ma/ sems can 'di dag ni lta ba ngan par lhung ba dag ste/ blo gros mi mnyam zhing bsam pa mi mnyam pa log pa'i lam thibs por rgyu ba yin gyi/ de dag bdag gis bden pa'i lam yang dag par lta ba'i lam/ de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin la rab tu dgod par bya'o/ / e ma'o/ / sems can 'di dag ni mi mthun zhing rtsod pa dang / 'thab pa la zhugs pa/ rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pas shin tu 'bar bar gyur pa yin gyi/ de dag bdag gis bla na med pa'i byams pa chen po rab tu nye bar bsgrub pa la rab tu dgod par bya'o/ / kye ma/ sems can 'di dag ni chog mi shes shing gzhan gyis nor la mngon par zhen te/ shin tu mi bzad par 'tsho bas rjes su spyod pa yin gyi/ de dag bdag gis lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las yongs su dag pas 'tsho ba la rab tu dgod par bya'o/ / kye ma/ sems can 'di dag ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / sred pa'i gzhi dang ldan zhing / nyon mongs pa sna tshogs kyi me lce rtag tu rgyud mi 'chad par kun tu 'bar bar gyur kyang 'di las 'byung ba'i thabs yongs su mi tshol ba yin gyi/ de dag bdag gis nyon mongs pa thams cad shin tu zhi zhing gtse ba med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu dgod par bya'o/ / kye ma/ sems can 'di dag ni gti mug gi mun pa dang / rab rib kyi ling thog gis bsgribs shing mun pa chen po thibs pa'i nang du song bas shes rab kyi snang ba dang ring du gyur te/ 'khor ba'i mya ngam chen por las shing lta ba ngan pa'i mya ngam la gzhol bar gyur pa yin gyi/ de dag bdag gis ci nas kyang chos thams cad kyi yid yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid bsgribs pa med pa khong du chud par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa thob par 'gyur bar shes rab kyi mig bsgribs pa med pa yongs su sbyang bar bya'o// kye ma/ sems can 'di dag ni 'khor ba'i mya ngam dang dgon pa chen por las shing / sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi g.yang sa la mngon du bltas pa/ lta ba ngan pa mi bzad pa'i dra bas kun nas 'khor ba/ gti mug thibs pos kun nas yog pa/ log pa'i lam gol bar zhugs pa/ long bar gyur pa/ dge ba'i mgon med pa/ 'byung ba ma yin pa la 'byung bar lta ba/ bdud kyi zhags pas bcings pa/ yul gyi rkun pos zin pa/ bdud kyi bsam pa thibs por nub pa/ sangs rgyas kyi bsam pa dang ring du gyur pa yin gyi/ de dag bdag gis rnam pa de lta bu'i 'khor ba'i dgon pa dang / mya ngam brgal dka' ba las bsgral te/ 'jigs pa med pa'i gnas thams cad mkhyen pa'i grong rdal chen po gtse ba med par rab tu dgod par bya'o/ / kye ma/ sems can 'di dag ni chu bo chen po'i klong du bying zhing 'dod pa dang / srid pa'i ma rig pa dang / lta ba'i chu bo la rab tu gzhol ba/ 'khor ba'i rgyud du 'brang ba/ sred pa'i chu klung gis khyer zhing dba' rlabs chen pos g.yengs pa/ sred pa'i 'dod chags kyi mthus shin tu bcom pa/ brtag pa'i mthu med pa/ 'dod pa dang / gnod sems dang / 'tshe ba dang / rnam par rtog pa mang po'i rjes su spyod pa/ 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i chu'i srin pos khrid pa/ 'dod pa'i yon tan thibs po'i gling du zhugs pa/ smon pa'i 'dod chags kyi 'dam du thogs pa/ nga'i nga rgyal gyi g.ye ba chen por 'khyams pa/ rten med pa/ skye mched kyi grong rdal nas ma 'phags pa/ dge ba'i sgrol ba med pa yin gyi/ de dag bdag gis snying rje chen po dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs kyis shugs kyis bton te/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i rin po che'i gling gtse ba med pa/ rdul med pa; zhi ba/ bde ba/ 'jigs pa med pa la rab tu dgod par bya'o/ / kye ma/ sems can 'di dag ni khams gsum gyi sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa mang po can chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang / sdug pa dang / mi sdug pas rnam par bcings pa dang / mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa'i rjes su spyod pa/ sred pa'i sgrog gis bcings pa; ma rig pa'i thibs pos kun nas yog pa'i nang na mi mthun par gyur pa yin gyi/ de dag bdag gis khams gsum pa'i gnas thams cad las dben pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bsgribs pa med pa la rab tu dgod par bya'o/ / kye ma/ sems can 'di dag ni bdag dang bdag gi la mngon par zhen cing / phung po'i gnas las ma 'phags pa/ phyin ci log bzhi la rab tu zhugs pa/ skye mched drug gi grong stong pa la shin tu gnas pa/ 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i sbrul gyis gtse ba/ phung po'i gshed ma dang chom pos shin tu bcom pa/ gzhal du med pa'i sdug bsngal myong bar gyur pa yin gyi/ de dag bdag gis bde ba'i dam pa gnas thams cad dang bral ba 'di lta ste/ bsgribs pa med pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu dgod par bya'o/ / kye ma/ sems can 'di dag ni dma' ba dang / zhan pa dang / zhum pa la mos shing thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dam pa'i sems mi bdog pas/ theg pa chen po'i 'byung ba yod kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi blo can yin gyi/ de dag bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po'i blo gros dang / bsam pa yangs pa'i theg pa chen po bla na med pa la thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su bstan pas rab tu dgod par bya'o snyam mo/ /

“This is what the enlightening beings think: ‘Alas, these beings have fallen into wrong views; their thinking and disposition of mind is wrong: traveling on erroneous paths, in the midst of entanglements, they should be set by us on the true way, the road of right insight, in accord with reality. Alas, these beings are at odds, argumentative, involved in disputes, always burning with anger and hatred—we should establish them in the exercise of unexcelled great kindness. Alas, these beings are insatiable, coveting others’ goods, following bad ways of making a living—we should establish them in pure deed, word, thought, and livelihood. Unfortunately, these beings follow the motivations of lust, hatred, and delusion, are burned by the flames of various afflictions, and do not seek a means of final escape from them—we should lead them to nirvana, where all afflictions cease and there are no ills. Regrettably, these beings are veiled by the darkness and obscurity of delusion and covered by the darkness of ignorance; they have entered a vast tangle of darkness, have become far estranged from the realm of wisdom and fallen into a great darkness, entered a wilderness of erroneous views—we should clarify their eye of unobstructed wisdom, so they will know all things as they really are without being directed by another. Alas, these beings are traveling in the desert of routine existence; they are in trouble, uneasy, fallen into a great pitfall, facing a fall into the realms of hells, animality, or the underworld; they are ensnared in the dangerous net of false views, entangled in delusion; they have gone off on the wrong road, are blind, lack a guide, and think what is not salvation is salvation; bound by the rope of demons, they are taken in by the thieving sense objects, are without a good guide, and have entered a thicket of demonic dispositions, becoming far estranged from the enlightened mentality: we should save them from such hardships of the wasteland of the mundane whirl and should settle them in the city of fearlessness, the city of all knowledge, where there is no affliction or pain. These beings, unfortunately, are sunk in the waves of great torrents, plunged into the flows of desire, existence, ignorance, and views, swept along by the current of the mundane whirl, fallen into the river of craving, into a great rapids, unable to see objectively, going along the creepers of thoughts of lust, malice, and viciousness, caught by the demon of the view of real existence of the body, plunged into the swirling abyss of desire, into the midst of passion for enjoyment, cast up on the land of self-conceit, rotten inside with misconduct and bad behavior, unable to escape the danger of the village of the six senses, without anyone to rescue them, without a savior or protector, without a refuge: we should bring forth great compassion, virtue, and power, and set them on the jewel island of omniscience, free from troubles, free from passion, peaceful, happy, free from danger, beyond all fears. These beings are unfortunately locked up in much suffering, sadness, and irritation, in bonds of love and hate, like and dislike, in sadness and grief, in the fetters of craving, in the tangles of illusion, deceit, and ignorance, in the prison of the triple world: we should lead them to nirvana, detached from the triple world, the city of fearlessness, where all suffering ceases, free from obstruction. Alas, these beings are attached to self and possessions, unable to get out of clinging to the elements of body and mind, acting according to delusions, dwelling in the desolate village of the senses, attacked by the vipers of physical constituents, besieged by the murderous bandits of the body-mind clusters, experiencing immeasurable pain: we should bring them to supreme bliss, free from all attachments—that is, to nirvana void of all obstructions. It is a pity that the aspirations of these beings are base and narrow and they lack the will for highest omniscience; even if they want to escape, they think of the vehicles of those aiming for individual enlightenment and liberation alone—we should set them in the unexcelled Great Vehicle of universal salvation in accord with focus on the great resolution for supreme buddhahood and the perspicacity of omniscience.’

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de ltar tshul khrims kyi stobs dang / mthu de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' snying rje dang / byams pa mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas pa/ sems can thams cad kyis ma bcol ba'i bshes gnyen du gyur pa/ sems can thams cad yongs su ma btang ba/ bya ba dang mi bya ba mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa dri ma med pa la gnas pa de'i lta ba rgya chen po dang / smon lam gyi stobs kyis sangs rgyas mang po rab tu snang bar gyur te/ lta ba rgya chen po dang / smon lam gyi stobs kyis sangs rgyas brgya phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas brgya stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas bye ba brgya stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas khrag khrig mang po dang / sangs rgyas khrag khrig brgya phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas khrag khrig stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas khrag khrig brgya stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag mang po rab tu snang bar 'gyur ro/ / des de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag mthong nas/ bsam pa rgya chen pos rim gro byed do/ / bkur sti byed do/ / bsti stang byed do/ / mchod par byed do/ / na bza' dang / bsod snyoms dang / gzims cha dang / snyun gyi rkyen sman dang / yo byad dag kyang 'bul zhing / byang chub sems dpa'i bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyang yongs su 'bul lo/ / dge 'dun gyi tshogs rnams la yang dag par mchod pa byed do/ / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o/ / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag las dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag kyang rim gro chen pos rab tu 'dzin te/ ji ltar bzung ba de'ang bar ma dor chud zos par mi byed do/ / de bskal pa du ma dang / bskal pa brgya phrag du ma dang / bskal pa stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa brgya stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa bye ba brgya stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa khrag khrig phrag du ma dang / bskal pa khrag khrig brgya phrag du ma dang / bskal pa khrag khrig stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du mar ser sna'i skyon dang / tshul khrims ngan pa'i dri ma med pas gtong ba dang / tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la yang dag par 'byung zhing gnas so; ;
kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di lta ste/ dper na/ gser gyi sa le sbram de nyid nag mtshur du bcug na/ de bas kyang dri ma thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ro; ; kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa dri ma dang bral ba'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang bskal pa du ma nas bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma'i bar du ser sna'i nyes pa dang / tshul khrims ngan pa'i dri ma med pas gtong ba dang / tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la yang dag 'byung zhing gnas so/ / de'i bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi las ngag snyan pa shas che ba yin/ pha rol tu phyin pa bcu las tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i shas che ba yin te/ lhag ma rnams kyang ci tshul ci nus su yang dag par mi sgrub pa ma yin no/ /

“Thus many buddhas come within the range of perception of the enlightening beings who are in accord with the sustaining power of morality, who have skillfully activated sympathy, compassion, and kindness, who are unsolicited good friends to all beings, who have not abandoned sentient beings, who skillfully accomplish what is to be done, who are stationed in the enlightening beings’ stage of purity, by the enlightening beings’ great vision and willpower: the enlightening beings perceive enormously many buddhas, many hundreds, thousands, millions, billions, trillions of buddhas, by their tremendous vision and the power of their vows. Having seen those buddhas, they honor and pay respect and homage to them with lofty intent, and provide them with the necessities—clothing, food and drink, bedding, and medicine; they also provide comforts for enlightening beings and pay respect to the religious community. They dedicate these roots of goodness to unexcelled perfect enlightenment. Also they attend those buddhas and respectfully learn from them the ten ways of virtuous action and never forget them as they have learned them; over countless eons rid of the defilements of envy and bad behavior, they therefore attain purity of generosity and morality.
“Just as gold becomes more and more free from all impurities when put in vitriol, so do enlightening beings in this stage of Purity, by virtue of riddance of the impurities of envy and bad behavior, accomplish purity of generosity and morality. Among the four means of salvation, kind speech is paramount in them; among the ten transcendent ways, morality is paramount. This does not mean they do not practice the rest—they do so as best they can, as is appropriate.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa dri ma med pa zhes bya ba ste/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa gnyis pa mdor bstan pa'o/ / de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni phal cher 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po gling bzhi la dbang bar 'gyur te/ chos kyis dbang bsgyur ba rab tu thob cing rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa/ sems can thams cad kyi ser sna'i skyon dang / tshul khrims ngan pa'i dri ma bzlog par bya ba la mkhas shing mthu yod pa dang / sems can rnams dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la rab tu dgod par bya bar shin tu mkhas pa dang / sbyin pa chen po rtsom pas thub pa med pa yin te/ sbyin pa'am/ ngag snyan pa'am/ don bsgrub pa'am/ don mthun pas dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ci rtsom yang rung ste/ de thams cad ji ltar na sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur/ gtso bor 'gyur/ thu bor 'gyur/ phul du 'gyur/ dam par 'gyur/ bla na med par 'gyur/ 'dren par 'gyur/ rnam par 'dren par 'gyur/ yongs su 'dren par 'gyur ba nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la rten pa'i bar du 'gyur snyam ste/ sangs rgyas yid la bya ba dang / chos yid la bya ba dang / dge 'dun yid la bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' yid la bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yid la bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa yid la bya ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa yid la bya ba dang / stobs yid la bya ba dang / mi 'jigs pa yid la bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa yid la bya ba nas/ rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar du yid la bya ba dang mi 'bral ba yin no/ /

“This is a brief explanation of the second stage of enlightening beings, the stage of Purity. Many of the enlightening beings in this stage are sovereigns, lords of four continents and masters of the law, competent, powerful, able to rid beings of the impurities of bad behavior, to set them on the ten paths of virtuous conduct. Whatever acts the enlightening beings undertake, whether by way of giving, or kind speech, or beneficial action, or cooperation, all of it is done with no other thoughts in mind but thoughts of the Buddha, the Teaching, the Community, enlightening beings, the practices of enlightening beings, the ways of transcendence, the stages, the powers, the expertises, the unique qualities of buddhas, and all aspects of omniscience. Why? To become the best of beings, unexcelled leaders and guides, and ultimately omniscient refuges.
