de 'dod na skad cig yud tsam thang cig tu khyim dang / chung ma dang / srid thams cad yongs su spangs te/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rab tu 'byung ba dang / de rab tu byung nas kyang skad cig yud tsam thang cig tu ting nge 'dzin stong rab tu 'thob cing de dag la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas stong mthong ba dang / de dag gi byin gyi rlabs kyang yang dag par shes pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams stong skyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing stong du 'gro ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams stong snang bar byed pa dang / sems can stong yongs su smin par byed pa dang / bskal pa stong du gnas pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa stong la rab tu 'jug pa dang / chos kyi sgo stong rnam par 'byed pa dang / lus stong yongs su bstan pa dang / lus re re la yang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor stong yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i brtson 'grus de lta bu rtsom mo/ / de yan chad byang chub sems dpa' smon lam gyi mthu can rnams smon lam gyi khyad par gyis rnam par 'phrul te/ de dag gi lus sam/ 'od dam/ rdzu 'phrul lam/ mig gam/ spyod yul lam/ dbyangs sam/ spyod pa'am/ rgyan tam/ byin gyi rlabs sam/ mos pa'am/ mngon par 'du byed pa dag kyang bskal pa du ma dang / bskal pa brgya phrag du ma dang / bskal pa stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa brgya stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma'i bar gyis kyang bgrang bar dka'o/ /

“Those who seek to be thus undertake the appropriate effort, by which they give up all comforts and go forth into the teaching of Buddha. Having gone forth, in a single instant they suddenly attain a thousand concentrations, see a thousand buddhas and recognize their power, shake a thousand worlds, go to a thousand fields, illumine a thousand worlds, mature a thousand beings, live for a thousand eons, penetrate a thousand eons past and future, contemplate a thousand teachings, and manifest a thousand bodies, each body manifesting a company of a thousand enlightening beings. Then enlightening beings with superior power of commitment, by the quality of excellence of vows, transform their bodies, auras, mystic powers, vision, spheres of operation, voices, conduct, adornments, power, resolutions, and performances in countless ways.”
de nas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos sa'i don 'di nyid yang brtag par bya ba dang / bstan par bya ba'i phyir de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then Diamond Matrix spoke these verses explaining the meaning of this stage:

de dag gnyen drang las rung 'jam pa'i sems ldan zhing / bsam pa dag dang bsam pa zhi dang ldan pa rnams/ / 'du 'dzi'i dmigs bral rlabs chen blo dang ldan pa yin/ / che nyid sems ldan mkhas pa de dag gnyis la 'phar/ /
de gnas yon tan 'chang zhing dge ba phun ldan pa/ / gtse med sems ldan srog gcod rnam par kun spangs shing / / ma byin len dang gzhan gyi chung ma de bzhin spangs/ / bden dang ldan zhing phra ma mi smra zhe gcod med/ /
gzhan gyi longs spyod 'dod sems bral zhing byams sems ldan/ / drang zhing g.yo med yang dag lam du rab tu zhugs/ / g.yo med thibs po med cing shin tu nges pa ste/ / rtag tu bag yod ston pa'i spyod pa yongs su srung / /
sems dmyal byol song skye gnas sdug bsngal ji snyed dang / / gshin rje'i ris na yi rtag tu lus 'bar ba/ / de dag sdig blos dge ba min la brtson pas byung / / de bas de spangs bden pa'i chos dang ldan par bya/ /
mi yi nang du skye ba yid du 'ong la sogs/ / srid rtse'i bar gyi lha yi bsam gtan bde ba dang / / rang rgyal theg pa de bzhin nyan thos theg pa dag / kun kyang dkar lam bcu pos byung ba yin zhes te/ /
de ltar shes shing rtag par mkhas pa bag yod pa/ / shin tu bsdams pa'i yid kyis pha rol tshul la 'god/ / sems can sdug bsngal shes shing snying brtse bskyed byas nas/ / de bas gong du snying rje'i sems dang ldan par byed/ /
kye ma byis pa'i blo can 'di dag lta ngan lhung / / khro zhing shar gnyer gnod pa kun sems rtsod pa can/ / rtag tu mi ngoms yul la yang dang yang du smon/ / gzhi gsum 'brel ba de dag yongs su dgrol bar bya/ /
gti mug mun pa chen pos kun nas yog pa rnams/ / lta ba'i dra mang mya ngam lam du lhung 'gyur ba/ / 'khor ba'i shing thags nang na rtag tu dgras gtse zhing / / bdud kyi chom po'i nang gnas de dag bdag gis dgrol/ /
nyon mongs rlabs kyis g.yengs shing chu bo bzhir nub pa/ / khams gsum sdug bsngal brgya yis yongs su gdungs pa rnams/ / phung po'i gnas la rten cing bdag tu 'du shes pa/ / de dag sdug bsngal dgrol don bdag gis brtson par bya; ;
sangs rgyas ye shes dam pa rmad byung phul spangs shing / / 'byung ba yod bzhin dma' ba'i blo gros skyed byed pa/ / de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes yang dgod ces; ; rgyal ba'i ye shes don du brtson 'grus yangs pa rtsom/ /
'di gnas yon tan brgya bsags drang srong chen po rnams/ / bde gshegs du ma mthong zhing mchod pa'ang rab tu byed/ / dge ba de dag bskal pa bye bar phyir zhing sbyong / / gser gyi dam pa nag mtshur nang du bcug pa bzhin/ /
'di gnas rgyal sras 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur/ / dge ba bcu la sems can rab tu dgod pa byed/ / dge tshogs gang yang rung ste gsog par byed pa rnams/ / stobs bcu ldan zhing 'gro ba'i skyabs 'gyur don du gsog /
'dod na rgyal po'i srid kyang rnam par spangs byas shing / / brtan pa rnams ni bstan pa'i mchog la rab byung nas/ / brtson 'grus ldan zhing ting 'dzin dam pa mchog kyang 'thob/ / sangs rgyas stong tshang skad cig gcig gis mthong bar byed/ /
'di 'dra'i tshul gyis bgrang bas gzhan yang gcig min pa/ / khyu mchog sa 'di gnas pa rab tu ston par byed/ / de yi gong nas ye shes smon lam mchog ldan pa/ / rnam par 'phrul pa rnam pa du mas sems can 'dul/ /

They are gentle, honest, mild, capable, Of goodwill, docile, unalloyed, unattached, of lofty awareness; With breadth of mind they enter the second stage.
Here, they are bearers of virtue, imbued with good. Avoiding the taking of life, their minds are free from viciousness. They do not take what is not given or take others’ spouses. They are truthful, do not slander, are not harsh in speech.
They have no desire for others’ possessions, are kind-hearted, Follow the right Path, and have no deceitful mind. With phantom bodies, beautifully adorned, They honor the Teacher and are always diligent.
The pains of hells and animal realms, Punishment in the underworld, eternal burning and hunger, All are produced by evil doings; Rejecting them, let us arrive at truth.
From birth in the human realm as desired, Up to the peak of existence, free from strife, with the bliss of meditation, The vehicle of solitary illuminates, the vehicles of disciples and buddhas, All come to exist from the ten paths of virtue.
Knowing this, enlightening beings are always diligent, Firmly abiding by ethics and also inducing others to do so. Furthermore, imbued with compassion, Knowing beings are suffering, they give rise to sympathy.
“Fallen into wrong views are these ignorant ones, With minds quick to anger, hate, and argue, Always unsatisfied, seeking objects ever more— These beings motivated by desire, hatred, and delusion should be liberated.
“They are covered by a great darkness, plunged into delusion, On a bad road in a wilderness, in a great net of views; In the cage of mundane life, enemies attack them— We should liberate those in the cage of the devil.
“Taken by the waves of afflictions, sunk in the torrents, They are tormented by a hundred miseries in the triple world, Wrapped up in the clusters, thinking of them as self— For their sake we strive, to release them from pain.
“Having given up this supreme vehicle of buddhahood, Though they aim for escape, their aspiration is low; We will establish them in the undefiled knowledge of the enlightened.” Thus enlightening beings arouse incomparable vigor in the cause of enlightenment.
In this stage the great sages, having gathered hundreds of virtues, See many buddhas and honor them with offerings. Their virtue is burnished the more for countless eons, Like gold plunged into vitriol.
Here enlightening beings become monarchs, Leading sentient beings by the ten virtues: By all the virtue they have amassed, They will to become saviors of the world, rich in the ten powers.
Willfully giving up the pleasures of kingship, Gone forth into the supreme Teaching, steadfast, Full of vigor, they attain supreme concentration And instantly see a thousand buddhas.
The enlightening beings in this stage also display Many spiritual powers, of such worthy intentions; Beyond this, imbued with the power of vows and knowledge, They guide beings with many kinds of miracles.
de ltar sa mchog gnyis pa 'di/ / 'jig rten kun la phan 'dod pa'i/ / byang chub sems dpa'i mchog rnams la/ / bde bar gshegs pa'i sras kyis bstan/ /
“Thus has been explained the second stage, exalted, of enlightening beings, who work for the weal of all worlds.”
dri ma dang bral ba zhes bya ba ste/ / byang chub sems dpa'i sa gnyis pa'o// //
bam po bzhi bcu bdun pa/

byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul bsam yas pa/ / sa mchog spyod pa de skad thos gyur nas/ / rgyal ba'i sras rnams rab tu dga' zhing bsti stang du/ / me tog sprin char kun nas mngon par 'bebs/ /
ri yi rgyal por bod pa legs so legs/ / sems can kun la snying brtse bsam pa yis/ / sa mchog dam pa'i spyod yul de 'dra dang / / mkhas pa'i tshul khrims sdom pa khyod kyis bshad/ /
yang dag de dngos ma nor gzhan min pa'i; ; byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yid 'ong zhing / / sems can kun la phan dang bde bar rab sems pa/ / phul du 'od gsal khyod kyis bstan pa byas/ /
da dung da chud lha dang mis mchod cing / / chos kyi ye shes rigs par brjod mkhas pa/ / de dag spyod yul tshul ni ji bzhin du/ / sa yi dam pa gsum pa brjod par mdzod/ /
drang srong chen po'i sbyin tshul spyod pa dang / / bzod pa brtson 'grus zhi ba shes rab thabs/ / byams pa'i mchog dang snying rje lam gyi rnams/ / rgyal sras spyod pa rnam sbyang bstan mdzod cig ;

Having thus heard of the supreme stages of practice in the sphere of enlightening beings, inconceivable, the enlightening beings in the audience, delighted, scattered multitudes of flowers from the sky, saying, “Excellent! Well have you explained, out of compassion for all beings, the body of conduct of the wise, the sphere of the second of the highest stages. Truthfully, without falsehood or change, have you explained the delightful practice of enlightening beings, with supreme clarity, for the welfare and happiness of all beings. Go on to speak of the third of the most excellent stages—let this superlative realm be told of as it is, linked with true knowledge and action. Tell of the path of the conduct of the Victorious, the practice of charity and morality of the sages, patience, energy, tranquillity, wisdom, skillfulness, supreme kindness, and compassion — tell all, omitting naught.”
rdo rje'i snying po 'jigs med la/ / rnam grol zla bas yang smras pa/ / gsum la yang dag 'phar 'gyur ba'i/ / bsam pa mkhas pas bshad pa mdzod/ /
Moon of Liberation said, “O Diamond Matrix, tell of the disposition of those who approach the third stage.”

byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdo rje'i snying pos smras pa/ kye/ rgyal ba'i sras dag /de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sa gnyis pa la bsam pa shin tu sbyangs pa ni/ sa gsum pa yongs su gnon to/ / de sems kyi bsam pa yid la bya ba bcus yongs su gnon to/ / bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ dag pa'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la bya ba dang / mi g.yo ba'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la bya ba dang / skyo ba'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la bya ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la bya ba dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la bya ba dang / brtan pa'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la bya ba dang / sbyangs pa'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la bya ba dang / rlom sems kyi bsam pa yid la bya ba dang / rlabs po che'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la bya ba dang / bdag nyid che ba'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la bya ba'o/ /

Diamond Matrix said, “The enlightening beings who have thoroughly purified the mind in the second stage come to the third stage. One enters the third stage by ten conscious focusings of the mind: purity, stability, disillusion, dispassion, nonregression, steadfastness, ardor, tirelessness, high-mindedness, and magnanimity. By consciously focusing the mind on these ten things, one enters the third stage.

kye/ rgyal ba'i sras dag /byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sa gsum pa la gnas pa ni 'du byed kyi rnam pa thams cad la mi rtag par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rtog go /sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba dang / rnam par 'jigs pa dang / ring du mi gnas pa dang / skad cig tu 'byung zhing 'gag pa dang / mi zad cing mi skye mi 'gag pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' kun nas ma byung ba dang / phyi ma'i mtha' 'pho ba med pa dang / da ltar byung ba mi gnas par rab tu rtog go /'du byed kyi rnam pa de lta bu la rab tu rtog pa'i tshe/ mngon par 'jig pa dang / mya ngan can/ smre sngags 'don pa can/ 'khrug pa can/ yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong bas rnam par bcings pa/ sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba mang ba/ bsags pa med pa las byung ba/ 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi me rab tu 'bar ba/ nad du mas rnam par skyed pa/ sgyu ma'i rang bzhin lta bur mthong nas/ de de bas kyang 'du byed thams cad las sems gyen du skyod cing de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la rab tu gtong ste/ des de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa'ang rjes su mthong ste/ mtshungs pa med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / rnyed par dka' ba dang / ma 'dres pa dang / gnod pa med pa dang / 'khrug pa med pa dang / mi 'jigs pa'i grong rdal du 'gro ba dang / phyir mi ldog pa dang / 'gro ba mang po yongs su skyob pa yang yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo/ /

“Furthermore, the enlightening beings in this third stage examine the impermanence of all that is conditioned, as it truly is; and they examine the painfulness, impurity, unreliability, destructibility, instability, instantaneous arising and passing away, not-coming-to-be-previously, not-reaching-the-past, and nonperdurance in the present of all that is conditioned. Seeing all conditioned things in this way, the enlightening beings, seeing themselves without refuge, without protection, in grief, sadness, distress, bound by likes and dislikes, with much suffering, dejection, and turmoil, without resources, burned by the fires of lust, hatred, and delusion, filled with many diseases, cause their minds to be more and more liberated from all conditioned things and direct their minds toward enlightened knowledge. The enlightening beings also recognize the inconceivability of enlightened knowledge and recognize its incomparability, its immeasurability, its difficulty of access, its independence, its freedom from afflictions, its freedom from distress, and how it arrives at the city of fearlessness and never comes back from it, and how it saves many people.

des de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes de ltar tshad med pa mthong ste/ 'du byed kyi rnam pa de ltar sdug bsngal mang pos gtses par mthong nas/ sems can thams cad la de bas kyang shas cher sems kyi bsam pa bcu nye bar gzhog ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ mgon med pa dang / skyabs med pa dang / rten med pa'i sems kyi bsam pa dang / rtag tu phongs pa'i sems kyi bsam pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi me kun nas 'bar ba'i sems kyi bsam pa dang / srid pa'i btson ras bzung ba'i sems kyi bsam pa dang / rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par nyon mongs pa'i thibs pos bsgribs pa'i sems kyi bsam pa dang / brtag pa'i mthu med pa'i sems kyi bsam pa dang / dge ba'i chos la mos pa med pa'i sems kyi bsam pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad las shin tu gol ba'i sems kyi bsam pa dang / 'khor ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'bab pa'i sems kyi bsam pa dang / thar pa'i lam gyis dngangs pa'i sems kyi bsam pa dang / sems kyi bsam pa 'di bcu nye bar gzhog go /

“Thus observing the immeasurability of enlightened knowledge, and observing how full of ills all conditioned states are, the enlightening beings further develop ten feelings toward sentient beings: the feeling that they are without a leader or a refuge; the feeling that they are always destitute; the feeling that they are burned by the fire of passion, hostility, and folly; the feeling that they are locked in the prison of existence; the feeling that they are always veiled in sleep in the thickets of afflictions; the feeling that they are incapable of viewing things objectively; the feeling that they have abandoned the desire for good; the feeling that they have lost the way to enlightenment; the feeling that they go along with the flow of the mundane whirl; the feeling that they have lost the means to liberation.

des de ltar sems can gyi khams gtse ba mang po can mthong nas brtson 'grus 'di ltar rtsom ste/ sems can 'di dag ni bdag gis bskyab par bya ba/ yongs su dgrol bar bya ba/ yongs su sbyang bar bya ba/ shin tu gdon par bya ba/ rab tu dgod par bya ba/ shin tu brtan par bya ba/ yongs su tshim par bya ba/ gnas su phyin par bya ba/ rnam par gdul bar bya ba/ yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba yin no/ /zhes nas

“Seeing the world of sentient beings so full of afflictions, the enlightening beings arouse their energy, thinking, ‘I should rescue and liberate these beings; I should purify and emancipate them; I should lead them, direct them, make them happy, develop them, and cause them to reach perfect peace.’

de de ltar 'du byed kyi rnam pa thams cad las skyo ba'i rjes su song zhing sems can thams cad la rab tu lta ba'i rjes su song ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rjes su song zhing / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la rab tu brten pas sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab par bya ba la brtson pa de 'di ltar yongs su rtog ste/ rgyu dang / gzhi dang / tshul dang / thabs gang zhig gi 'di lta bur sdug bsngal dang; nye ba'i nyon mongs par lhung ba'i sems can 'di dag mngon par gdon par nus/ rgyu dang / gzhi dang / tshul dang / thabs gang zhig gis ni shin tu bde ba'i mya ngan las 'das par dgod par nus snyam nas/ de la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te/ bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes rnam par thar pa'i gnas ma gtogs par gzhan gyis mi nus so/ / bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes rnam par thar pa'i gnas de yang chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa ma gtogs par gzhan gyis thob par mi nus so/ / chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa yang rgyu ba med cing skye ba med pa la spyod pa'i shes rab ma gtogs par gzhan gyis khong du chud par mi nus so/ / shes rab kyi snang ba de yang bsam gtan la mkhas shing rtogs pa'i blos rab tu rtog pa med par gzhan gyis thob par mi rung ngo/ / bsam gtan la mkhas shing rtog pa'i blos rab tu rtog pa de yang thos pas mkhas pa med par mi 'byung ngo/ /zhes

“Thus disillusioned with all conditioned things, considerate toward all sentient beings, seeing the benefit in omniscience, taking refuge in enlightened knowledge, dedicated to the salvation of all beings, the enlightening beings reflect thus: ‘By what means can these beings, fallen as they are into so much misery, be lifted out of it and established in the ultimate bliss of nirvana and be caused to attain freedom from doubt about all things?’ It occurs to these enlightening beings, ‘The means to do this is nowhere else but in the realm of knowledge of unobstructed liberation; and the knowledge of unobstructed liberation is nowhere else but in awareness of all things as they are; and awareness of all things as they are is nowhere else but in transcendent knowledge of the unconditioned and unproduced; and that light of knowledge is nowhere else but in contemplation by the analytic intellect skilled in meditation; and that contemplation by the analytic intellect skilled in meditation is nowhere else but in skill in learning.’

de de ltar shin tu brtag pa'i shes pa dang ldan pas/ de bas kyang shes cher dam pa'i chos tshol ba la mngon par brtson par gnas te/ nyin mtshan du chos mnyan pa don du gnyer ba yin/ sangs rgyas kyi chos btsal ba'i don du chos la mos shing ngoms mi shes la rgyun mi 'chad pa yin/ chos la dga' zhing spro ba dang chos la rab tu 'jug pa yin/ chos la gzhol zhing chos la 'bab pa dang / chos la bab pa yin/ chos la rten cing chos la skyabs tshol ba dang / chos la mthu tshol ba yin/ chos dang gnyer ba'i chos la mngon par brtson pa yin te/ de de ltar chos tshol ba la mngon par brtson pas rin po che'i rnam pa'am/ dbyig gi rnam pa'am/ nor dang 'bru'i mdzod dang / bang ba gang yang rung ste/ yongs su mi gtong ba de lta bu gang yang med do/ / chos smra ba'i gang zag de 'ba' zhig la dka' ba'i 'du shes su gyur pa las phar/ de dag gzhan la cung zad kyang dga' ba'i 'du shes mi skyed do/ /

“The enlightening beings thus apply this contemplative knowledge to the quest of the Buddha Way, day and night intent on hearing the Teaching, desirous of the Teaching, enjoying the Teaching, delighted in the Teaching, relying on the Teaching, devoted to the Teaching, concentrated on the Teaching, intent on the Teaching, taking refuge in the Teaching, dwelling on the Teaching, saved by the Teaching, acting in accord with the Teaching.

de ni chos kyi don du phyi rol gyi dngos po nye bar bzung ba yongs su mi gtong ba de gang yang med do/ / nang gi dngos po yongs su mi gtong bar bya ba de lta bu'ang cung zad kyang med do/ / gang 'di dag 'di lta ste/ g.yog 'khor yongs su gtang ba'am/ rgyal srid yongs su gtang ba'am/ longs spyod yongs su gtang ba'am/ nor dang / 'bru dang / nor bu dang / gser gyi mdzod dang / bang ba yongs su gtang ba dang / rta dang / glang po dang / shing rta dang / bzhon pa yongs su gtang ba'am/ rin po che'i rgyan dang / lhab lhub yongs su gtang ba dang / chung ma dang / bu dang / bu mo yongs su gtang ba'am/ mgo dang / rkang lag dang / yan lag gi dam pa yongs su gtang ba'am/ lus thams cad yongs su gtang bar bya ba yang rung ste/ de dag thams cad chos kyi don du yongs su mi gtong ba gang yang med do/ / bla ma la bsnyen bkur dang / rim gror bya ba gang yang rung ste nyams su mi len pa gang yang med do/ / nga rgyal dang lhag pa'i nga rgyal yongs su gtang bas nga rgyal med pa la sbyang ba gang yang rung ste/ nyams su mi len pa gang yang med do// lus kyi gnod pa gang yang rung ste/ nyams su mi len pa gang yang med do/ / de ma thos pa'i chos kyi tshig gcig thos pa nor che bar 'dzin gyi/ stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su gang ba'i rin po che'i phung po thob pas ni ma yin no/ / legs par bshad pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig thos pas sems dga' bar 'gyur gyi/ brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i srid la bskal pa brgya stong mang po'i mthar thug par gnas pas ni ma yin no/ / de la la la zhig brgya la 'di skad du zer te/ gal te khyod kyis me'i dong chen por lus por te/ sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i phung po chen po rang gi lus kyis nyams su blang bar nus na/ ngas khyod la chos kyi tshig yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su spyad pa 'di bshad par bya'o/ / zhes na yang de 'di snyam du sems te/ chos kyi tshig yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su sbyong ba'i don du ni; stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mes gang bar yang tshangs pa'i 'jig rten nas bdag gis bdag dor bar mos na/ me'i dong tha mal pa 'di lta bu zhig tu bdag dor ba lta ci smos kyi/ de bas sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad nyams su bab pas kyang bdag gis chos btsal bar bya'i/ me'i sdug bsngal dang 'grogs pa lta khyad du gsad do/ /zhes nas de rnam pa de lta bu'i brtson 'grus rtsom pas chos yongs su tshol lo/ /
ji skad du thos pa'i chos rnams la yang tshul bzhin du rab tu rtog pa'i ngang tshul can yin te/ de chos de dag thos nas kyang / rjes la rang gi sems rtog par bzhag pas gcig pu dben pa na 'dug cing 'di ltar rtog go / chos dang gnyer ba'i chos la nan tan du bya bas sangs rgyas kyi chos khong du chud par bya ba'i tshig gi lam yongs su dag pa 'ba' zhig gis ma yin no/ /zhes te/

“While the enlightening beings are thus focused on the quest for the Buddha Way, there is nothing they do not give up—goods, supplies, dwelling, precious things, even their own bodies—and because of their desire for truth they do not consider this difficult to do; they only consider it difficult to find a person who utters the truth, who teaches even a single phrase of truth. For the sake of the Buddha Teaching there is no external thing whatsoever that they are attached to that they do not give up, and there is nothing whatsoever within themselves that they do not give up. There is no service to teachers they do not take on; there is no pride or conceit they do not abandon and no humility of action they do not accept; there is no physical suffering they do not bear. They are more glad to hear a single verse of the Teaching that they have not heard than they would be to get a galaxy full of jewels; they are more glad to hear a well-spoken verse than they would be to gain kingship; they are more glad to hear a new phrase of teaching spoken by a complete buddha purifying enlightening practice than they would be to attain godhood for many hundreds of thousands of eons. If someone should declare to the enlightening beings, ‘I too have a phrase of teaching spoken by a perfectly enlightened buddha that purifies the practice of enlightening beings, which I will tell you if you throw yourself in a great blazing pit of fire and endure the agony,’ the enlightening beings think, ‘For the sake of even a single phrase of teaching spoken by a completely enlightened buddha I could even bear to hurl myself from the heavens into a whole galaxy of fire, to say nothing of an ordinary pit of fire. Indeed, we should seek the Buddha Teaching even through all the afflictions and pains of hells, to say nothing of the pains of life in the human world.’ They seek the teachings with such heroic vigor as this, and they contemplate the teachings truthfully as they hear them. Furthermore, having heard these teachings, with profound meditation in their own minds, alone in solitary places, they think, ‘It is by realization and practice of the Teaching through appropriate methods that these doctrines of Buddha are to be followed they cannot be clarified just by talk.’

byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od byed pa la gnas shing 'dod pa rnams las dben/ sdig to dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben zhing rnam par rtog pa can; rnam par dpyod pa can/ dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba'i bsam gtan dang po la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so/ / de rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa rnam par zhi ste/ nang shin tu dang zhing sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas/ rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa med pa/ ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so/ / de dga' ba las 'dod chags dang bral te btang snyoms su gnas pas dran pa dang ldan zhing rab tu shes par bde ba yang lus kyis rab tu tshor te/ 'phags pa rnams kyis btang snyoms pa dran pa can dga' ba med la bde ba la gnas pa'o zhes bya bar bsam gtan gsum pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so/ / de bde ba yang spangs/ sdug bsngal yang spangs la bde ba'i yid dang / nyam nga ba'i yid kyang sngar nub pas sdug bsngal yang med/ bde ba yang med pa'i btang snyoms dran pas yongs su dag pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so/ /

“Enlightening beings in this stage of Refulgence leave desires and evil and unwholesome things for the sake of realization of the Teaching and its practical application: with thought and reflection, becoming aloof, joyful and blissful, they attain the first stage of meditation and abide there. By cessation of thought and reflection, inner purity, and mastery of single-mindedness, free from thought and cogitation, concentrated, joyful and blissful, they attain and abide in the second stage of meditation. By freedom from desire for joy they abide in equanimity; with mindfulness and precise knowledge, they experience physical bliss: as the sages say, those who are dispassionate, mindful, blissful, and detached from joy attain to and abide in the third stage of meditation. By the abandonment of pleasure and pain, and by the disappearance of former joy and dejection, free from both pleasure and pain, equanimous, with pure mindfulness, they attain to and abide in the fourth stage of meditation.

de gzugs su 'du shes pa las rnam pa thams cad du 'das nas/ thogs pa'i 'du shes rnam pa nub ste/ 'du shes sna tshogs yid la mi byed pas mtha' yas nam mkha' zhes te/ nam mkha' mtha' yas pa'i skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so/ / de nam mkha' mtha' yas pa'i skye mched las rnam pa thams cad du 'das nas mtha' yas rnam shes zhes te/ rnam par shes pa mtha' yas pa'i skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so/ / de rnam par shes pa'i skye mched las rnam pa thams cad du 'das nas ma yod cung zad ces te/ cung zad kyang med pa'i skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so/ / de cung zad kyang med pa'i skye mched las rnam pa thams cad du 'das nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so/ / de chos dang gnyer ba'i chos la nan tan du byas pa ma gtogs par de yang mngon par dga' ba'i gnas dang rten ma yin pas/

“By transcendence of all perceptions of form, by disappearance of all perceptions of objects, by not placing the attention on various perceptions, they attain to and abide in the realm of infinity of space, aware of infinite space. Totally transcending the realm of infinity of space, they attain to and abide in the realm of infinity of consciousness, aware of boundless consciousness. By totally transcending the realm of infinity of consciousness, they attain to and abide in the realm of nothingness, aware of the absence of anything at all. Totally transcending the realm of nothingness, they attain to and abide in the realm of neither perception nor nonperception. This is done on a basis not of enjoyment, but only for the purpose of accomplishment of practical application of the Teaching.

de byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems yangs pa/ rgya che ba/ gnyis su med pa/ tshad med pa/ kho na med pa/ ltod pa med pa/ bsgribs pa med pa/ gnod pa med pa thams cad du khyab pas 'jig rten gyi khams chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa thams cad rgyas par bkang nas nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so/ / de bzhin du snying rje dang ldan pa dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa dang / btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i sems yangs pa/ rgya che ba/ gnyis su med pa/ tshad med pa/ khon med pa/ ltod pa med pa/ bsgribs pa med pa/ gnod pa med pa/ thams cad du khyab pas 'jig rten gyi khams chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa thams cad rgyas par bkang nas nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so/ / de rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam pa du ma myong bar byed de/ sa 'di yang g.yo bar byed do/ / gcig tu gyur nas mang por 'gyur ro/ / mang por gyur nas gcig tu 'gyur ro// snang ba dang mi snang ba la'ang rab tu spyod de/ rtsig pa la thags thogs med pa dang / ra ba la thags thogs pa med pa dang / ri la yang / dper na/ nam mkha' bzhin du thags thogs med cing chags pa med par 'gro'o/ / dper na/ nam mkha' la lding ba'i bya bzhin du nam mkha' la'ang skyil mo krung gis gnas par byed do/ / chu bzhin du sa la yang nub cing 'byung bar ston to/ / sa bzhin du chu la yang 'byin pa med par 'gro'o/ / me'i phung po chen po bzhin du du ba 'thul lo/ / me lce 'bar ro/ / sprin chen po bzhin du lus las char 'bebs so/ / nyi ma dang zla ba 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che zhing 'di ltar mthu che la/ 'di ltar dbang che bar grags pa dag kyang lag pas nyug cing reg par byed do/ / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du yang lus kyis dbang bsgyur te/ de lha'i rna ba'i khams rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pas lha dang mi'i sgra gnyis ka yang nyan to/ / ring yang rung / nye yang rung ste/ chung ngu na sbrang bu dang / sha sbrang dang / bung ba dang / srin bu'i sgra yang thos so/ / de sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol gyi sems kyang sems kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te/ 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so/ / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so/ / zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang / nyon mongs dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs dang bral ba dang / che ba dang; chung ba dang / yangs pa dang / dog pa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par ma grol ba dang / skyon can dang / skyon med pa dang / sems rgya chen po la sems rgya chen po'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so/ / sems rgya chung ngu la sems rgya chung ngu'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te/ de ltar na sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol gyi sems kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so/ / de rnam pa du mar sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran te/ tshe rabs gcig kyang rjes su dran no/ / gnyis dang / gsum dang / bzhi dang / lnga dang / bcu dang / nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu dang / tshe rabs brgya yang rjes su dran no/ / tshe rabs brgya phrag du ma dang / tshe rabs stong phrag du ma dang / tshe rabs brgya stong phrag du ma dang / tshe rabs bye ba brgya stong phrag du ma nas/ tshe rabs bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du ma'i bar du rjes su dran no/ / 'du ba'i bskal pa du ma dang / 'jig pa'i bskal pa du ma dang / 'du ba dang / 'jig pa'i bskal pa du ma yang rjes su dran no/ / bskal pa brgya yang rjes su dran no/ / bskal pa stong dang / bskal pa stong phrag brgya dang / bskal pa bye ba stong phrag brgya nas bskal pa bye ba brgya stong du ma'i bar du rjes su dran no/ / bskal pa khrag khrig dang / bskal pa khrag khrig brgya dang / bskal pa khrag khrig stong dang / bskal pa khrag khrig stong phrag brgya dang / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong nas/ bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma'i bar du rjes su dran te/ bdag ni che ge mo zhig na 'dug 'dug go /ming ni 'di zhes bya'o/ / rigs ni 'di yin no/ / rus ni 'di yin no/ / kha zas ni 'di lta bu zhig zos so/ / tshe ni 'di tsam zhig tu gyur to/ / 'di srid gcig tu ring du gnas so/ / bde ba dang nyon mongs pa ni 'di lta bu zhig myong ngo/ / de nas shi 'phos nas che ge mo zhig tu skyes so/ / de nas kyang shi 'phos nas 'di lta bu zhig tu skyes so/ / zhes sa tshigs dang bcas/ mtshan ma dang bcas/ don rtags dang bcas par rnam pa du mar sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran no/ / des lha'i mig rnam par dag cing mi las 'das pas sems can rnams shi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / kha dog sdug pa dang / bde ba'i lam du phyin pa dang / ngan song du song ba dang / ngan pa dang / bzang po thams cad rab tu mthong ngo/ / las ji lta ba bzhin rjes su 'brang ba'i sems can rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te/ sems can 'di dag ni lus kyis ngan du spyod pa dang ldan pa/ ngag gis ngan du spyod pa dang ldan pa/ yid kyis ngan du spyod pa dang ldan pa/ 'phags pa rnams la skur pa 'debs pa / log par lta ba can dag ste/ log par lta ba'i las rab tu blangs pa'i rgyus lus zhig ste/ shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba/ sems can dmyal bar skye'o zhes bya ba dang / sems can 'di dag ni lus kyis legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa/ ngag gis legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa/ yid kyis legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa/ 'phags pa la skur pa mi 'debs pa/ yang dag pa'i lta ba can dag ste/ yang dag pa'i lta ba'i las rab tu blangs pa'i rgyus lus zhig ste/ shi ba'i 'og tu bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lhar skye'o zhes bya bar rab tu shes te/ de ltar na lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pas sems can 'chi ba dang / skye ba dang / kha dog sdug pa dang / kha dog mi sdug pa dang / bde 'gror song ba dang / ngan song du song ba dang / ngan pa dang / bzang po thams cad sa tshigs dang bcas/ mtshan ma dang bcas/ dan rtags dang bcas par rab tu mthong ste/ las ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su 'brang ba'i sems can rnams kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so/ / de bsam gtan dang; rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa 'di dag la snyoms par 'jug cing rnam par ldang yang gang du byang chub kyi yan lag rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i gnas ma gtogs par de dag gi dbang gis mi skye'o/ /

“With minds imbued with kindness, broad-minded, magnanimous, nondualistic, immeasurable, free from hostility and enmity, unobstructed, unafflicted, extending everywhere, they travel to the farthest reaches of the cosmos, reaching all worlds throughout space. In the same way, with minds imbued with compassion, joy, and equanimity, broad-minded, magnanimous, nondualistic, without hostility or enmity, without obstruction or affliction, reaching everywhere, they roam throughout the cosmos, to all worlds in space. They experience many kinds of miraculous actions, even shaking the earth; being one, they become multiple, and having become multiple, they become one; they are able to appear and disappear; they go through walls and even through mountains, just as through space; they travel sitting through the sky like birds; they emerge from and sink into the earth unhindered as though in water, and walk on water as on earth; they produce smoke and flames like a great bonfire and emit water from their bodies like great clouds, by which torrents this world system, set ablaze, is annihilated; even the sun and moon here, powerful and mighty, they take in hand, and extend their power even up to the heaven of Brahma; by the divine ear, purified, beyond humans, they hear both celestial and human voices, whether soft or loud, far or near, hearing even the sounds of insects; they know the minds of other beings, other persons, as they really are—they know if they are covetous or desireless, if they are hateful or not, if they are deluded or not, if they are afflicted or not, if they are small-minded or broad-minded, if they are magnanimous, if they are beyond measure, if they are confused or not, if they are concentrated or not, if they are liberated or not, if they are defiled or not, if their minds are crude or not—all this they know as it really is; in this way they know the minds of other people as they really are. They remember many former abodes: they remember one lifetime, two, three, four, five, ten, one hundred, two hundred, three hundred, four hundred, five hundred—they remember hundreds of lifetimes, many hundreds of lifetimes, many thousands of lifetimes, many hundreds of thousands of lifetimes, many hundreds of thousands of billions of trillions of lifetimes; they remember the age of becoming, the age of disintegration, the age of becoming and disintegration, and remember many ages of becoming and disintegration, hundreds of ages, thousands of ages, hundreds of thousands of ages, hundreds of millions of ages, hundreds of billions of ages, up to hundreds of billions of trillions of ages—they know, ‘I was in such and such a place named such and such, of such and such a family, of such and such a caste, with such and such a diet, with such and such a life span, abiding so long, experiencing such and such pleasures and pains; I died there and was born here, died here and was born there’—they know many kinds of former abodes, including their characteristics, appearances, and speech there. With the divine eye, purified, beyond that of humans, they see beings, dying, being born, of good character, of bad character, in good states, in bad states, inferior, superior, following the force of their deeds; they know beings as they truly are: ‘These beings are badly behaved in thought, word, and eed, they slander the sages, they entertain false views; owing to the pursuit of actions based on false views, by that cause, that condition, after the disintegration of the body and death they fall into states of woe and are born in hells. These other beings are virtuous in thought, word, and deed, they do not slander the sages, they see rightly; because of their deeds and undertaking of duty based on right views, after they die they are born in blissful states in heavens.’ Thus, by the divine eye, purified, beyond that of humans, they see beings, their characteristics, appearances, and speech, dying, being born, of good and bad appearance and character, in good or bad states, inferior and superior, according to their deeds—they know them as they truly are. They enter and arise from these meditations, liberations, concentrations, and attainments, without being born by their force. If they see somewhere where the elements of enlightenment may be fulfilled, they are purposely born there by willpower because such is the mental consistency of enlightening beings, having accomplished skill in means.

byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od byed pa'di la gnas pa'i tshe/ de'i lta ba rgya chen po dang / smon lam gyi stobs kyis sangs rgyas mang po snang bar 'gyur te/ lta ba rgya chen po dang / smon lam gyi stobs kyis sangs rgyas brgya phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas brgya stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas bye ba brgya stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas khrag khrig mang po dang / sangs rgyas khrag khrig brgya phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas khrag khrig stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas khrag khrig brgya stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang po rab tu snang bar 'gyur ro/ / des de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mthong nas bsam pa rgya chen pos rim gro byed do/ / bkur sti byed do/ / bsti stang byed do/ / mchod pa byed do/ / na bza' dang / bsod snyoms dang / gzims cha dang / snyun gyi rkyen sman dang / yo byad dag kyang 'bul zhing byang chub sems dpa'i bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyang yongs su 'bul lo/ / dge 'dun gyi tshogs rnams la yang yang dag par mchod pa byed de/ dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o/ / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag la bsnyen bkur byed cing de dag las rim gror chos nyan to/ / len to/ / 'dzin to/ / thos nas kyang ci tshul du nan tan gyi yang dag par bsgrub ste/ de chos thams cad la 'pho ba med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba shes pas rab tu lta zhing rtog pas kyang 'dod pa'i bcings pa thams cad bsrabs par 'gyur ro/ / srid pa'i bcings pa thams cad bsrabs par 'gyur ro/ / ma rig pa'i bcings pa thams cad bsrabs par 'gyur ro/ / lta ba las byung ba'i bcings pa rnams ni snga nas kyang byang ba yin te/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od byed pa'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i log pa'i 'dod chags ni bskal pa du ma dang / bskal pa brgya phrag du ma dang / bskal pa stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa brgya stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa bye ba brgya stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa khrag khrig phrag du ma dang / bskal pa khrag khrig brgya phrag du ma dang / bskal pa khrag khrig stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du mar spangs shing mi gsog par gnas so/ / log pa'i zhe sdang spangs shing mi gsog par gnas so/ / log pa'i gti mug spangs shing mi gsog par gnas te/ dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang yongs su byang ba dang / yongs su dag pa dang / las su rung bar gyur par gnas so/ / kye/ rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di lta ste/ dper na/ gser gyi sa le sbram de nyid mgar ba mkhas pa'i lag na spyod na srang grangs ci yod pa'i tshad bzhin du 'dug go / kye/ rgyal pa'i sras dag /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od byed pa'di la gnas pa'i log pa'i 'dod chags kyang 'grib pa med par 'byang bar 'gyur ro/ / log pa'i zhe sdang yang 'grib pa med par 'byang bar 'gyur ro/ / log pa'i gti mug kyang 'grib pa med par 'byang bar 'gyur ro/ / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang rab tu 'byang zhing yongs su dag pa dang / las su rung bar 'gyur ro/ /

“The enlightening beings in this stage of Refulgence see many buddhas, by great vision and the power of will they see many hundreds of buddhas, many hundreds of thousands, millions, billions, trillions of buddhas, by great vision and willpower. Having seen those buddhas, those completely enlightened ones, they honor and make offerings to them with great earnestness, providing them with food, clothing, medicines, and seats and beds. They also provide comforts for enlightening beings and honor the religious community. They dedicate these roots of goodness to consummate enlightenment. They also attend those buddhas, respectfully listen to their teachings, take up and maintain the teachings, cause them to be repeated, and apply and practice them according to their ability. They observe the absence of process and nonextinction and conditionality of all things; all their bonds of desire become weaker, all their bonds to form, all their bonds to existence, all their bonds of ignorance become weaker, and their bonds caused by views have already been removed. Wrong desires are gone from the enlightening beings in the stage of Refulgence because of countless eons of nonaccumulation, and so are wrong hatred and misguided delusions, because they do not produce or accumulate them. Their roots of goodness become clarified, purified, and useful. Just as gold in the hands of a skillful smith remains the same weight, in the same way the wrong desire, hatred, and delusion are gone from the enlightening beings in the stage of Refulgence, not being accumulated for countless ages, while their roots of goodness become clarified and purified and useful.

de bzod pa dang nges pa yang de bas kyang yongs su dag par 'gyur ro/ / grogs la bde zhing nges pa'i bsam pa dang; mi 'khrugs pa'i bsam pa dang / glong ba med pa'i bsam pa dang / rnyog pa med pa'i bsam pa dang / mtho dman med pa'i bsam pa dang / sems can la phan 'dogs pas lan mi re ba'i bsam pa dang / phan btags pa la phyir lan glon pa'i bsam pa dang / g.yo med cing sgyu med pa'i bsam pa dang / thibs po med pa'i bsam pa yang yongs su dag par 'gyur te/ de'i bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi las don grub pa'i shas che ba yin/ pha rol tu phyin pa bcu las bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa shas che ba yin te/ lhag ma rnams kyang ci tshul ci nus su yang dag par mi sgrub pa ma yin te/

“Furthermore, their patience and gentleness are purified, as well as their friendliness, freedom from anger, imperturbability, calmness, freedom from pride and self-abasement, freedom from desire to be honored, freedom from desire for reward for what they do, honesty, and nonentanglement—all these are purified. For them, among the four means of salvation, beneficial action is paramount, and among the ten transcendent ways, transcendent tolerance is paramount, while they practice the others according to their power.

kye/ rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od byed pa zhes bya ste / byang chub sems dpa'i sa gsum pa'o/ / de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni phal cher lha'i rgyal po'i dbang po 'gyur te/ sems can rnams kyi 'dod pa'i 'dod chags rnam par bzlog pa'i thabs nye bar bsgrubs pa la mkhas shing mthu yod pa yin/ de sbyin pa'am/ ngag snyan pa'am/ don bsgrub pa'am/ don mthun pas dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ci rtsom yang rung ste/ de thams cad ji ltar na sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur/ gtso bor 'gyur/ thu bor 'gyur/ phul du 'gyur/ dam par 'gyur / bla na med par 'gyur/ 'dren par 'gyur/ rnam par 'dren par 'gyur/ yongs su 'dren par 'gyur ba nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la rten pa'i bar du 'gyur snyam ste/ sangs rgyas yid la bya ba dang / chos yid la bya ba dang / dge 'dun yid la bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' yid la bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yid la bya ba dang; byang chub sems dpa'i sa yid la bya ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa yid la bya ba dang / stobs yid la bya ba dang / mi 'jigs pa yid la bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa yid la bya ba nas/ rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar du yid la bya ba dang mi 'bral ba yin te/ de 'dod na skad cig yud tsam thang cig tu ting nge 'dzin brgya stong rab tu thob cing de dag la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas brgya stong mthong ba dang / de dag gi byin gyi rlabs kyang yang dag par shes pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams brgya stong skyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgya stong du 'gro ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams brgya stong snang bar bya ba dang / sems can brgya stong yongs su smin par bya ba dang / bskal pa brgya stong du gnas par bya ba dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa brgya stong la rab tu 'jug pa dang / chos kyi sgo brgya stong rnam par 'byed pa dang / lus brgya stong yongs su bstan pa dang / lus re re la yang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor brgya stong yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i brtson 'grus kyi rnam pa de lta bu rtsom mo/ / de yan chad byang chub sems dpa' smon lam gyi mthu can rnams smon lam gyi khyad par gyis rnam par 'phrul te/ de dag gi lus sam/ 'od dam/ rdzu 'phrul lam/ mig gam/ spyod yul lam/ dbyangs sam/ spyod pa'am/ rgyan tam; byin gyi rlabs sam/ mos pa'am/ mngon par 'du byed pa dag kyang bskal pa du ma dang / bskal pa brgya phrag du ma dang / bskal pa stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa brgya stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du ma'i bar gyis bgrang bar dka'o/ /

“This is a summary of the third stage of enlightening beings, the stage of Refulgence. The majority of the enlightening beings in this stage are Indras, chiefs of the celestial beings of the thirty-three heavens, capable, powerful, providing means of detaching beings from lust and desire, skilled in extricating beings from the mud of desire. Whatever the enlightening beings do—whether by charity, kind speech, beneficial action, or cooperation—their thoughts are always fixed on Buddha, the Teaching, the Community, enlightening beings, the practices of enlightening beings, the transcendent ways, the stages, the expertises and unique qualities of buddhas, including complete omniscience. To what purpose? To become the best of beings, unexcelled leaders and guides, and ultimately omniscient refuges.
“Those who seek to be thus undertake the appropriate effort, by which they instantly attain a hundred thousand concentrations, see a hundred thousand buddhas and recognize their power, shake a hundred thousand worlds, go to a hundred thousand lands, illumine a hundred thousand worlds, mature a hundred thousand beings, live for a hundred thousand eons, penetrate a hundred thousand eons past and future, contemplate a hundred thousand teachings, and manifest a hundred thousand bodies, each body accompanied by a hundred thousand enlightening beings. Then enlightening beings with the power of vows perform, by the excellence of their vows, countless transformations of their bodies, auras, mystic powers, vision, spheres of operation, voices, conduct, adornments, power, resolutions, and performances.”
de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdo rje'i snying pos don 'di nyid yang brtag pa dang bstan par bya ba'i phyir de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then Diamond Matrix spoke these verses explaining the meaning of this stage:

de dag yon tan 'byung gnas bsam dag sems des pa/ / skyo zhing 'dod chags bral te 'tshe med sems dang ldan/ / sems bskyed bstan pa dga' ldan rgya chen shugs can rnams/ / mkhas pa bdag nyid che ba'i sems ldan gsum pa gnon/ /
'od byed sa phyogs 'di la gnas pa'i mkhas pa ni/ / sdug bsngal mi rtag mi sdug rab tu 'jig chos dang / / ring por mi gnas skad cig snying po med par ni/ / 'dus byas rnam pa 'ong ba med la rab tu rtog /
nad du gyur pa mya ngan smre sngags 'don dang bcas/ / gnod dang 'khrug dang sdug dang mi sdug rjes 'brang ba/ / sdug bsngal yid blong phung po 'bar ba'i me 'dra bar/ / 'dus byas mtha' yas kun nas 'bar mthong de las skyod/ /
srid pa gsum po kun las skyo zhing ltos sems med/ / bde gshegs ye shes 'dod cing blo gzhan med pa ste/ / bsam du med cing gzhal yas pha rol mtha' yas pa'i/ / rgyal pa'i ye shes gnod med de dag rab tu mthong / /
de dag sangs rgyas ye shes gnod med mthong gyur nas/ / skyabs med mgon dang bral pa rab tu dgrol ba'i phyir/ / rtag tu dbul zhing me gsum kun nas 'bar gyur dang / / srid pa'i btson rar sdug bsngal sna brgyas sems bskor cing / /
nyon mongs bsgribs dang rnam par lta dang 'dod nyams pa/ / bde gshegs chos kyi dga' ba stor ba'i byis pa rnams/ / 'khor ba'i rgyud du 'bab cing thar pas dngangs gyur pa/ / bdag gis bskyabs pa yin zhes brtson 'grus dam du rtsom; ;
ye shes 'dod pas ltos pa med par 'gro don byed/ / gang rgyus rnam thar lam gyi rgyud ni gang zhes rtog / bde gshegs ye shes bsgribs pa med las gzhan med na/ / bde gshegs ye shes de yang shes rab mthus 'byung ste/ /
shes rab thos las 'byung bar byang chub sems dpa' rtog / de ltar shes nas thos don spyad par brtson 'grus rtsom/ / nyin mtshan nyan pa'i rgyur spyod bya ba gzhan med par/ / chos kyi don gnyer chos la rab tu rten pa yin/ /
nor bu mu tig rin chen tshogs dang mdza' gnyen dang / / srid longs du ma pho brang phun ldan dam pa dang / / chung ma dag dang bu dang mthun par spyod ba'i 'khor/ / ltos med sems kyis mkhas pa chos kyi don du gtong / /
mgo dang rkang lag mig dang de bzhin bdag gi sha / lce dang mche ba rna ba sna dang khrag rnams dang / / phangs pa'i rkang dang snying phyung yongs su gtong bar byed/ / 'di ni dka' bar mi rtsi thos pa de dkar rtsi/ /
la la de drung 'ongs shing de skad smrar gyur te/ / de ste me lce mi bzad 'bar dong mchong phod na/ / bde gshegs bstan chos rin chen bshad do zhes na yang / / thos nas mi dma'i yid kyis yon tan don du mchod/ /
chos kyi tshig gcig don du ri rab brtses btags par/ / stong gsum mes bkang tshangs ris yul nas mchongs gyur kyang / / da dung rgyal ba'i byang chub yangs pa thob dka' na/ / de ste tha mal mi bdes rnyed 'gyur shin tu bde/ /
drang srong mchog gi ye shes 'thob 'gyur ji srid pa/ / de srid bar du mnar med sdug bsngal bzod bya na/ / mi yi sdug bsngal phung po sna tshogs ci smos kyi/ / chos rab mnyam pa'i don du bdag gis nyams blang zhes/ /
chos rnams thos par gyur nas tshul bzhin sems par byed/ / bsam gtan tshad med de bzhin gzugs med rnam pa bzhi/ / mngon par shes pa'i dam pa lnga po mngon sgrub kyang / / de dag dbang gis skye bar de dag 'gyur ba min/ /
legs ldan 'di gnas sangs rgyas khrag khrig mang po la/ / mchod par byed cing des rtogs yid kyis chos kyang nyan/ / bsrabs par gyur cing log bral yongs su dag par 'gyur/ / skyon med gser sbram ji ltar srang la gcal ba bzhin/ /
de gnas yon tan ldan pa lha yi bdag po ste/ / dbang sgyur don byed 'dod pa'i nad kyi rnam pa sel/ / lha mang sna tshogs du ma dge ba'i lam la dgod/ / sangs rgyas yon tan mngon 'dod bsam pa gzhan yang med/ /
'di la gnas pa'i rgyal sras brtson 'grus rab rtsom ste/ / brgya phrag stong las mi nyung ting 'dzin thob pa yin/ / mtshan rab sku brgyan sangs rgyas rnams kyang rab tu mthong / / yan chad smon lam rab ldan yon tan bsam mi khyab/ /

With pure minds, full of virtue, keen of mind, Dispassionate and unregressing, Steadfast, ardent, firm, energetic, magnanimous, They enter the third stage.
In the third stage, Refulgence, they contemplate The principle of suffering, impermanence, impurity, Dissolution, evanescence, momentariness, inefficiency, And absence of coming and going, of all that is conditioned.
They see the conditioned as sickness, accompanied by grief and lament, Affliction, bound by attraction and aversion, An abode of suffering and unhappiness, like blazing fire, All this endlessly arising together.
Disillusioned with all states of being, unattached, Single-mindedly seeking enlightened knowledge, They see the knowledge of buddhas as inconceivable, Unthinkable, incomparable, free from affliction.
Seeing buddha-knowledge free from all ills, They pity those who are helpless, forever destitute, Burned by the fires of passion and folly, Minds bound by a hundred miseries in hellish existences.
They undertake steadfast effort to save those veiled in afflictions, Those who are without insight, who have little will, Who are deprived of the jewel of the way of enlightenment, Following the flow of the mundane whirl, afraid of liberation.
Seeking knowledge, unattached, acting for the sake of the world, They consider how the liberation of the world may be caused— It is nowhere but in the unobstructed knowledge of the enlightened, And the endless knowledge of Buddhas is born of wisdom.
Reflecting that wisdom comes from learning, Enlightening beings strive diligently as learners; Day and night, in the cause of learning, doing nothing else, They seek the truth as the ultimate goal.
Collections of jewels and pearls, beloved relatives, Sovereignty, endless kinds of cities and fine abodes, Spouses and children, agreeable companions— All they relinquish without attachment for the sake of truth.
Head, hands, feet, eyes, flesh, tongue, teeth, ears, Heart, blood, bones, marrow, They gladly give away, not considering it hard, Only considering it hard to get to hear the truth.
If someone should tell them He would give a jewel of the Buddha’s teaching To anyone who would jump into a blazing fire, They would jump in without anxiety.
For a single phrase of the Teaching they would leap From the heavens into a galaxy of fire: How hard is this supreme enlightenment of buddhas to attain, That is gained by such human suffering?
They would endure the unremitting pains of hell For as long as it takes to attain the knowledge of the seers, To say nothing of the mass of pain of the human world— They will accept pain for the sake of the supreme Teaching.
And having heard the Teaching, they think about it reasonably And accomplish the four meditations, immeasurable minds, Formless trances, and five supreme mystic knowledges, But, having mastered them, are not born under their sway.
Here the bearers of virtue pay honor to myriad buddhas And with doubt-free minds listen to the Teaching; In this stage they become free from error, purified, Like gold freed from dross, undiminished.
Here the virtuous ones undertake celestial lordship, Powerful, free from lust, Making manifold groups of people virtuous and dispassionate, Intent on seeking the qualities of buddhahood.
Here enlightening beings undertake vigorous effort; Having attained a full hundred thousand concentrations, They see buddhas’ bodies’ various eminent characteristics, And infinitely more qualities, by superlative will.
de ltar sa mchog gsum pa 'di/ / 'jig rten kun la phan brtson pa'i/ / byang chub sems dpa'i mchog rnams la/ / rgyal ba'i sras kyis bstan pa yin/ /
“This has been an explanation of the third stage of enlightening beings, who seek benefit for all people.”
'od byed pa zhes bya ba ste/ / byang chub sems dpa'i sa gsum pa'o/ /

sa mchog dam pa yid 'ong phul gyi/ / spyod pa yangs pa 'di 'dra thos nas/ / rgyal sras yid dga' shin tu mgu gyur/ / rgyal ba la ni me tog mngon 'thor/ /
chos 'di shin tu bstan cing brjod pas/ / lan gangs chen mtsho yang g.yos 'gyur/ / lha yi bu mo yid 'ong snyan pa'i/ / glu yi dbyangs su chos rab dbyangs len/ /
dbang sgyur lha dbang shin tu yid dga'/ / bde gshegs rin chen lha rdzas nor 'thor/ / don 'grub yon tan pha rol phyin pa'i/ / rgyal ba de tshe gsung rab sgrog mdzad/ /
ci phyir zhe na chos kyi dam pa/ / rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod rab/ / de ring 'dir thos mkhas pa'i sa de/ / bskal pa brgya yang thos par rab dka'/ /
rgyal sras mkhas la spyod pa'i dam pa/ / lha dang mi la phan pas yang shod/ / sa don nges pa ma nor lam 'di/ / lha ma nga 'di dag yid dga' nyan 'gyur/ /

Thus having heard of this far-reaching practice, this lofty, eminent stage, the enlightening beings were delighted and showered the Buddha with flowers. When this teaching was spoken, the oceans and earth trembled; beautiful devoted goddesses reveled in the Teaching in song, while the gods, overjoyed, showered heavenly jewels on the Buddha and said, “A victor who speaks beneficially has arisen, having reached the ultimate weal and virtue. We have now heard of the superlative way, the supreme conduct of enlightening beings, the stage of the wise, which is hard to get to hear of even in a hundred eons. Speak further, O sage, for the benefit of heaven and earth, of the excellent practice of enlightening beings. This crowd of celestials wants to hear the definitive, exhaustive truth.”
bde bar gshegs pa'i sras po la/ / rnam thar zla bas yang smras pa/ / bzhi por yang dag 'bar ba yi/ / spyod yul mkhas pas bshad par mdzod/ /
Moon of Liberation said to Diamond Matrix, “Heroic speaker, tell the enlightening beings of the exalted state of those who enter the fourth stage.”

byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos smras pa/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dang / / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sa gsum pa la snang ba shin tu sbyangs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bzhi pa yongs su gnon to/ / de chos snang ba la 'jug pa bcu yongs su gnon te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ sems can gyi khams rnam par dpyad pa snang ba la 'jug pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par dpyad pa snang ba la 'jug pa dang / chos kyi khams rnam par dpyad pa snang ba la 'jug pa dang / nam mkha'i khams rnam par spyad pa snang ba la 'jug pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams rnam par dpyad pa snang ba la 'jug pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams rnam par dpyad pa snang ba la 'jug pa dang / gzugs kyi khams rnam par dpyad pa snang ba la 'jug pa dang / gzugs med pa'i khams rnam par dpyad pa snang ba la 'jug pa dang / bsam pa dang mos pa yangs pa'i khams rnam par dpyad pa snang ba la 'jug pa dang / bdag nyid che ba'i bsam pa dang / mos pa'i khams rnam par dpyad pa snang ba la 'jug pa dang; chos snang ba la 'jug pa bcu po 'di dag gis yongs su gnon to/ /

Diamond Matrix said, “Whoever has thoroughly purified vision in the third stage enters the fourth stage. One attains this stage by ten entries into the light of the Teaching: by entry into the light through contemplation of the realms of beings; by entry into the light through contemplation of the realms of the world; by entry into the light through contemplation of the realms of phenomena and principles; by entry into the light through contemplation of the realm of space; by entry into the light through contemplation of the realm of consciousness; by entry into the light through contemplation of the realm of desire; by entry into the light through contemplation of the realm of form; by entry into the light through contemplation of the realm of formlessness; by entry into the light through contemplation of the realm of high-minded devotion; and by entry into the light through contemplation of the realm of inclinations of the magnanimous mind.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de la byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od 'phro ba can thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su de'i bdag nyid kyi chos rab tu 'thob pa'i phyir ye shes yongs su smin par byed pa'i chos bcus yang dag par 'byung ba yin/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ phyir mi ldog pa'i bsam pa dang / dkon mchog gsum la dad pa mi phyed pa rab tu thob pa'i mthar thug pa dang / 'du byed skye ba dang / 'jig par rnam par bsgom pa dang / rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa rnam par bsgom pa dang / 'jig rten rgyu zhing ldog pa rnam par bsgom pa dang / las kyi srid par skye ba rnam par bsgom pa dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa rnam par bsgom pa dang / sems can gyi zhing dang las rnam par bsgom pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' rnam par bsgom pa dang / med pa'i mtha' dang zad pa'i mtha' rnam par bsgom pa ste/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag/ ye shes yongs su smin par byed pa'i chos bcu po 'di dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su de'i bdag nyid kyi chos rab tu 'thob pa'i phyir yang dag par byung ba yin/

“Here, in this fourth stage, called Blazing, simultaneous with the attainment of this stage the enlightening beings are born in the family of buddhas, so as to attain the qualities proper to it by means of ten things that develop and mature knowledge: by nonregressing will; by ultimate unbreakable faith in the three treasures; by contemplation of the origination and extinction of conditioned things; by contemplation of the nonorigination of inherent nature; by contemplation of the formation and disintegration of worlds; by contemplation of coming into existence due to actions; by contemplation of the mundane whirl and nirvana; by contemplation of actions of beings and lands; by contemplation of past and future; and by contemplation of nonbeing and nonanmhilation. Having embodied these ten things that mature knowledge, enlightening beings are born in the family of buddhas by attainment of the principles that are proper to it.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od 'phro ba can la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni yongs su sbyong ba dang ldan zhing / shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan par 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par spangs te/ nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta bar gnas so/ / yongs su sbyong ba dang ldan zhing shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan par 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang yid mi bde ba rnam par spad [\?] te/ phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta bar gnas so/ / spyod pa dang ldan zhing shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan par 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang yid mi bde ba rnam par spangs te/ phyi nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta bar gnas so/ / de bzhin du nang gi tshor ba dang / phyi rol gyi tshor ba dang / phyi nang gi tshor ba dang / de bzhin du nang gi sems dang / phyi rol gyi sems dang / phyi nang gi sems la lta ste/ sbyong ba dang ldan zhing shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan par 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par spangs te/ nang gi chos la chos kyi rjes su lta bar gnas so/ / yongs su sbyong ba dang ldan zhing shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan par 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang yid mi bde ba rnam par spangs te/ phyi rol gyi chos la chos kyi rjes su lta bar gnas so/ / yongs su sbyong ba dang ldan zhing shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan par 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par spangs te/ phyi nang gi chos la chos kyi rjes su lta bar gnas so/ / de sdig to dang mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skye ba'i phyir dad pa bskyed do/ / rtsol lo/ / brtson 'grus rtsom mo/ / sems rab tu 'dzin te/ / smon lam yang dag par 'debs so/ / sdig to dang mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnam par spang ba'i phyir dad pa bskyed do/ / rtsol lo/ / brtson 'grus rtsom mo/ / sems rab tu 'dzin to/ / smon lam yang dag par 'debs so/ / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skye bar 'gyur bar dad pa bskyed do/ / rtsol lo/ / brtson 'grus rtsom mo/ / sems rab tu 'dzin to/ / smon lam yang dag par 'debs so/ / dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / mi nyams pa dang / rgya cher 'gyur ba dang / de bas kyang 'phel bar 'gyur ba dang / bsgom pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir dad pa bskyed do/ / rtsol lo/ / brtson 'grus rtsom mo/ / sems rab tu 'dzin to/ / smon lam yang dag par 'debs so/ / de mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dben pa la gnas pa/ 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa/ 'gog pa la gnas pa/ rnam par spangs pas yongs su grub pa yongs su sgom mo/ / brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dben pa la gnas pa/ 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa/ 'gog pa la gnas pa/ rnam par spangs pas yongs su grub pa yongs su sgom mo/ / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dben pa la gnas pa/ 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa/ 'gog pa la gnas pa/ rnam par spangs pas yongs su grub pa yongs su sgom mo/ / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dben pa la gnas pa/ 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa/ 'gog pa la gnas pa/ rnam par spangs pas yongs su grub pa yongs su sgom mo/ / / dad pa'i dbang po dben pa la gnas pa/ 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa/ 'gog pa la gnas pa/ rnam par spangs pas yongs su grub pa yongs su sgom mo/ / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dben pa la gnas pa/ 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa/ 'gog pa la gnas pa/ rnam par spangs pas yongs su grub pa yongs su sgom mo/ / dran pa'i dbang po dben pa la gnas pa/ 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa/ 'gog pa la gnas pa/ rnam par spangs pas yongs su grub pa yongs su sgom mo/ / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dben pa la gnas pa/ 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa/ 'gog pa la gnas pa/ rnam par spangs pas yongs su grub pa yongs su sgom mo/ / shes rab kyi dbang po dben pa la gnas pa/ 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa/ 'gog pa la gnas pa/ rnam par spangs pas yongs su grub pa yongs su sgom mo/ / dad pa'i stobs dben pa la gnas pa/ 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa/ 'gog pa la gnas pa/ rnam par spangs pas yongs su grub pa yongs su sgom mo/ / brtson 'grus kyi stobs dben pa la gnas pa/ 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa/ 'gog pa la gnas pa/ rnam par spangs pas yongs su grub pa yongs su sgom mo/ / dran pa'i stobs dben pa la gnas pa/ 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa/ 'gog pa la gnas pa/ rnam par spangs pas yongs su grub pa yongs su sgom mo/ / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dben pa la gnas pa/ 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa/ 'gog pa la gnas pa/ rnam par spangs pas yongs su grub pa yongs su sgom mo/ / shes rab kyi stobs dben pa la gnas pa/ 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa/ 'gog pa la gnas pa/ rnam par spangs pas yongs su grub pa yongs su sgom mo/ / dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dben pa la gnas pa/ 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa/ 'gog pa la gnas pa/ rnam par spangs pas yongs su grub pa yongs su sgom mo/ / chos rnam par dbye ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dben pa la gnas pa/ 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa/ 'gog pa la gnas pa/ rnam par spangs pas yongs su grub pa yongs su sgom mo/ / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dben pa la gnas pa/ 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa/ 'gog pa la gnas pa/ rnam par spangs pas yongs su grub pa yongs su sgom mo/ / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dben pa la gnas pa/ 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa/ 'gog pa la gnas pa/ rnam par spangs pas yongs su grub pa yongs su sgom mo/ / bag yod pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dben pa la gnas pa / 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa/ 'gog pa la gnas pa/ rnam par spangs pas yongs su grub pa yongs su sgom mo/ / ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dben pa la gnas pa/ 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa/ 'gog pa la gnas pa/ rnam par spangs pas yongs su grub pa yongs su sgom mo/ / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dben pa la gnas pa/ 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa/ 'gog pa la gnas pa/ rnam par spangs pas yongs su grub pa yongs su sgom mo; ; yang dag pa'i lta ba dben pa la gnas pa/ 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa/ 'gog pa la gnas pa/ rnam par spangs pas yongs su grub pa yongs su sgom mo; ; yang dag pa'i rtog pa dben pa la gnas pa/ 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa/ 'gog pa la gnas pa/ / rnam par spangs pas yongs su grub pa yongs su sgom mo/ / yang dag pa'i dag dben pa la gnas pa/ 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa/ 'gog pa la gnas pa/ rnam par spangs pas yongs su grub pa yongs su sgom mo/ / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dben pa la gnas pa/ 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa/ 'gog pa la gnas pa/ rnam par spangs pas yongs su grub pa yongs su sgom mo/ / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dben pa la gnas pa/ 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa/ 'gog pa la gnas pa/ rnam par spangs pas yongs su grub pa yongs su sgom mo/ / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dben pa la gnas pa/ 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa/ 'gog pa la gnas pa/ rnam par spangs pas yongs su grub pa yongs su sgom mo/ / yang dag pa'i dran pa dben pa la gnas pa/ 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa/ 'gog pa la gnas pa/ rnam par spangs pas yongs su grub pa yongs su sgom mo/ / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dben pa la gnas pa/ 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa/ 'gog pa la gnas pa/ rnam par spangs pas yongs su grub pa yongs su sgom mo/ / de dag kyang sems can thams cad la lta ba dang / sngon gyi smon lam mngon par bsgrubs pas nye bar brtan pa dang / snying rje chen po sngon du btang ba dang / byams pa chen po dang ldan par bya ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la dmigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing bsgrub cing rgyan mngon par grub par bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang / gzugs dang / mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang po dang / dbyangs kyi yan lag dang / gsung phun sum tshogs pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang / gong nas gong du khyad par du 'gyur ba'i chos yongs su btsal ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par thar pa zab mo thos pa khong du chud par bya ba dang / shes rab dang thabs la shin tu mkhas pas rnam par spyod pa'i phyir ro/ /

“Furthermore, the enlightening beings in this Blazing stage carry on examination of the inner body vigorously, with precise awareness and mindfulness, getting rid of worldly desire and dejection. They carry on examination of the external body vigorously, with precise awareness and mindfulness, getting rid of worldly desire and dejection. They do the same to internal sensation, external sensation, and internal and external sensation, to the internal mind, the external mind, and the internal and external mind. They carry on examination of internal phenomena, precisely aware and mindful, getting rid of worldly desire and dejection. They carry on examination of external phenomena, precisely aware and mindful, getting rid of worldly desire and dejection. They carry on examination of internal and external phenomena, precisely aware and mindful, getting rid of worldly desire and dejection.
“The enlightening beings will and strive for the nonarising of bad and unwholesome states that have not yet arisen; they initiate vigorous effort, commanding the mind and directing it properly. They will and strive for the destruction of bad and unwholesome states that have arisen, initiating vigorous effort, commanding the mind and directing it properly. They will and strive for the arising of good states that have not yet arisen, initiating vigorous effort, commanding the mind and directing it properly. They will and strive for the stabilization, prevention of loss, augmentation, increased production and cultivation, and complete fulfillment of good states that have already arisen, initiating vigorous effort, commanding the mind and directing it properly.
“They develop the basis of mystical power of will combined with concentration and exertion, based on detachment, based on dispassion, based on extinction, given to relinquishment. They develop the basis of mystical power of energy combined with concentration and exertion, based on detachment, based on dispassion, based on extinction, given to relinquishment. They develop the basis of mystical power of attention combined with concentration and exertion, based on detachment, based on dispassion, based on extinction, given to relinquishment. They develop the basis of mystical power of contemplation combined with concentration and exertion, based on detachment, based on dispassion, based on extinction, given to relinquishment.
“They develop the faculty of faith, based on detachment, based on dispassion, based on extinction, given to relinquishment. They develop the faculty of energy, based on detachment, based on dispassion, based on extinction, given to relinquishment. They develop the faculty of recollection, based on detachment, based on dispassion, based on extinction, given to relinquishment. They develop the faculty of concentration, based on detachment, based on dispassion, based on extinction, given to relinquishment. They develop the faculty of wisdom, based on detachment, based on dispassion, based on extinction, given to relinquishment.
“They develop the power of faith, based on detachment, based on dispassion, based on extinction, given to relinquishment. They develop the power of energy, based on detachment, based on dispassion, based on extinction, given to relinquishment. They develop the power of recollection, based on detachment, based on dispassion, based on extinction, given to relinquishment. They develop the power of concentration, based on detachment, based on dispassion, based on extinction, given to relinquishment. They develop the power of wisdom, based on detachment, based on dispassion, based on extinction, given to relinquishment.
“They develop the branch of enlightenment of mindfulness, based on detachment, based on dispassion, based on extinction, given to relinquishment. They develop the branch of enlightenment of investigation of things, based on detachment, based on dispassion, based on extinction, given to relinquishment. They develop the branch of enlightenment of energy, based on detachment, based on dispassion, based on extinction, given to relinquishment. They develop the branch of enlightenment of joy, based on detachment, based on dispassion, based on extinction, given to relinquishment. They develop the branch of enlightenment of tranquillity, based on detachment, based on dispassion, based on extinction, given to relinquishment. They develop the branch of enlightenment of concentration, based on detachment, based on dispassion, based on extinction, given to relinquishment. They develop the limb of enlightenment of equanimity, based on detachment, based on dispassion, based on extinction, given to relinquishment.
“They develop right thought, based on detachment, based on dispassion, based on extinction, given to relinquishment. They develop right seeing, based on detachment, based on dispassion, based on extinction, given to relinquishment. They develop right speech, based on detachment, based on dispassion, based on extinction, given to relinquishment. They develop right action, based on detachment, based on dispassion, based on extinction, given to relinquishment. They develop right livelihood, based on detachment, based on dispassion, based on extinction, given to relinquishment. They develop right effort, based on detachment, based on dispassion, based on extinction, given to relinquishment. They develop right mindfulness, based on detachment, based on dispassion, based on extinction, given to relinquishment. They develop right concentration, based on detachment, based on dispassion, based on extinction, given to relinquishment.
“Furthermore, all this is due to concern for all beings, due to the support of carrying out past vows, due to being led by great compassion, due to realization of great kindness, due to being principally focused on omniscience, due to being engaged in the full accomplishment of the powers, expertise, unique qualities, marks, embellishments, and voice of all enlightened ones, due to being in quest of the final supreme truth, due to following what is learned of the liberation of the profound teaching of buddhas, and due to reflection on the great power of skill in liberative means.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od 'phro ba can'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gang 'di la 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa bdag tu mngon par chags pa dang / sems can du mngon par chags pa dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / gang zag dang / shed bdag dang / shed las skyes pa la mngon par chags pa dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la mngon par chags pa las byung ba/ brkyang ba dang / bskum pa dang / rnam par brtags pa dang / rnam par dpyad pa dang / dran pa dang / bdag gir byas pa dang / nor du byas pa dang / brtan pa'i gnas su gyur pa de dag thams cad kyi thams cad du rab tu shes so/ / rab tu spong ngo/ / de 'di ltar las gang bya ba'i mi cha ba yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis smad pa/ kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa de dag thams cad kyi thams cad du spong ngo/ / las gang bya ba'i rigs pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bsngags pa/ byang chub kyi lam gyi tshogs dang mthun pa/ de dag yang dag par blangs shing gnas te/ de phyir zhing ji lta ji ltar thabs dang shes rab kyis mngon par bsgrubs pa'i lam yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyir lam gyi yan lag rnams sgom pa/ de lta de ltar 'jam pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin/ mnyen pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin/ las su rung ba'i sems dang ldan pa yin/ phan pa dang bde ba skyed pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin/ kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin/ gong nas gong du khyad par yongs su tshol ba'i sems dang ldan pa yin/ ye shes kyi khyad par la mos pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin/ 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin/ bla ma la rim gro bya ba dang mthun
