pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin/ ji skad du thos pa'i chos la nan tan du byed pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin te/ de ni byas pa shes pas drin du gzo ba yin/ 'grogs na bde zhing des pa yin/ 'jam zhing mnyen pa yin/ sgyu med cing nga rgyal med pa thibs po med par spyod pa yin/ mthun par 'dzin cing nga lo bde ba yin te/ de de ltar bzod pa dang ldan/ de ltar dul ba dang ldan/ de ltar zhi ba dang ldan te/ de ltar bzod cing dul ba zhi ba dang ldan pas/ gong du sa yongs su sbyong ba'i las rnams yid la byed cing yang dag par spyod pas phyir mi ldog pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin/ rgyun ma chad pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin; kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin/ zlog par mi nus pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin/ skyo ba med pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin/ yangs pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin/ mtha' yas pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin/ shin tu sbyangs pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin/ mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin/ mi 'phrogs pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin/ sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin; tshul dang mi tshul ba bye brag phyed pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin te/ phyir zhing de'i bsam pa'i khams yongs su dag par 'gyur ro/ / lhag pa'i bsam pa'i khams dang rnam par mi 'bral lo/ / mos pa'i khams kyang shin tu byang bar 'gyur ro/ / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par 'phel ba dang yongs su skye'o/ / 'jig rten gyi dri ma'i rnyog pa dang yang bral bar 'gyur ro/ / the tshom dang / yid gnyis dang / nem nur yang rgyun chad par 'gyur ro/ / nem nur med pa la mngon sum du gyur pa yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro/ / dga' ba dang bag yangs kyang yang dag par 'byung ngo/ / de bzhin gshegs pa la dad pa rlabs po che yang mngon sum du 'gyur ro/ / sems kyi bsam pa tshad med pa yang yang dag par skye'o/ /

“Moreover, the enlightening beings in the stage of Blazing are freed from all points of attachment—to what is considered wealth, what is considered one’s own possessions, what is guarded and kept, what is thought of, what is ruminated on, what is conceived of, appearing and disappearing, aroused by attachment to the ideas of a real body, self, being, life, growth, person, personality, mental and physical clusters, elements, and sense mediums. Whatever acts should not be done, are disapproved by perfect buddhas, and provoke affliction, the enlightening beings get rid of; whatever acts should be done, are approved by perfect buddhas, and are appropriate for provisions for the Path of enlightenment, these the enlightening beings take on.
“As the enlightening beings increasingly develop the elements of the Path accomplished by skill in means and wisdom for the attainment of the Path, their minds accordingly become gentle, mild, workable, and altruistic, unafflicted, seeking the final ultimate excellence, seeking higher knowledge, liberating all beings, obeying and respecting their teachers, practicing the teachings as they have learned. They also become grateful and appreciative of what has been done for them, and they become extremely courageous, easy to live with, honest, gentle, uncomplicated, undeluded, free from conceit, easy to talk to, skillfull in grasping the speaker’s meaning. Thus the enlightening beings attain patience, self-control, and tranquillity.
“Thus patient, controlled, and calm, they contemplate the elements of the Path to purify the higher stages with unremitting vigor, unafflicted vigor, unregressing vigor, immense vigor, endless vigor, blazing vigor, unequaled vigor, invincible vigor, vigor in developing all beings to maturity, vigor in discerning what is instructive and what is not. And their mentality becomes more and more purified, their prevailing will doesn’t die out, and their element of zeal blazes; great roots of goodness are produced, and they accomplish destruction of worldly defilements. All their doubts and uncertainties are cut off, and they accomplish presence of mind free from doubt. They also attain joy and serenity. They come into the presence of the power of the enlightened and attain immeasurable will.

de byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od 'phro ba can'di la gnas pa'i tshe lta ba rgya chen po dang / smon lam gyi stobs kyis sangs rgyas mang po snang bar 'gyur te/ lta ba rgya chen po dang / smon lam gyi stobs kyis sangs rgyas brgya phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas brgya stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas bye ba brgya stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas khrag khrig mang po dang / sangs rgyas khrag khrig brgya phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas khrag khrig stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas khrag khrig brgya stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag mang po snang bar 'gyur ro/ / des de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag mthong nas/ bsam pa rgya chen pos rim gro byed do/ / bkur sti byed do/ / bsti stang byed do/ / mchod pa byed do/ / na bza' dang / bsod snyoms dang / gzims cha dang / snyun gyi rkyen sman dang / yo byad dag kyang 'bul zhing / byang chub sems dpa'i bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyang yongs su 'bul lo/ / dge 'dun gyi tshogs rnams la yang yang dag par mchod pa byed de/ dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“To the enlightening beings in this stage of Blazing, many buddhas become visible, by great vision and willpower: many hundreds of buddhas, many thousands of buddhas, many hundreds of thousands of buddhas, many millions of buddhas, many hundreds of millions of buddhas, many billions of buddhas, many trillions of buddhas become visible to the enlightening beings by great vision and willpower. Having seen those enlightened ones, they honor and make offerings to them with great zeal, providing useful items such as clothing, food and drink, bedding, seat cushions, and medicines; they also provide comforts for enlightening beings and pay honor to the religious community. These roots of goodness they dedicate to unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment.

de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag bsnyen bkur byed cing / de dag gis chos bstan pa yang rim gror nyan cing len to/ /'dzin to; ;thos nas kyang ci tshul du nan tan gyis yang dag par sgrub bo/ / de dag las phal cher de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi bstan pa la rab tu 'byung ste/ phyir zhing de'i bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / mos pa mnyam pa nyid kyang rnam par dag par 'gyur te/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od 'phro ba can'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de bskal pa du ma dang / bskal pa brgya phrag du ma dang / bskal pa stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa brgya stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa bye ba brgya stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa khrag khrig phrag du ma dang / bskal pa khrag khrig brgya phrag du ma dang / bskal pa khrag khrig stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong khrag du mar bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / mos pa'i bsam pa mnyam pa nyid rab tu gnas so/ / de dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad yongs su dag cing shin tu 'od gsal bar 'gyur ro/ /

“Also they attend those buddhas and respectfully listen to their teachings, taking them up, remembering them, and putting them into practice to the best of their ability. In many cases the enlightening beings go forth from home into the tutelage of those buddhas. Their will, purpose, devotion, and equanimity are further purified. In this stage of blazing the enlightening beings abide in purity of will, purpose, devotion, and equanimity for many eons, many hundreds and thousands and millions and billions and trillions of eons, and their roots of goodness become radiant with extreme clarity.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di lta ste/ dper na/ gser gyis le sbram de nyid mgar ba mkhas pas rgyan du byas pa ni/ de ma yin pa'i gser gyi sa le sbram gzhan rgyan du ma byas pas mi 'phrogs shing mi thub pa yin/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od 'phro ba can'di la gnas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'og ma rnams la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa bas mi 'phrogs shing mi thub pa yin/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nor bu rin po che 'od dang ldan pa/ 'od zer gyi dkyil 'khor yongs su dag pa can/ snang ba rab tu gtong pa ni de ma yin pa'i rin po che'i rnam pas mi 'phrogs shing mi thub pa yin/ rlung langs pa dang / chu dang / char bab pas 'od mi chod pa yin/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od 'phro ba can'di la gnas pa'ang de ma yin pa'i sa 'og ma la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mi 'phrogs shing mi thub pa yin/ bdud dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyud rnams kyis ye shes mi chod pa yin/

Just as gold fashioned by a skilled goldsmith into ornaments cannot be outshone by gold that has not been worked, in the same way the roots of goodness of enlightening beings in the stage of Blazing cannot be outshone by the roots of goodness in the lower stages. And just as the light produced from a jewel, light emanating from a sphere of completely pure radiance, cannot be outshone by other pure lights produced from jewels, and the light cannot be destroyed by any wind, water, or rain, in the same way the enlightening beings in this stage of Blazing cannot be outshone by enlightening beings in the lower stages, and their cannot be destroyed by the actions of any demonds or afflictions.

de'i bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi las/ don mthun pa'i shas che ba yin/ pha rol tu phyin pa bcu las brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i shas che ba yin te/ lhag ma rnams kyang ci tshul ci nus su yang dag par mi sgrub pa ma yin no/ /

“Of the four means of salvation, cooperation is predominant in these enlightening beings, and among the ten transcendent ways, energy is predominant—nonetheless they do practice the others as they can.

kye/ rgyal ba'i sras dag/ 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i sa bzhi pa ste/ 'od 'phro ba can zhes bya'o/ / de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phal cher lha'i rgyal po rab mtshe mar 'gyur te/ sems can rnams kyi 'jig tshogs la lta ba mang po yang dag par gzhom pa la mkhas shing mthu yod pa yin/ de sbyin pa'am/ ngag snyan pa'am/ don bsgrub pa'am/ don mthun pas dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ci rtsom yang rung ste/ de thams cad ji ltar na/ sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur/ gtso bor 'gyur/ thu bor 'gyur/ phul du 'gyur/ dam par 'gyur/ bla na med par 'gyur/ 'dren par 'gyur/ yongs su 'dren par 'gyur ba nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la rten pa'i bar du 'gyur snyam ste/ sangs rgyas yid la bya ba dang / chos yid la bya ba dang / dge 'dun yid la bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' yid la bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yid la bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa yid la bya ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa yid la bya ba dang / stobs yid la bya ba dang / mi 'jigs pa yid la bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa yid la bya ba nas/ rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar du yid la bya ba dang mi 'bral ba yin te/ de 'dod na skad cig yud tsam thang cig tu ting nge 'dzin khrag khrig rab tu thob cing de dag la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas khrag khrig mthong zhing de dag gi byin gyi rlabs kyang yang dag par shes pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams khrag khrig spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing khrag khrig tu 'gro ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams khrag khrig snang bar bya ba dang / sems can khrag khrig yongs su smin par bya ba dang / bskal pa khrag khrig tu gnas par bya ba dang; sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa khrag khrig la rab tu 'jug pa dang / chos kyi sgo khrag khrig rnam par 'byed pa dang / lus khrag khrig yongs su bstan pa dang / lus re re la yang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor khrag khrig yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i brtson 'grus kyi rnam pa de lta bu rtsom mo/ / de yan chad byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam gyi mthu can rnams smon lam gyi khyad par gyis rnam par 'phrul te/ de dag gi lus sam/ 'od dam/ rdzu 'phrul lam/ mig gam/ spyod yul lam; dbyangs sam/ spyod pa'am/ rgyan tam/ byin gyi rlabs sam/ mos pa'am/ mngon par 'du byed pa dag kyang bskal pa du ma dang / bskal pa brgya phrag du ma dang / bskal pa stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa brgya stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du ma'i bar gyis kyang bgrang bar dka'o/ /

“This is a summary of the fourth stage of enlightening beings, the stage called Blazing. Most of the enlightening beings in this stage are celestial sovereigns of the heaven of timely portion, powerful, able to remove beings’ view of a really existent body and establish them in right insight. Whatever actions the enlightening beings in the stage undertake, whether by giving, by kind speech, by beneficial action, or by cooperation, it is never apart from thoughts of Buddtha, the Teaching, the Community, enlightening beings, the practices of enlightening beings, the ways of transcendence, the powers, expertise, and unique qualities of buddhas, up to omniscience consummate in all respects. Why? To become the best of beings, unexcelled leaders and guides, and ultimately omniscient refuges.
“Those who seek to be thus undertake the appropriate effort, by which they instantly attain a billion concentrations, see a billion buddhas and recognize their power, shake a billion worlds, go to a billion lands, illumine a billion worlds, mature a billion beings, abide for a billion eons, penetrate a billion eons past and future, contemplate a billion teachings, and manifest a billion bodies, each surrounded by a billion enlightening beings. Then enlightening beings with the power of vows, by the excellence of their vows, perform countless transformations of the body, aura, mystic powers, sphere of operation, voice, conduct, adornment, power, resolution, and performances.”
de nas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos sa'i don 'di nyid yang brtag par bya ba dang / bstan par bya ba'i phyir de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then Diamond Matrix spoke these verse describing the meaning of this stage:

sa gsum 'od byed pa la shin tu sbyangs byas shing / / nam mkha'i khams dang yid kyi khams dang khams gsum dang / / sems can spyod dang chos dang 'jig rten dpyod byed cing / / mos dang bsam pa rnam par dag pa yang dag gnon/ /
'od 'phro yod pa'i sa thob 'phral du mthu chen rnams/ / ston pa'i rigs su yang dag skyes pas phyir mi ldog /sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun dkon mchog dad mi phyed/ / skye zhing 'jig dang gnas ma byed pa med par lta/ /
'jig rten rgyu ba'i las dang byed dang srid skye dang / / mya ngan 'das 'khor zhing dang sems can rnam par sgom/ / sngon dang phyi mtha' zad dang skye med grub pa dang / / las la ston pa'i rigs kyi rjes su 'brang zhing sgom/ /
de dag 'di 'dra'i chos ldan phan dang bder sems pa/ / lus dang dran pa tshor ba sems dang chos sgom ste/ / dran pa nyer gzhag bsgom pa rten pa rnams spangs pa/ / phyi dang nang gi gnyis ka'i rnam par mkhas pa sgom/ /
sdig to zad cing dge chos rnam par 'phel 'gyur ba'i/ / yang dag spong ba bzhi la'ang mkhas pa sgom par byed/ / rdzu 'phrul rkang pa bzhi dang stobs dang dbang po dang / / byang chub yan lag rin chen lam rab yid 'ong sgom/ /
de dag kun kyang 'gro la lta ba'i blo sgom ste/ / snying brtse byams pa sngon 'gro smon lam nye bar rton/ / stobs kyi dam pa go 'phang mchog gi rjes sems shing / / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes sangs rgyas zhing la smon/ /
ston pa'i 'jigs med rnams dang chos rnams 'phrogs med dang / / sangs rgyas gsung gi mchog la brten pa smon byed cing / / rin chen lam zab rnam par thar pa'i gnas rnams dang / / che ba'i thabs rnams yang dag bsgrub phyir sgom par byed/ /
'jig tshogs lta med lta ba drug cu gnyis kyang med/ / bdag dang bdag gi med cing srog tu dmigs pa med/ / phung po skye mched rnams dang khams kyi gnas dang rten/ / kun kyang mkhas pas bzhi pa'i sa la rab tu spangs/ /
des ni gang dang gang rnams rgyal bas smad mdzad pa'i/ / las dang nyon mongs bcas pa don du mi 'gyur rnams/ / de dag yongs su spangs shing mkhas pa khong nas dag / 'gro ba bskyab pa'i don du las rab dge ba brtson/ /
mkhas pa de ni byams pa'i sems ldan bag kyang yod/ / gnyen 'jam sems ldan phan dang bde byed dran dang ldan/ / dam pa'i don rnams thams cad skyon med yongs su tshol/ / ye shes dbang bskur mngon mos 'gro ba'i don kyang byed/ /
bla ma rim gror byed dang ldan zhing nan tan brtson/ / drin bzo khro ba med cing nga lo bde dang ldan/ / sgyu med thibs po med cing shin tu nges pa ste/ / yang dag sgrub byed brtson 'grus phyir ldog med pa yin/ /
yid du 'ong ba'i sa 'di la ni de gnas tshe/ / lhag pa'i bsam pa nyid dang bsam dga' thob par 'gyur/ / mos pa rab tu 'byung 'gyur dge chos rnam par 'phel/ / dri ma rnyog pa the tshom yid gnyis thams cad bsal/ /
'di la gnas pa'i mi rab khyu mchog rgyal ba'i sras/ / bde gshegs bye ba du ma mngon par mchod pa byed/ / chos kyang nyan byed bstan pa de la rab tu 'byung / / rgyan du byas pa'i gser ltar mi 'phrogs thub pa med/ /
mkhas pa 'di la gnas pa'i yon tan bsam pa dang / / ye shes thabs dang spyod pa rnam dag lam la yang / / rnam par bzlog par bdud rnams bye bas mi nus te/ / rin chen 'od la rlung gis chod par mi 'gyur bzhin/ /
mi dang lhas mchod 'os pa 'di la gnas pa yi/ / dbang phyug mtshe ma'i dam pa chos la spyod par 'gyur/ / lta ba'i thibs po rnams las sems can rnam par bzlog / rgyal ba'i ye shes don du dge ba'i rab tu brtsom/ /
brtson 'grus ldan pas mi yi khyu mchog khrag khrig brgya/ / gzhan du mi sems shin tu mnyam par bzhag pas mthong / / yan chad smon lam dam pa yon tan don spyod pa/ / ye shes 'byung gnas bskal pa mang por mngon par sgrub/ /

Those who have accomplished the third stage, Refulgence, Contemplating the deeds of beings, the world, and phenomena, With purity of resolution and will, they enter The realm of space, the realm of mind, and the triple realm.
As soon as those of great power attain the stage of Blazing, They are born in the family of the Teacher, never to regress, Inseparable from the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Community, Viewing the inertness of the continuum of birth and death.
Reflecting on the coming into existence of action that causes the world to develop, On cyclic existence, nirvana, lands, and beings, As well as phenomena, past and future, nonextinction and nonorigination, They grow in the family of the Teacher, acting in accord.
Having realized these principles, kind and compassionate, They contemplate the phenomena of their bodies and minds; They contemplate the inner, outer, and both, Reflecting on the four points of mindfulness, free from attachment.
From the destruction of evil, having developed good qualities, They actualize the four right efforts: They develop the four bases of mystic powers, the powers and faculties, The light of the jewels of the limbs of enlightenment, and thus the supreme Path.
They develop these for the benefit of beings, focusing their minds on this, Their vow supporting them, with compassion foremost, Seeking omniscient knowledge, the field of buddhas, Thinking of supreme power and the highest path.
Steadfast in seeking also the unshakable state of wisdom And the supreme buddha-voice of the Teacher, The jewel of the profound path and the abode of liberation, They develop great means.
Free from the view of a real body and from all erroneous views, Free from ego and possession, from living and gaining, In this fourth stage the defilement of attachment To the clusters, sense mediums, and elements is removed.
Whatever actions are condemned by buddhas As being conducive to affliction and not beneficial These enlightening beings abandon and with purified intent Undertake good deeds for the benefit of the world.
They become gentle in mind, Careful, mild, genial, honest, kind, easy to live with; Unafflicted, they seek the highest path in quest of supreme knowledge, Acting for the benefit of the world.
Respectfully approaching the worthy, wishing to learn, They are grateful, easy to teach, not hypocritical. Free from pride and guile, equanimous and courageous, They arouse nonregressing vigor in cultivation.
Those established in the splendor of this stage Have their minds set on pure truth; Their zeal blazes, they increase good qualities— All defilement, impurity, heedlessness, and doubt vanish.
The enlightening beings here, the best of people, Pay respect to billions of buddhas, hear their teaching And detach from the world to enter it, Impossible to spoil, like ornaments of gold.
The virtuous state of mind, knowledge, expedient practice, And the path of purification of the sages in this stage Cannot be turned back even by billions of demons, Just as the radiance of jewels cannot be leached away by rainwater.
Those in this stage, worthy of human and celestial respect, Become lords of the heaven of timely portion, carrying out celestial justice; They withdraw beings from the tangle of views and accumulate good For the sake of enlightened knowledge.
Full of vigor, they see a billion buddhas, Due to concentration, single-minded: After that for many eons they carry out beneficial actions, Supreme undertakings characterized by knowledge.
de ltar sa mchog bzhi pa 'di/ / rnam dag dag pa'i spyod ldan zhing / / yon tan ye shes don ldan pa/ / bde bar gshegs pa'i sras kyis bstan/ /
“Children of Buddha, I have explained this fourth stage of enlightening beings, called Blazing, which is pure and involves the immaculate conduct of those with virtue and knowledge.”
'od 'phro can zhes bya ba ste/ / byang chub sems dpa'i sa bzhi pa'o// //
bam po bzhi bcu brgyad pa/

mkhas pa rnams kyi sa mchog spyod pa thos gyur nas/ / chos kyi shes pas rgyal sras rnams ni mgu zhing dga'/ / dga' ba'i yid kyis mkha' las me tog char yang 'bebs/ / bdag nyid che ba'i bde gshegs sras po dge zhes brjod/ / lha yi bdag po dbang sgyur lha yi tshogs rnams dang / / dga' bas mkha' la 'phags te bde gshegs mchod pa'i phyir/ / me tog sna tshogs sprin chen mdog sdug yid 'ong ba/ / dga' zhing mos pas bde bar gshegs la mngon par gtor/ / glu dbyangs snyan pa yid 'ong sil snyan rnga yi sgra/ lha tshogs mang pos rgyal ba mchod pa'i don du byas/ / rgyal ba de tshe rab tu 'phrul ba'i sku yang ston/ / sgra dbyangs rnam pa kun las 'di 'dra'i sgra byung ngo/ /

Having thus heard the practice of this excellent stage of the wise, the enlightening beings were pleased, delighted by the teaching. Uplifted, they showered a rain of flowers in the sky, saying, “Well have you spoken, great enlightening one!” The king of gods, with a group of celestials, stood in the sky to honor the Buddha, their minds elevated: delighted, happy, they made clouds of various glows for the Buddha, with pleasing lights. Goddesses in concert sang and played music to offer to the Teacher; manifesting such power of enlightening beings, they spoke these words:

yun ring mchog gis thub pa'i dgongs pa rdzogs/ / yun ring mchog gis thub pas byang chub brnyes/ / lha mi phan pa yun ring mchog gis mthong / / lha yi gnas su shAkya thub pa gshegs/ /
yun ring mchog gis rgya mtsho'i chu yang g.yos/ / yun ring mchog gis 'od bzang thub pas bkye/ / yun ring mchog gis sems can bde bar 'gyur/ / thugs rje che gsung yun ring mchog gis thos/ /
yun ring mchog gis thub pa che dang phrad/ / yon tan kun gyi mtha' phyin da byon to/ / nga rgyal dregs snyems mun pa kun spangs te/ / mtshungs med mchod par 'os la mchod par gyis/ /
de la mchod byas bde 'gro'i lam du 'gro / de la mchod byas bde ba rnam pa mang / / de la mchod byas sdug bsngal thams cad 'byang / / de la mchod byas rgyal ba'i ye shes 'thob/ /
rgyal ba mkha' ltar rnam par dag pa ste/ / 'gro bas mi gos pad+mo'i chu dang 'dra/ / shin tu 'phags pa rgya mtsho'i ri rab bzhin/ / spro ba'i sems kyis rgyal ba mchod gyis shig /

At long last is the will of the Sage fulfilled; At long last has the Victor attained the emancipation of enlightenment. At long last is Shakyamuni seen in the celestial city, Having accomplished human and divine weal.
At long last are the waters of the ocean stirred, At long last is the pure light of the Victor released; At long last do suffering beings become happy, At long last is the Teaching of the Compassionate One heard.
At long last is the great Sage met Who has attained the consummation of all virtues, Having destroyed the darkness of conceit and heedlessness, The great mendicant, worthy, respected.
Those who have honored him are gone to heaven, Enjoying many kinds of happiness; Those who have honored him put an end to all suffering And gain supreme knowledge.
The Victor is pure as space, Undefiled by the world, like a lotus in water, Like the polar mountain rising from the sea— So honor the Buddha glad in mind.
de skad dbyangs su brjod byas nas/ / lha yi bu mo brgya mang ba/ / dga' bas rgyas pas rab tu lta/ / shin tu dga' bas rim gror byed/ /
de nas rdo rje'i snying po la/ / rnam thar zla bas smras pa ni/ / sa lnga'i rnam pa ci 'dra ba/ / rgyal ba'i sras kyis bshad par mdzod/ /
Then the wise one Moon of Liberation said to Diamond Matrix, “Please tell us the characteristics of the fifth stage.”

byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos smras pa/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de ltar byang chub sems dpa'/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa bzhi pa la sa'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga pa la 'jug ste/ de sems kyi bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid bcus 'jug go /bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos kyis bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos kyis bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos kyis bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / tshul khrims kyis bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / / sems kyis bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / lta ba dang / nem nur dang / dogs pa bsal bas bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / lam dang lam yin pa shes pas bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / nan tan dang spong ba shes pas bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad gong nas gong du rnam par bsgom pas bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya bas bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid de/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /sems kyi bsam pa rnam par dag pa bcu po 'di dag gis de la 'jug ste/

Diamond Matrix said, “Whoever has fulfilled the path of the fourth stage enters the fifth stage; one enters the fifth stage by tenfold impartiality with purity as the focus of the mind: by impartiality of focus on the purity of the teachings of past buddhas, by impartiality of focus on the purity of the teachings of future buddhas, by impartiality of focus on the purity of the teachings of present buddhas, by impartiality of focus on purity of conduct, by impartiality of focus on purity of mind, by impartiality of focus on purity of removal of views and doubt and uncertainty and perplexity, by impartiality of focus on purity of knowledge of right and wrong paths, by impartiality of focus on purity of knowledge of application and relinquishment, by impartiality of focus on purity of the final ultimate discernment and realization of all the elements of enlightenment, and by impartiality of focus on purity of perfecting all beings.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang / lam gyi yan lag de dag nyid la sbyang ba shin tu byas shing lhag pa'i bsam pa shin tu sbyangs pas de'i gong du lam gyi khyad par tshol zhing / de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa dang / smon lam gyi mthu dang / shugs dang / snying rje dang / byams pas sems can yongs su mi gtong ba dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rab tu bsags pa dang / yongs su rgyun chad pa med pa dang / thabs la mkhas pas mngon par bsgrub pa dang / gong nas gong du sa'i snang ba blta ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs btsal ba dang / dran pa dang / blo gros dang / rig pa dang / blo'i stobs dang shugs kyi sa yid la bya ba'i phyir mi zlog par byas te/ 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so/ / 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba/ 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa/ 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te/ de kun rdzob kyi bden pa la mkhas pa yin/ don dam pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin/ mtshan nyid kyi bden pa la mkhas pa yin/ rnam par dbye ba'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin/ brtag pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin/ dngos po'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin/ 'byung ba'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin/ byang zhing mi skye ba'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin/ lam gyi ye shes la 'jug pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i rim pa mtshams sbyar ba grub par bya bas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes yang dag par bskyed pa'i bar du mkhas pa yin te/

“Furthermore, the enlightening beings who have reached the fifth stage, from having cultivated these elements of enlightenment and branches of the path, and from having thoroughly purified their intent—practicing what is needed for the quest for a higher path in the future, being supported by the power of vows, compassionately and kindly not abandoning beings, accumulating provisions of virtue and knowledge, never ceasing, putting skill in means into operation, seeing the light of the later stages, seeking the power of the Buddha, being supported by the power of intellect and action and awareness and recollection—attain unwavering attention; and doing so, they accurately know as it really is what the truth of suffering recognized by sages is, what the truth of the cause of suffering is, what the extinction of suffering is, and what the truth of its attainment is. They become well versed in conventional truth, in ultimate truth, in the truth of characteristics, the truth of distinctions, the truth of structure, the truth of substance, the truth of becoming, the truth of knowledge of extinction and nonorigination, the truth of entry into knowledge of the path; and by having accomplished the continuity of accession to the stages of enlightening beings, they become well versed in the truth of the accumulation of the knowledge of the enlightened.

de sems can gzhan dang gang zag gzhan la bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du shin tu dga' bar byed pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa yang rab tu shes so/ / theg pa gcig tu yang dag par gzhol bas don dam pa'i bden pa yang rab tu shes so/ / chos kyi rang gi mtshan nyid khong du chud pas mtshan nyid kyi bden pa yang rab tu shes so; ; chos kyi bye brag rnam par dgod pa khong du chud pas rnam par dbye ba'i bden pa yang rab tu shes so/ / phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnam par dgod pas rtog ba'i bden pa yang rab tu shes so/ / lus dang sems la gnod pa nyams su 'bab pas dngos po'i bden pa yang rab tu shes so/ / 'gro ba'i rgyud kyi mtshams sbyor bas 'byung ba'i bden pa yang rab tu shes so/ / rims dang yongs su gdung ba thams cad shin tu zhi bas byang zhing mi skye ba'i bden pa yang rab tu shes so/ / mi gnyis pas mngon par bsgrub pas lam gyi ye shes la 'jug pa'i bden pa yang rab tu shes so/ / rnam pa thams cad du mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa rim pa thams cad mtshams sbyar ba rab tu bsgrub pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes yang dag par 'byung ba'i bden pa yang rab tu shes so/ de 'ang mos pas shes pa'i stobs dang / shugs kyis te lhag ma ma lus par ye shes khong du chud pas ni ma yin no/ / de de ltar bden pa la mkhas pa mngon par bsgrubs pa'i blos 'dus byas thams cad gsob gsog rdzun pa bslu ba'i chos can dku byed pa/ byis pa 'drid par yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te/ de sngon pas kyang sems can thams cad la snying rje mngon du 'gyur ro/ / byams pa chen po'i snang ba yang rab tu 'byung ste/ de de ltar ye shes kyi stobs dang shugs rab tu thob cing sems can thams cad la lta ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la mngon par mos pas 'du byed kyi rnam pa thams cad kyi sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' rab tu rtog ste/ 'di ltar sngon gyi mtha'i ma rig pa dang / srid pa dang / sred pa las rab tu byung ba'i sems can 'khor ba'i rgyud du 'bab pa/ phung po'i gnas las ma 'phags pa/ sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po/ bdag med pa/ sems can med pa/ srog med pa/ gso ba med pa/ gang zag med pa/ bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba/ rnam par 'phel lo zhes de'ang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so/ / 'di ltar phyi ma'i mtha' med pa la rmongs pa'i 'dod pa 'di nyid rgyun gcad pa dang / mthar dbyung ba dang / 'byung bar bya ba dang / yod pa dang med pa de yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te/ de 'di snyam du sems so/ / de ltar lus grangs med pa zhig 'gags la 'gag par 'gyur zhing 'gag bzhin te/ 'di ltar rgud par 'gyur yang lus la skyo ba mi skyed cing / sdug bsngal gyi 'khrul 'khor je bas je 'phel du byed pa dang / 'khor ba'i rgyud las phyir mi ldog cing / phung po'i gnas mi gtong ba dang / khams kyi sbrul gyis skyo bar mi 'gyur ba dang / nga rgyal dang lta ba'i zug rngu mi 'byin cing / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi me lce 'bar ba zhi bar mi byed pa dang; ma rig pa'i mun pa chen po mi sel cing / srid pa'i mtsho mi skem la/ stobs bcu'i ded dpon mi tshol zhing / bdud kyi bsam pa thibs po'i rjes su song ste/ 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho rnam par rtog pa sna tshogs kyi chu srin gyis dkrugs pas yongs su g.yeng bar 'khod cing / byis pa so so'i skye bo de dag de ltar mi shes shing rmongs pa ni ngo mtshar che'i/ ma la/ bdag gis sems can de ltar sdug bsngal gyis mnar ba/ mgon med pa/ dpung gnyen med pa/ skyabs med pa/ gnas med pa/ gzhi med pa/ rten med pa/ long bar gyur pa/ ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs dang / bris yog pa/ mun pas khebs pa de dag gi don du bdag gcig pu gnyis su med pas bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs kyi rnam par bsags par bya ba/ ji lta bur bsags pas sems can de dag shin tu rnam par dag pa thob par 'gyur ba dang / stobs bcu'i stobs kyi ye shes chags pa med pa'i bar gyi mthar thug pa thob par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa de lta bu'i bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs bsags par bya'am ci snyam ste/ de de ltar shin tu brtags pa'i ye shes kyis mngon par bsgrubs pa'i blos dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ci rtsom yang de dag thams cad sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa dang / sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / sems can thams cad la bde ba dang / sems can thams cad la snying brtse ba dang / sems can thams cad la gtse ba med pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su dgrol ba dang / sems can thams cad drang ba dang / sems can thams cad dad par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad gdul ba dang / sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba'i phyir rab tu rtsom ste/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga pa shin tu khyab par dga' ba 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni/ de bas kyang nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i chos nyid kyis dran pa dang ldan pa yin/ shin tu nges par rtogs pa'i ye shes kyis blo gros dang ldan pa yin/ mdo'i don dang / tshul dang / ldem po dag khong du chud pas rig pa dang ldan pa yin/ bdag de gzhan gyi sems rjes su srung bas ngo tsha shes shing khrel yod pa yin/ sdom pa dang tshul ma bor bas dga' ba dang ldan pa yin/ gnas dang gnas pa ma yin pa la mkhas shing shin tu brtags pas blo dang ldan pa yin/ gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pas ye shes dang ldan pa yin/ don dang don ma yin pa'i tshig yang dag par dbye ba la mkhas pas shes rab dang ldan pa yin/ bsgom pa mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas pas mngon par shes pa bsgrub pa thob pa yin/ 'jig rten gyi rjes su 'brang bas thabs la mkhas pa yin/ bsod nams kyi tshogs nye bar gsog pas ngom mi shes pa yin/ ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su tshol bas brtson 'grus rgyun mi 'chad pa yin/ byams pa dang snying rje chen po'i tshogs yang dag par gsog pas skyo ba med pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa yin/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa yongs su tshol bas snyom las med par yongs su tshol ba la brtson pa yin/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing bsgrub pa dang / rgyan mngon par shom pas mngon par bsgrub pa'i yid dang ldan pa yin/ mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po yang dag par bsgrub pas dge ba rnam pa sna tshogs la brtson pa yin/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rgyan yongs su tshol bas rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par brtson pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa' dang / chos smra ba thams cad la rim gro byed pas bsnyen bkur dang / sri zhu chen po'i ngang tshul can yin/ byang chub kyi sems dang thabs mkhas pa chen po'i ngang tshul dang ldan par 'jig rten du rgyu bas khong khro ba med pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin/ sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba la mngon par brtson pas nyin mtshan du gzhan du sems pa'i yid yongs su spangs pa yin te/ de de ltar mngon par brtson pas sbyin pas kyang sems can yongs su smin par byed do/ / ngag snyan pa dang / don bsgrub pa dang / don mthun pa dang / gzugs kyi lus kun tu bstan pa dang / chos bshad pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa brjod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i che ba nyid smos pa dang / 'khor ba'i nyes pa bstan pa dang; sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi yon tan yongs su grags par bya ba dang / rdzu 'phrul dang / rnam par 'phrul pa chen po mngon par bsgrub pa dang / bya ba dang / thabs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis sbyor bas sems can yongs su smin par byed do/ / de ltar sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la mngon par brtson pa dang ldan zhing / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi rjes su song ba'i bsam pa can/ dge ba'i rtsa ba phyir mi ldog pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa/ khyad par can gyi chos yongs su btsal ba la mngon par brtson pa de gang 'di 'jig rten na yod pa'i yi ge dang / gtsug lag dang / lag brda dang / grangs dang / rtsis dang / shod thabs la sogs pa dang / khams kyi cho ga dang; gso ba'i cho ga dang / skem pa dang / brjed byed dang / 'byung po'i gdon bsal pa dang / dug dang ro langs kyi sbyor ba bsal ba dang / rang bzo dang / gar gyi cho ga dang / gtam dang / rol mo dang / sgrung gtam la dga' bskyed pa dang / grong dang grong khyer dang / bza' shing gi ra ba dang / chu klung dang / mtshe'u dang / lteng ka dang / rdzing bu dang / me tog dang / shing tog dang / rtsi dang / nags tshal mngon par bsgrub pa dang / gser dang / dngul dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bai DUr+ya dang / dung dang / rin po che shI la dang / byi ru dang / rin po che rnams kyi 'byung gnas bstan pa dang / nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / gza' dang / rgyu skar dang / sa g.yo ba dang / ri kyi ltas dang / rmi lam dang ltas bstan pa la 'jug pa dang / yan lag dang / nying lag gi mtshan dang / spyod pa'i mtshan dang / sdom pa dang / tshul dang / bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i gnas rnams dang / gzhan yang gang sems can la 'tshe bar mi 'gyur ba'i sbyor ba dang / sems can thams cad la phan pa dang; bde bar 'gyur ba yod dgu de dag thams cad 'jig rten la snying brtse bas rim gyis sangs rgyas kyi chos la rab tu dgod pa'i phyir mngon par sgrub bo/ /

“They know the conventional truth from satisfying other beings according to their inclinations. They know the ultimate truth by comprehending all in one principle. They know the truth of characteristics from awareness of individual and common characteristics. They know the truth of differentiation from learning the definitions of differentiations in the Teaching. They know the truth of structure from learning the definitions of the clusters, elements, and sense mediums. They know the truth of substance from realizing the pressure of the body and mind. They know the truth of becoming from the continuity of realms of existence. They know the truth of knowledge of extinction and nonorigination from the ultimate extinction of all burning torments. They know the truth of entry into the knowledge of the path from the accomplishment of nonduality. By accomplishment of continuity of accession to the stages of enlightening beings from perfect awareness of all their features, ultimately they know the truth of accumulation of the knowledge of the enlightened. This is, however, on the basis of the power of knowledge in the process of application, not by ultimate exhaustive knowledge.
“By means of the awareness effected by this knowledge of truths, they know in truth that all that is conditional is void, unreal, delusive, deceptive, fooling the ignorant. They become all the more compassionate toward beings, and the light of great goodwill shines forth. Supported by the power of knowledge, with concern for all beings, seeking enlightened knowledge, they examine all conditioned activities, past and future. They know for a fact how the mass of suffering of beings, sprung from ignorance and craving for existence from the past, borne along in the stream of cyclic existence, never having gotten free from the dwelling of the physical and mental clusters, increases, and that it has no self, no being, no life, no soul, no personality, no self or personal possessions. They also know in truth whether or not there is an end, limit, or escape from their deluded wishing for the nonexistent future.
“It occurs to the enlightening beings, ‘How strange and pitiful these ignorant, deluded creatures, whose countless bodies have perished, will perish, and are perishing, yet even while they are passing away they do not give rise to disaffection with the body; they increase the fetters of suffering, flowing along in the stream of the mundane whirl, not turning back from great danger and trouble, not letting go of the dwelling of the body-mind clusters; they do not reject the vipers of the elements, they are unaware of the prison of greed for happiness; they do not pull out the arrows of pride and views, they do not extinguish the flames of desire, hatred, and delusion; they do not disperse the darkness of ignorance; they do not evaporate the flood of craving; they do not seek an enlightened guide; going along with maniacs, they swim around in the sea of the mundane whirl, in the confusion of grasping of various bad thoughts. Being without refuge, they fall into intense distress and individually experience many pains, such as birth, old age, sickness, death, grief, lament, dejection, mental disturbance. For the sake of these beings, who are suffering distress, without a leader, without a savior, without a refuge, without a reliance, without an island of safety, without direction, in the dark, wrapped up in the shell of ignorance, overcome by darkness, we alone will gather such stores of virtue and knowledge as will enable these beings to be ultimately purified, and finally that they may arrive at the state of unimpeded knowledge of those with the ten powers.’
“Whatever goodness the enlightening beings undertake with this mind which has realized well-considered knowledge, they undertake it all for the salvation of all beings, for the benefit of all beings, for the happiness of all beings, out of compassion for all beings, so that all beings will be free from trouble, for the liberation of all beings, to take care of all beings, for the purification of all beings, to lead all beings to freedom, for the ultimate nirvana of all beings.
“The enlightening beings in this fifth stage, the stage Difficult to Conquer, become all the more mindful, by not forgetting the nature of things; they become wise, by certain knowledge; they become wayfarers, by realizing the hidden meanings intended by the scriptures; they become conscientious because of protecting self and others; they become steadfast, by maintaining disciplined behavior; they become awake because of careful consideration of what is true and what is not; they become followers of knowledge because of not being led by others; they become followers of wisdom because of skill in expression distinguishing the meaningful and meaningless; they become skilled in maturing beings because of skill in effecting higher knowledge; they become accomplished in mystic knowledge because of skill in accomplishing meditation; they become skilled in expedients because of adaptation to the world; they become tireless because of accumulation of virtues; they become ceaselessly energetic because of seeking knowledge; they become unflagging in determination because of having accumulated great kindness and compassion; they become devoted to tireless seeking because of being in quest of the ten powers, infallible expertise, and unique qualities of buddhas; they become imbued with well-accomplished attention because of having accomplished buddha-land adornment; they become engaged in various good works because of having accumulated the distinctive marks and embellishments of buddhahood; they become constantly engaged in right effort because of seeking the physical, verbal, and mental adornments of the enlightened; they become most respectful in conduct because of listening to all enlightening beings and expounders of truth, they become unhindered in mind because of continually traveling through the world by the great skill in means of enlightening beings; they become undistracted at all times because of application of effort to the full development of all beings.
“Thus engaged, the enlightening beings develop people by means of charity, kind speech, beneficial action, and cooperation; they develop people by showing forms, by revelation of enlightening action by making clear the greatness of the enlightened, by showing the ills of the mundane whirl, by lauding the knowledge of buddhas, and by production of great spiritual manifestations and application to various practices and works.
“The enlightening beings, thus engaged in the development of sentient beings with minds continually following buddha-knowledge engaged in unregressing goodness, intent on the search for supreme truth, practice whatever in the world would benefit sentient beings, such as writing, teaching, mathematics, sciences of various realms or elements; medical sciences; prevention of consumption, epilepsy, and possession; warding off poison, zombies, and witchcraft; song and dance, drama, music, storytelling, and entertainment; the construction of villages, cities, par s, canals, reservoirs, ponds abounding in lotuses, groves producing flowers, fruits and medicines; the discovery of gold, jewels, and other precious substances; methods of pointing out the signs of the sun, moon, planets stars, constellations, movements of the earth, omens, dreams, and the characteristics of coordination of general and specific actions and forms of limbs and parts of the body; points of cultivation of discipline, meditation, mystic knowledge, the immeasurables and formless states—and whatever else is not harmful or injurious, that which is conducive to the benefit and well-being of all creatures, that the enlightening beings undertake, guided by compassion, to establish them in the way of buddhas.

byang chub sems dpa'i sa shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lta ba rgya chen po dang / smon lam gyi stobs kyis sangs rgyas mang po snang bar 'gyur te/ lta ba rgya chen po dang / smon lam gyi stobs kyis sangs rgyas brgya phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas brgya stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas bye ba brgya stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas khrag khrig mang po dang / sangs rgyas khrig khrig brgya phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas khrag khrig stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas khrag khrig brgya stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag mang po snang bar 'gyur ro/ / des de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag mthong nas bsam pa rgya chen pos rim gro byed do/ /bkur sti byed do/ /bsti stang byed do/ /mchod pa byed do/ / na bza' dang / bsod snyoms dang / gzims cha dang / snyun gyi rkyen sman dang / yo byad dag kyang 'bul zhing byang chub sems dpa'i bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyang yongs su 'bul lo; ; dge 'dun gyi tshogs rnams la'ang yang dag par mchod pa byed de/ dge ba'i rtsa ba dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o/ / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag la rim gro byed cing de dag las rim gro dang / zhe sa dang / bsti stang du chos bstan pa nyan to/ /len to/ /'dzin to/ /thos nas kyang ci tshul du nan tan gyis yang dag par sgrub ste/

“To the enlightening beings in this stage, Difficult to Conquer, there appear many buddhas, by great vision and willpower—many hundreds of buddhas, many thousands, many hundreds of thousands, many millions, many billions, many trillions of buddhas. Having seen those buddhas, the enlightening beings honor and serve them with great resolution, providing the necessities of life, also providing comforts for enlightening beings and honoring the religious community, and dedicate these roots of goodness to unexcelled, complete, perfect enlightenment. The enlightening beings also attend those buddhas and with greatest respect and reverence listen to, take up, and remember their teachings and, having heard them, apply them as much as possible.

de dag las phal cher de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi bstan pa la rab tu 'byung ngo/ /
rab tu byung nas kyang thos pa 'dzin pa'i gzungs rab tu thob pa'i chos smra bar 'gyur ba yin/

“Many enlightening beings go forth from society into the tutelage of those buddhas and, having gone forth, become holders of learning and preachers of the Teaching. Moreover, they become preachers who have attained command of the practices they have learned, because of not forgetting what they have learned from billions of buddhas over billions of eons.

de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bskal pa du mar shin tu byang ba dang / yongs su dag pa dang / 'od rab tu gsal bar gnas so/ / bskal pa brgya phrag du ma dang / bskal pa stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa brgya stong du ma dang / bskal pa bye ba brgya stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa khrag khrig phrag du ma dang / bskal pa khrag khrig brgya phrag du ma dang / bskal pa khrag khrig stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du mar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag shin tu byang ba dang / yongs su dag pa dang / rab tu 'od gsal bar gnas so/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /gser gyi sa le sbram de nyid rin po che mu sa ra gal bas btab na; de bas kyang yongs su 'tsher ro/ / yongs su dag par 'gyur ro/ /'od shin tu gsal zhing dang bar 'gyur ro/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thabs dang shes rab kyis rnam par spyad pa yang de bas kyang shin tu byang ba dang / yongs su dag pa dang / rab tu 'od gsal zhing dang ba yin/ ye shes kyi sbyor ba'i yon tan mngon par bsgrubs pa dang ldan pa yin/ mi 'phrogs shing shin tu brtags pa yin/

“The roots of goodness of many eons of the enlightening beings in this stage are refined, purified thoroughly, and become more radiant, over hundreds and thousands and millions and billions of eons, just as gold adorned with jewels becomes brighter, purer, and more radiant. Because of accomplishment of the virtues of application of knowledge, they also become impeccable in conduct.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag / 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / skar ma dang / rgyu skar gyi gzhal med khang gi 'od snang ba ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyis mi 'phrogs shing / rlung dang thun mong du mi spyod pa yin/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba'di la gnas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thabs dang / shes rab dang / ye shes dang / sems kyis shin tu brtags pa dang ldan pa yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis mi 'phrogs pa yin/ 'jig rten pa dang thun mong du mi spyod pa yin/ de'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu las bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa shas che ba yin te/ lhag ma rnams kyang ci tshul ci nus su mi sgrub pa ma yin no/ /

Just as the light of the sun, moon, planets, and stars cannot be diverted by the winds and is not of a class with the winds, in the same way the roots of goodness of the enlightening beings in the Difficult to Conquer stage, in accord with the thought of the skillful, wise, knowing mind, cannot be surpassed by any who learn or attain individual liberation, and are not of the same class as the worldly.
“For enlightening beings in this stage the transcendent way of meditation is paramount, while they practice the rest as best they can.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag/ 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga pa mdor bstan pa'o/ /
de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni phal cher lha'i rgyal po rab dga' ldan du 'gyur te/ sems can thams cad kyi mu stegs kyi gnas thams cad rnam par bzlog pa la mkhas shing mthu yod pa yin/ de sbyin pa'am/ ngag snyan pa'am/ don bsgrub pa'am/ don mthun pas dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ci rtsom yang rung ste/ de thams cad ji ltar na sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur/ gtso bor 'gyur/ thu bor 'gyur/ phul du 'gyur/ dam par 'gyur/ bla na med par 'gyur/ 'dren par 'gyur/ yongs su 'dren par 'gyur ba nas/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la rten pa'i bar du 'gyur snyam ste/ sangs rgyas yid la bya ba dang / chos yid la bya ba dang / dge 'dun yid la bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' yid la bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yid la bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa yid la bya ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa yid la bya ba dang / stobs yid la bya ba dang / mi 'jigs pa yid la bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa yid la bya ba nas/ rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar du yid la bya ba dang mi 'bral ba yin te/ de 'dod na skad cig yud tsam thang cig tu ting nge 'dzin khrag khrig phrag stong rab tu 'thob cing / de dag la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas khrag khrig phrag stong mthong zhing de dag gi byin gyi rlabs kyang yang dag par shes pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams khrag khrig phrag stong skyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing khrag khrig phrag stong du 'gro ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams khrag khrig phrag stong du snang bar bya ba dang / sems can khrag khrig phrag stong yongs su smin par bya ba dang / bskal pa khrag khrig phrag stong du gnas par bya ba dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi mi'i mtha'i bskal pa khrag khrig phrag stong la rab tu 'jug pa dang / chos kyi sgo khrag khrig phrag stong rnam par 'byed pa dang / lus khrag khrig phrag stong yongs su bstan pa dang / lus re re la yang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor khrag khrig phrag stong yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus kyi rnam pa de lta bu rtsom mo/ / de yan chad byang chub sems dpa' smon lam gyi mthu can rnams smon lam gyi khyad par gyis rnam par 'phrul te de dag gi lus sam/ 'od dam/ rdzu 'phrul lam/ mig gam/ spyod yul lam/ dbyangs sam/ spyod pa'am/ rgyan tam/ byin gyi rlabs sam/ mos pa 'am/ mngon par 'du byed pa dag kyang bskal pa du ma dang / bskal pa brgya phrag du ma dang / bskal pa stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa brgya stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du mas kyang bgrang par dka'o/ /

This is the stage of enlightening beings called Difficult to Conquer.
Most of the enlightening beings in this stage become celestial sovereigns of the heaven of complete satisfaction, capable, powerful, able to detach beings from all false teachers and to establish them in the truth. Whatever acts they undertake, whether by giving, kind speech, beneficial action, or cooperation, it is all never apart from thoughts of Buddha, the Teaching, the Community, enlightening beings, the conduct of enlightening beings, the ways of transcendence, the stages, the powers, expertise, and unique qualities of buddhas, including omniscience complete in all respects. Why? Because they want to be the best of beings, unexcelled leaders and guides, and ultimately omniscient refuges.
“Those who seek to be thus undertake the appropriate effort, by the energy of which they instantly attain a trillion concentrations, see a trillion buddhas and perceive their power, shake a trillion worlds, go to a trillion lands, illumine a trillion realms, mature a trillion beings, abide for a trillion eons, penetrate a trillion eons past and future, contemplate a trillion doctrines, and manifest a trillion bodies, each appearing surrounded by a trillion enlightening beings.
“Beyond that, enlightening beings with the power of vows, by the excellence of their vows, perform countless transformations of body, aura, mystic powers, vision, sphere of operation, voice, conduct, adornments, power, resolution, and performances.”
de nas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos sa'i don 'di nyid yang brtag par bya ba dang bstan par bya ba'i phyir/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then Diamond Matrix spoke these verses describing this stage:

rgyal ba'i spyod pa bzhi po de ltar rnam sbyangs te/ / dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi rjes su sems byed cing / / tshul khrims sems dang nan tan lam rnams rnam dag pas/ / nem nur med pa'i mkhas pa lnga pa yongs su gnon/ /
dran pa'i gzhu dang dbang po mda' rno phyir mi ldog / yang dag spong ba rta yin gzhon pa rdzu 'phrul rkang / / stobs lnga go cha dgra rnams kun gyis tshugs mi nus/ / dpa' bas mi ldog mkhas pa lnga pa yongs su gnon/ /
ngo tsha khrel yod gos yin mkhas pa'i tshul gtsang spos/ / byang chub yan lag phreng ba byug pa bsam gtan mchog / shes rab rnam par dpyang dang thabs mchog rgyan yin te/ / bza' shing ra ba ting 'dzin dga' ldan yang dag gnon/ /
rdzu 'phrul bzhi po rkang pa dran pa rnam dag mgrin/ / byams brtse rnam dag mig yin shes rab mche ba mchog / bdag med nga ros nyon mongs dgra rnams rab tu 'joms/ / mkhas pa mi yi seng ge sa lnga yongs su gnon/ /
de dag sa mchog lnga pa'i phyogs su phyin gyur nas/ / yongs su dag pa'i lam rnam phyir zhing gong du sbyong / / bsam dag mkhas pa rgyal ba 'thob par bya don du/ / skyo ba med par snying rje byams pa'i rjes su sems/ /
bsod nams tshogs bsags de bzhin ye shes rab ldan pa/ / sa rnams snang bar bya phyir gcig min thabs rtog cing / / sangs rgyas byin gyis dran dang blo gros blo thob pas/ / bden pa bzhi po ma lus yang dag khong du chud/ /
don dam bden pa de bzhin kun rdzob mtshan bden dang / / rnam par dbye ba'i bden pa de bzhin brtag bden dang / / 'byung zhing 'jug dang dngos po bzhi lam bden pa nas/ / sgrib med bden pa'i bar du yang dag rab tu rtogs/ /
de ltar bden pas yongs su sbyangs pa'i blo phra yang / / rnam thar dam pa sgrib med de ni thob pa min/ / ye shes mos yangs yon tan rnams kyi 'byung gnas te/ / 'gro kun dgra bcom rang rgyal rnams ni zil gyis gnon/ /
de dag bden pas de ltar rang gi blos bsgrubs pas/ / 'dus byas rdzun zhing rang bzhin snying po med par shes/ / sems can don du bde gshegs ye shes tshol ba'i tshe/ / bde gshegs thugs brtse byams pa snang ba rab tu 'thob/ /
'dus byas sngon dang phyi mtha' mkhas pa rab tu lta/ / gti mug mun gnag mun pas 'khrugs shing sred chags pa'i/ / 'gro rnams sdug bsngal phung po lta ba bdag med cing / / srog bral shing 'dra ba mngon par sel ba byed/ /
nyon mongs rjes 'gro 'di dag 'das dang ma 'ongs pa'i/ / sdug bsngal rgyun gcod mthar phyin gzhal bar yong mi byed/ / kyi hud 'gro ba de ltar 'khyams zhes snying rje skye/ / gti mug 'khrul pas 'khor ba'i rgyud du phyir mi ldog /
phung po'i gnas dang khams sprul lta bu'i zug rngu can/ / mes gdungs yid can sgrib pa'i mun pas bsgribs gyur pa/ / don rnams rnam par ma brtags sred pa'i mtshor lhung zhing / / rgyal ba'i ded dpon bral ba sdug bsngal rgya mtshor gnas/ /
de ltar rig nas bag yod phyir zhing rab tu rtsom/ / ci rtsom kun kyang 'gro ba rnam thar don du ste/ / phyir zhing dran ldan blo gros rig dang ldan pa yin/ / khrel yod dga' ldan mkhas pa blo ldan shes rab ldan/ /
bsod nams bsags dang ye shes dam pas mi ngoms shing / / rtag tu skyo med le lo med par thos pa tshol/ / zhing sgrub rgyal ba'i mtshan dang sangs rgyas gsung tshol zhing / / sems can phan par brtson pa'i bya bas ngoms mi shes/ /
'gro ba smin bya'i don du mkhas pas bzo yi gnas/ / yi ge lag brda grangs dang rtsis dang gso ba'i thabs/ / 'byung po'i gdon dang las rnams sna tshogs bsal ba'i phyir/ / snying brtse byams pa'i blo gsal gtsug lag kun la gzhol/ /
rang bzo mchog dang gar sdug sna tshogs dga' byed dang / / chu klung ra ba shing tog me tog 'dug gnas dang / / bya ba sna tshogs sgrub byed sems can bde don du/ / rin chen 'byung gnas du ma'ang nye bar ston pa byed/ /
sa g.yo nyi zla gza' skar kun kyang de bzhin du/ / sems can yan lag mtshan ma'i dpyad dang rgyal srid gnas/ / gzugs med bsam gtan mngon shes mchog dang tshad med pa/ / 'gro la bde dang phan pa'i don 'dod mngon par bsgrub/ /
shin tu rgyal dka' 'di thob shes rab mchog spyod pa/ / sangs rgyas bye ba mchod byed chos rnams nyan par byed/ / de dag dge dang bsam pa phyir zhing dag par 'gyur/ / gser sbram ji ltar mu sar gal bas btab pa bzhin/ /
ji ltar bar snang gza' yi rin chen gzhal med khang / / rlung la rgyu ste 'on kyang rlung gis 'phrogs pa min/ / de ltar 'gro ba'i don spyod 'jig rten chos spyod kyang / / ji ltar pad+mo chus mi chags bzhin 'phrogs pa min/ /
'di la gnas pa dga' ldan dbang po mkhas par 'gyur/ / mu stegs spyod dang lta ba mang po'i gnas kyang sel/ / stobs rnams bcu po sems can bskyab par bya'o zhes/ / dge ba de dag rgyal ba'i ye shes don du rtsom/ /
'di na sa gong du brtson 'grus rtsom byed mthu thob pa/ / khrag khrig bye ba stong gi bde gshegs mchod pa byed/ / ting 'dzin thob nas khrag khrig zhing yangs mkhas pas bskyod/ / yan chad smon lam khyad par yon tan 'byung gnas so/ /

Thus purified in the excellent practices of the fourth stage, They contemplate the equality of the buddhas of past, present, and future— In conduct, mental attainment, purity of the Path, And freedom from doubt—and enter the fifth stage.
Their bow is recollection, their arrows the spiritual faculties, undeflected; Their horses the right efforts, the bases of mystic power their chariot, The five powers their armor, which no bandits can break through; Heroic, never retreating, they enter the fifth stage.
Clothed in conscience and modesty, wise, with the fragrance of pure conduct, With the garland of the elements of enlightenment, the unguent of high meditation, With excellent methods adorned by wisdom and reflection, Entering the garden of mental command, they come to this fifth stage.
The four bases of mystic power their feet, pure mindfulness their necks, Noblest kindness and compassion their eyes, lofty wisdom their teeth, The roar of selflessness overcoming the thieving afflictions, The human lions, equanimous, wise, enter this fifth stage.
Having attained this excellent fifth stage, They further cultivate the luster of the pure path: With a pure intent, to attain buddhahood, They think of compassion and kindness, without distress.
By gathering stores of virtue and higher knowledge, By many means they observe the range of the stages. Mindful of the power of the Buddha, imbued with intelligence and reason, They contemplate the four truths completely.
They delve into the ultimate truth, the conventional truth, The truth of characteristics, of distinctions, and structure, The truth of substance, of the tainted and annihilation, The truth of the Path, up to the truth of the unobstructed.
Yet though their subtle discernment seeks the truth They do not attain highest unobstructed liberation; Still, by great knowledge and application they surpass All virtues of which worldlings are capable.
Thus having developed veritable discernment of truth, They know the conditioned is unreal by nature and valueless. They gain the light of compassion and kindness of buddhas yet more, Seeking enlightened knowledge for the benefit of sentient beings.
They observe the past and future of the conditioned, Those shrouded in the darkness of delusion, caught up in suffering, And rescue worldlings bound to this mass of suffering, Though they are without self or soul and equal to grass and trees.
“Because of two simultaneous afflictions are you reborn, Past, present, and future; you find no end to suffering.” They see these people are lost, not turning back From the mundane whirl, though it has no being of its own.
Dwelling in the clusters, with the serpents of the senses, Infested with errant views, hearts burning with fire, shrouded in darkness, Sunk in a flood of craving through lack of insight, Without the guidance of Buddha, they are stranded in the sea of suffering.
Knowing this, enlightening beings strive yet more diligently, Undertaking the liberation of all sentient beings: They become mindful, discerning, intent, steadfast; They become conscientious, hence awake and full of wisdom.
They do not cease their accumulation of virtue and higher knowledge; Without weariness or laxity seeking power, They develop lands, features, and voices of buddhas Unceasing, all their deeds being for the weal of the living.
In order to mature people, they establish arts and skills— Writing, printing, mathematics, medical sciences, Exorcism, antidotes, curing, Establishing excellent education, compassionate, kind, intelligent.
Witty in the finest song and dance, they build delightful places— Canals, parks with flowers and fruits, places to sit, Doing many things for the pleasure of beings, Even revealing many kinds of treasure troves.
Mastering observation of the movements of celestial bodies and earth As well as physiognomy, They accomplish formless meditations, mystic knowledges, and the immeasurables, Desiring well-being and happiness for the world.
Arriving in the Difficult to Conquer stage, practitioners of higher wisdom Serve billions of buddhas and hear their teaching: Their goodness and heart become more radiant, Like gold sprinkled with jewels.
As the jewel palaces of the constellations Are not swept away by the wind, so are enlightening beings Unaffected while working in the world for beings’ sake, Like lotuses to which water does not cling.
In this stage, those experienced lords of contentment Destroy the actions of false teachers, the abodes of manifold views. All the good they do is in the cause of enlightened knowledge, Wishing to become saviors of beings, rich in the ten powers.
Arousing superior energy, unflagging, They serve a trillion buddhas; Having attained concentration, they shake a trillion worlds, Bearing the undertakings of the virtuous.
de ltar sa mchog lnga pa 'di/ / thabs kyi rnam pa khrag khrig gis/ / sems can gtso la yang dag tu/ / rgyal ba'i sras kyis bstan pa yin/ /
“Thus have enlightening beings, excellent guardians of the living, told of the fifth stage, called Difficult to Conquer, in myriad different ways.”
shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba zhes bya ba ste/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga pa'o/ /

mkhas pa rnams kyis mchog spyod pa rab thob nas/ / rgyal sras dga' zhing mkha' las me tog char 'bebs so/ / nor bu rin chen rnam dag 'od gsal rgya chen 'byung ba dag / bde bar gshegs la mngon 'thor dge zhes rnam par brjod/ /
lha rnams brgya phrag stong grangs dga' zhing bar snang las/ / lha rdzas yid 'ong rin chen sna tshogs phye ma'i rnams/ / bde bar gshegs la mngon 'thor byug pa phreng ba spos/ / gdugs dang rgyal mtshan ba dan se mo do yang 'bul/ /
lha yi dbang po dbang sgyur lha tshogs mang po dang / / steng gi nam mkha' la 'khod cing rin chen sprin yangs pa/ / rgyal ba mchod pa'i don du bde bar gshegs la 'thor/ / dga' ba'i sems kyis rgyal sras legs zhes rnam par brjod/ /
bar snang gnas las lha yi bu mo stong gis kyang / / glu dbyangs yid 'ong rol mo'i sgra dbyangs snyan pa phyung / / sgra rnams kun gyi dbyangs las 'di skad tshig kyang byung / / rgyal ba'i gsung ni yid 'ong nyon mongs gdung ba sel/ /

Having heard of the superior practice of this exalted stage of the wise the host of enlightening beings, delighted, showered flowers and sprinkled the Buddha with sublime jewels radiating pure light, uttering praise. A hundred thousand celestial beings in the sky, pleased, scattered exquisite varicolored celestial jewel dust on the Buddha, presenting incense, garlands, perfumes, parasols, decorative banners and pennants, and ornamental crescents. The commanding lord of the celestials, along with all heavenly hosts, hovering in the empyrean, well pleased and serene, showered clouds of jewels in offering to the Victor, urging the enlightening beings to speak. A thousand goddesses in the sky sang pleasantly and played music, singing as with one voice in praise of the Buddha, destroyer of the fire of afflictions:

chos rnams thams cad stong zhing dngos zhi mtshan ma med/ / nam mkha'i dbyings dang mtshungs mnyam rnam dag rnam mi rtog / 'gro dang gnas las rnam 'das ma lus spros pa med/ / de bzhin nyid du chos rnams yang dag mnyam mi rtog /
chos rnams kun la snang ba khong du sus chud pa/ / de la dngos dang dngos med g.yo ba gang yang med/ / snying rje brtse bas 'gro ba dgrol phyir brtson pa ni/ / de dang de dag rgyal sras chos kyi sku skyes pa'o/ /
mtshan ma thams cad spangs shing sbyin pa'i spyad pa spyod/ / tshul khrims shin tu sems dam sngon nas zhi zhing dul/ / 'gro ba'i don du chos kyi ye shes ma nyams bzod/ / brtson 'grus stobs dang ldan zhing chos rnams kun gyis dben/ /
nyon mongs bsal cing rnam dag bsam gtan tshul la zhugs/ / dngos po thams cad snga nas zhi zhing rnam par phye/ / ye shes spyod dang stobs phyug rtag tu 'gro don brtson/ / rgyal sras de dag sdig zhi che ba nyid dang ldan/ /

Empty nature quiescent, all things are signless, Equal to space, beyond discriminating thought, totally pure; Beyond motion or stillness, beyond philosophy, all equal in suchness, By their suchness, the essence of things is beyond thought.
Those who understand all things thus Are unmoved by existence or nonexistence: With compassion for the world, striving for liberation, They are offspring of Buddha, born from the Teaching.
They practice generosity without concern for appearances, With well-disciplined minds, fundamentally tranquil, extremely calm: They tolerate what is made in the world, knowing the imperishable truth; They are endowed with vigor and strength, detached from all things.
Having fully entered into meditation, exhausted afflictions, they are purified; Knowing all things, they are centered in primordial emptiness. Rich in knowledge and practical power, they are always devoted to the welfare of the world, For they are great beings, offspring of Buddha, having extinguished all evil.

de skad sgra dbyangs snyan pa stong grangs brjod byas nas/ / lha yi bu mo mi smra dad par thub la lta/ / rdo rje'i snying po 'jigs med la/ / thar pa'i zla bas yang smras pa/ / sa mchog lnga yi gong ma de; ; rnam pa ci 'dras 'grub par 'gyur/ /

Having uttered a thousand such songs, those beautiful goddesses hovered in the sky silently gazing at the Buddha, serene, enraptured with admiration for the Teaching. Moon of Liberation said, continuing, to Diamond Matrix, “What are the characteristices of attainment of the next stage after this fifth one?”

byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje snying pos smras pa/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga pa la sa'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni/ byang chub sems dpa' sa drug pa la 'jug go /de chos mnyam pa nyid bcus 'jug ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad mi skye ba mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad ma byung ba mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad dben pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad snga nas rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad spros pa med pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / mig yor dang / sgra brnyan dang / chu'i zla ba dang / gzugs brnyan dang / sprul pa dang mtshungs pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad dngos po yod pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / gnyis ka ma yin pa mnyam pa nyid de/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /chos mnyam pa nyid bcu po 'di dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa la 'jug go /de chos thams cad la rang bzhin de 'dra bar rab tu rtog cing spyod pa dang mthun par sems shing mi mthun par mi byed pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa mthun pa'i bzod pa rnon pos 'thob ste/ 'on kyang da dung mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa mngon du gyur pa ni thob pa ma yin no/ /

The enlightening being Diamond Matrix said, “Those who have thoroughly fulfilled the path of the fifth stage of enlightening beings enter into the sixth stage. They enter by way of ten equalities of things: by the equality of signlessness of all things; by the equality of nonorigination of all things; by the equality of absence of characteristic marks of all things; by the equality of nonbirth of all things; by the equality of detachment of all things; by the equality of primordial purity of all things; by the equality of nonconceptuality of all things; by the equality of all things in neither coming nor going; by the equality of all things in being like illusions, dreams, reflections, echoes, the moon’s image in the water, or apparitions; and by the equality of nonduality of existence and nonexistence of all things. Thus observing all things in terms of their intrinsic nature and according with it without opposition, they attain the sixth stage of enlightening beings, the stage of Presence. But this is only by penetrating conformative tolerance; they have not yet attained the tolerance of the nonorigination of things.

de chos thams cad la rang bzhin de ltar rtog pa'i tshe/ de bas kyang snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba dang; snying rje chen po la dbang bsgyur bas snying rje chen po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir/ 'jig rten 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa la rnam par lta'o/ / de 'jig rten 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa la lta ba'i tshe/ 'di snyam ste/ 'jig rten kun tu rgyu ba'i skye ba ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad bdag tu mngon par shes pa las 'byung ste/ bdag tu mngon par zhen pa dang bral na 'byung ba yang med par 'gyur ro/ / byis pa'i blo can bdag tu mngon par zhen pa/ mi shes pa'i rab rib kyis bsgribs pa yod pa dang med pa la mngon par mos pa/ tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la gzhol ba/ yang dag pa ma yin par rab tu zhugs pa/ log pa'i rjes su 'brang ba de dag ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa'i 'du byed nye bar gsog ste/ 'du byed de dag gis yongs su bsgos pa'i sems kyi sa bon zag pa dang bcas pa/ nye bar len pa dang bcas pa ni/ ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba dang / rga shi dang / yang srid pa mngon par 'grub pa 'byung ba nye bar song ba yin te/ las kyi zhing gi gzhi dang / ma rig pa'i mun pa dang / sred pa'i snum dang; nga'i nga rgyal gyis brlan pa'i lta ba'i rnam pa dang / dra ba rab tu 'phel bas ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu 'byung ste/ byung nas rnam par 'phel lo/ / ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu rnam par 'phel nas/ dbang po lnga 'byung bar 'gyur ro/ / dbang po lnga byung nas/ phan tshun 'dus shing phrad pas reg par 'gyur ro/ / reg pa 'dus pas tshor ba 'byung ngo/ / tshor ba de'i rjes su mngon par smon pas sred pa 'byung ngo/ / sred pa ni nye bar len pa rnam par 'phel bar byed do/ / nye bar len pa rnam par 'phel ba las srid pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro; ; srid pa byung nas phung po lnga po 'byung bar 'gyur te/ phung po lnga byung nas lam gyi rgyud lngar rim gyis dengs par 'gyur ro/ / dengs nas 'bral bar 'gyur te/ dengs shing bral bas mi dga' zhing yongs su gdung bar 'gyur ro/ / mi dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba'i rgyus mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa 'byung bar 'gyur yang de dag las su yang 'byung bar byed pa med do/ / rang bzhin dang lhun gyis grub par 'jig par 'gyur yang de dag la 'jig par byed pa su yang med do/ /zhes

“Thus understanding all things in their intrinsic nature, enlightening beings, all the more guided by compassion, commanded by great compassion, in order to completely fulfill great compassion, observe the formation and disintegration of the world. While observing the formation and disintegration of the world, it occurs to them, ‘The origins of worldly ways are all due to attachment to self. In those who have no attachment to self the development of worldly ways does not take place.’
“It also occurs to them, ‘These beings, intellectually infantile, attached to their selves, covered by the blinders of nescience, seeking existence and nonexistence, thinking illogically, gone on a wrong path, acting perversely, accumulate conditioned states of good, bad, and immobility. The mental seed conceived and planted by those conditioned states, imbued with taint and grasping, leads to future birth, old age, and death, coming into being as a result of renewed existence. In the field of action, in the darkness of ignorance, with the moisture of craving and the flow of egotism, the net of views grown, the sprouts of name and form appear. Having appeared, they grow, and, name and form having developed, the five senses become operative. From the intercourse of the operative senses comes contact. From the intercourse of contacts comes sensation. After sensation there is desire; thence craving and grasping grow. Once grasping is developed, becoming comes into existence. Once becoming has come into existence, the five clusters emerge. The five clusters having emerged, they progressively deteriorate in the five courses of existence. Having deteriorated, they disintegrate. From deterioration and disintegration there is anguish. Caused by anguish, all troubles of sadness, lament, pain, and dejection arise together. And yet there is no one who collects these. Of their own nature, spontaneously they disintegrate; there is no one who disintegrates them.’

de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lugs su mthun par rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la rab tu rtog go /de 'di snyam du sems te/ bden pa mngon par mi shes pa ni yang dag par ma rig pa ste/ ma rig pas byas pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa ni 'du byed rnams so/ / 'du byed la gnas pa'i sems dang po ni rnam par shes pa'o/ / rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig tu skyes pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po bzhi ni ming dang gzugs so; ; ming dang gzugs rnam par 'phel ba ni skye mched drug go /dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum phrad pa zag pa dang bcas pa ni reg pa'o/ / reg pa'i rjes las skyes pa ni tshor ba'o/ / tshor ba la chags pa ni sred pa'o/ / sred pa rnam par 'phel ba ni nye bar len pa'o/ / nye bar len pa las byung ba'i las zag pa dang bcas pa ni srid pa'o/ / las dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni skye ba'o/ / skye ba ni phung po 'byung ba'o/ / phung po yongs su smin pa ni rga ba'o/ / rgas nas phung po 'jig pa ni 'chi ba'o; ; 'chi zhing 'bral ba'i tshe myos shing chags par 'gyur ba'i sems la yongs su gdung ba ni mya ngan to/ / mya ngan las byung ba'i tshig tu brjod pa ni smre sngags 'don pa'o; ; dbang po lnga'i nyams su bab pa ni sdug bsngal lo/ / yid kyis lta ba'i nyams su bab ni yid mi bde ba'o/ / sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba mang po byung ba ni 'khrug pa ste; de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdong po 'ba' zhig byed pa po dang / tshor ba po med pa mngon par grub par 'gyur ro/ / de 'di snyam du sems te; byed pa po la mngon par chags pas las rnams yod par gyur te/ gang na byed pa po med pa de na don dam par na las kyang mi dmigs so/ / de 'di snyam du sems te/ 'di ltar khams gsum pa 'di ni sems tsam ste/ gang 'di srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu phye ste bka' stsal ba de dag thams cad kyang sems gcig la gnas pa dag go /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ dngos po gang la 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems skyes pa de ni rnam par shes pa'o/ / dngos po ni 'du byed do/ / 'du byed la mgo rmongs pa ni ma rig pa'o/ / ma rig pa'i sems dang lhan cig skyes pa ni ming dang gzugs so/ / ming dang gzugs rnam par 'phel ba ni drug gi skye mched do// dgru gi skye mchod dang 'brel ba ni reg pa'o/ / reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa ni tshor ba'o/ / tshor bas mi ngoms pa ni sred pa'o/ / sred pas mnar te sdug cing mi gtong ba ni nye bar len pa'o/ / srid pa'i yan lag 'byung ba 'di dag ni srid pa'o/ / srid pa 'byung ba ni skye ba'o/ / skye ba yongs su smin pa ni rga ba'o/ / rga ba dang bral ba ni 'chi ba'o/ /
