Enlightening beings acting in accord with such knowledge never stop the vision of buddhas in concentration—in each age seeing countless buddhas, they honor, respect, and venerate them. With immense vision of buddhas they ceaselessly attend them respectfully and ask the buddhas questions. They attain mental command of the Teaching and can expound it.
“Those purified roots of goodness of enlightening beings become all the more beyond compare. Just as gold fashioned into ornaments, perfected by a skilled goldsmith and put on the head or neck of a universal monarch, cannot be outshone by the adornments of all minor kings and people of the four continents, in the same way the roots of goodness of enlightening beings in the stage of Good Mind, well arrayed by the light of great knowledge, are so purified that they cannot be outshone by all listeners, individual illuminates, and enlightening beings in lower stages. The light of their roots of goodness, shining on the mental tangles of afflictions of sentient beings, put an end to them. Just as great Brahmas of million-world systems illumine the thickets and lowlands in all worlds of the million-world system, in the same way does the light of roots of goodness of enlightening beings in this stage of Good Mind shine on the mental thickets of afflictions of sentient beings and put an end to them. Of the ten transcendent ways, transcendent power is predominant in these enlightening beings, while they practice the others as best they can.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya ba ste/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa dgu pa mdor bstan pa'o/ / rgya cher ni bskal pa mu med pa'i bstan pa'i mthar thug par shes par bya'o/ / de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni phal cher tshangs pa chen por gyur te/ stobs dang mthu chen po thob pa/ stong gnyis la dbang zhing zil gyis gnon la gzhan gyis zil gyis mi non pa/ mthun pa'i don mthong ba/ dbang shin tu thob pa/ sems can rnams la nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad ston pa la mkhas shing mthu yod pa ste/ sems can gyi bsam pa yongs su dris pa bstan pas mi 'phrogs pa yin/ de sbyin pa'am/ ngag snyan pa'am/ don bsgrub pa'am/ don mthun pas dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ci rtsom yang rung ste/ de thams cad ji ltar na/ sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur/ gtso bor 'gyur/ thu bor 'gyur/ phul du 'gyur/ dam par 'gyur/ bla na med par 'gyur/ 'dren par 'gyur/ yongs su 'dren par 'gyur ba nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la rten pa'i bar du 'gyur snyam ste/ sangs rgyas yid la bya ba dang / chos yid la bya ba dang / dge 'dun yid la bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' yid la bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yid la bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa yid la bya ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa yid la bya ba dang / stobs yid la bya ba dang / mi 'jigs pa yid la bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa yid la bya ba nas/ rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar du yid la bya ba dang mi 'bral ba yin te/ de 'dod na skad cig yud tsam thang cig tu ting nge 'dzin sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa brgya stong phrag bcu tshang ba'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed rab tu thob cing de dag la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa brgya stong phrag bcu tshang ba'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed mthong ba dang / de dag gi byin gyi rlabs kyang yang dag par shes pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa brgya stong phrag bcu tshang ba'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed skyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa brgya stong phrag bcu tshang ba'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du 'gro ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa brgya stong phrag bcu tshang ba'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed snang bar bya ba dang / sems can sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa brgya stong phrag bcu tshang ba'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed yongs su smin par bya ba dang / bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa brgya stong phrag bcu tshang ba'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du gnas par bya ba dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa brgya stong phrag bcu tshang ba'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed la rab tu 'jug pa dang / chos kyi sgo sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa brgya stong phrag bcu tshang ba'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed rnam par 'byed pa dang / lus sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa brgya stong phrag bcu tshang ba'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed yongs su bstan pa dang / lus re re la yang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa brgya stong phrag bcu tshang ba'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed yang dag par bstan pa'i brtson 'grus kyi rnam pa de lta bu rtsom mo/ / de yan chad byang chub sems dpa' smon lam gyi mthu can rnams/ smon lam gyi khyad par gyis rnam par 'phrul te/ de dag gi lus sam/ 'od dam/ rdzu 'phrul lam/ mig gam/ spyod yul lam/ dbyangs sam/ spyod pa'am/ rgyan tam/ byin gyi rlabs sam/ mos pa'am/ mngon par 'du byed pa dag kyang bskal pa du ma dang / bskal pa brgya phrag du ma dang / bskal pa stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa brgya stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du mas kyang bgrang bar dka'o/ /

“This is a summary explanation of the ninth stage of enlightening beings, called Good Mind, the full details of which would take forever to tell. Most of the enlightening beings in this stage become great Brahmas of enormous power, lords of a million worlds, eminent, unsurpassed, seers of what is beneficial, masterful, able and strong in the exposition of the ways of transcendence of all listeners, individual illuminates, and enlightening beings, invincible in answering questions according to beings’ dispositions. Whatever actions they undertake, whether by giving, kind speech, beneficial action, or cooperation, it is never apart from thoughts of Buddha, the Teaching, the Community, enlightening beings, the practices of enlightening beings, the ways of transcendence, the stages, the powers, expertises, and unique qualities of Buddhas, and ultimately omniscience in all its aspects. Why? Because they want to become the best of beings, unexcelled leaders and guides, and ultimately omniscient refuges.
“With this desire they exert their energy, by which exertion of energy they attain in one instant as many concentrations as atoms in countless millions of buddha-lands, see as many buddhas as atoms in countless millions of buddha-lands and become aware of their power, shake as many worlds as atoms in countless millions of buddha-lands, go to as many buddha-lands as atoms in countless millions of buddha-lands, illumine as many lands as atoms in countless millions of buddha-lands, mature as many beings as atoms in countless millions of buddha-lands, abide for as many eons as atoms in countless millions of buddha-lands, penetrate as many eons past and future as atoms in countless millions of buddha-lands, ascertain as many ways of entry into the Teaching as atoms in countless millions of buddha-lands, and manifest as many bodies as atoms in countless millions of buddha-lands, manifesting each body accompanied by as many enlightening beings as atoms in countless millions of buddha-lands. Beyond that, enlightening beings with the power of vows perform, by the excellence of their vows, countless transformations, of the body, aura, mystic powers, vision, sphere of action, voice, conduct, adornment, power, resolution, and performances.”
de nas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos sa'i don 'di nyid yang brtag par bya ba dang / bstan par bya ba'i phyir de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so; ;
Then Diamond Matrix spoke these verses describing this stage:

de dag tshad med stobs kyi blo yis rnam dpyod cing / / ye shes phra ba'i dam pa 'gro bas shes dka' ba/ / de bzhin bde gshegs gsang ba'i gnas la yang dag 'jug / 'gro ba'i don byed de dag sa dgu yongs su gnon/ /
de dag gzungs mchog ting 'dzin che ba nyid mchog dang / / mngon shes yangs dang de bzhin zhing 'jug mtha' yas dang / / stobs dang rtogs pa'i ye shes rgyal ba'i brten gnas dang / / smon lam snying rje'i bsam pas mkhas pa dgu la 'jug /
sa dgu ldan pa de dag rgyal ba'i mdzod 'dzin cing / / dge ba'i chos dang mi dge lung du ma bstan dang / / zag dang bcas dang 'jig rten pa dang 'phags pa dang / / bsam du rung dang bsam du mi rung mkhas pas shes/ /
nges pa'i chos dang ma nges chos kyang rab tu rtogs/ / theg gsum phun sum tshogs pa'i bya ba yongs su 'jal/ / 'dus byas rnam par phye dang grangs dang rgyu ba dang / / 'jig rten ji ltar mngon byed de la rab tu 'jug /
de dag de 'dra'i shes ldan blo mchog phra ldan pa/ / sems can sems kyi thibs po yongs su rtog pa byed/ / rnam shes sna tshogs myur du 'gyur zhing ldog pa dang / / rnam shes mtha' yas 'byung la rtag tu mkhas pa 'jug /
nyon mongs mtha' yas sbyor dang grogs su 'gyur ba dang / / kun nas 'khor dang bag nyal 'gro rgyud mtshams sbyor dang / / las rnams sna tshogs rnam par phye la'ang de bzhin 'jug / rgyu dang 'gog dang de bzhin 'bras bu 'jig pa'ang yang dag 'jug /
dbang po rno dang tha ma 'bring dang yangs pa dang / / tha dang sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' la'ang yang dag 'jug / mos pa dge dang mi dge sna tshogs du ma dag / stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi kun la yang dag 'jug /
khams kyi rnam pa nyon mongs lta ba srid pa rnams/ / thibs por gyur ba snga phyi med cing 'chad med dang / / bag nyal bsam pa lhan cig skyes pa'i rgyud rnams kyi/ / sems rnams kun rgyu 'brel cing rgyun chad mi 'gyur ba/ /
bsam pa bag nyal rgyud yod dngos po ma yin te/ / yul la mi gnas bsam pa yongs su 'bral mi 'gyur/ / shes pa dka' ba'i bsam gtan yul las phyir mi ldog / rdo rje lta bu'i lam gyis chod 'gyur gzhan gyis min/ /
rgyud drug skye ba rnam par phye la rab tu 'jug / sred rlan ma rig mun pa de bzhi las kyi zhing; ; rnam shes sa bon can 'byung myu gu ming dang gzugs/ / khams gsum sngon mtha' med par de dag rab tu 'jug /
de dag bag chags tshul dang nyon mongs las dang sems/ / 'dod chags bral bas lam gyi rgyud du 'byung ba min/ / sems can phung po gsum du nges pa yang dag shes/ / lta bar bying ba shes pa'i lam dang de dag ldan/ /
de 'dra'i shes ldan sa mchog 'di la gnas pa ste/ / sems can bsam pa mos pa dbang po'i tshul bzhin du/ / chos rnams rnam par phye zhing shin tu ston pa byed/ / tha dad yang dag don shes nges tshig spobs pa yis/ /
de dag chos smra'i tshul la gnas pa rab tu thob/ / seng ge khyu mchog dpe 'dra ri yi rgyal po 'dra/ / bdud rtsi sprin chen zhim pa'i char yang rab tu 'babs/ / klu yi dbang pos rgya mtsho rgyas pa byed pa bzhin/ /
don gyi don shes de bzhin chos nyid rab tu shes/ / nges tshig rjes su song zhing spobs pa rab tu thob/ / de dag grangs med stong phrag bcu yi gzungs thob bas/ / chos rnams 'dzin pa rgya mtsho sprin chen char 'dzin bzhin/ /
de dag de 'dra'i ting 'dzin gzungs gsal thob gyur pas/ / skad cig gcig gis sangs rgyas mang po stong yang mthong / / rin chen chos rnams thos nas yang du ston byed de/ / tshig gi dkyil 'khor rnam dag dbyangs kyi yan lag ldan/ /
'dod na stong gsum 'jig rten khams su gtogs pa yi/ / sems can bsam sems sna tshogs tshul bzhin smin byed cing / / thams cad bsam pa dbang po ji bzhin tshim par byed/ / gling bzhi rgya mtsho'i sprin bzhin yang dag rab tu 'jug /
de bas gong du legs ldan brtson 'grus rab thob pa/ / skra rtse'i go gcig bsam gyis mi khyab sems pa byed/ / sems can sna tshogs mang la bde gshegs chos ston pa/ / thos nas sa bon kun 'dzin sa bzhin yongs su 'dzin/ /
phyogs rnams bcu po'i sems can mang po ji snyed pa/ / de dag thams cad 'khor gcig 'dus par 'khod gyur kyang / / de dag bsam pa skad cig gcig gis bsam byas shing / / sgra skad gcig gis de dag thams cad tshim par byed/ /
'di la gnas pa chos rgyal lha mi mchog tu 'gyur/ / rgyal ba'i sras po chos kyis yongs su skyong ba yin/ / nyin mtshan kun tu rgyal ba rnams dang rtag par 'grogs/ / zab yangs ye shes rnam par thar pa ldan par gnas/ /
de dag yang du sangs rgyas khrag khrig bsnyen bkur byed/ / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyan bzang yongs su byang ba bzhin/ / de yi 'od kyang nyon mongs thibs po snang ba byed/ / tshangs pa'i 'od kyis stong gnyis 'jig rten ji bzhin no/ /
'di la gnas pa legs ldan tshangs chen 'jig rten du/ / skye 'gyur theg gsum ston la mkhas shing mthu yod pa/ / 'gro ba kun la phan phyir ci tsam gang yang rung / / yon tan shes ldan bde gshegs ye shes ldan pa bsngo/ /
grangs med zhing du gtogs pa'i rdul phran du yod pa/ / de snyed ting 'dzin skad cig gcig tu brtan pas thob; ; phyogs rnams kun gyi rgyal ba mthong zhing gsung yang nyan/ / yan chad smon lam ldan pa tshad med rnam par 'phrul/ /

Contemplating with immeasurably powerful intellect, With very subtle knowledge, atom-splitting knowledge, Thus entering into the abode of the secret of buddhas, They reach the ninth stage, benefactors of the world.
Their mental command and concentration are great, Their far-reaching mystic knowledge enters all lands. With certainty of knowledge and power, this is the abode of steadfastness of the conquerers— The wise with commitment and compassion enter this ninth stage.
Those who have reached this stage, holders of buddhas’ treasury, Know what is good, what is bad, and what is neutral, What is tainted and worldly, and what is transcendent, What is conceivable and what is inconceivable.
They examine what is certain and what is uncertain, And foster the practices accomplishing the Three Vehicles. Teachings of the stages, according to inclinations and conduct, They prepare and enter the world accordingly.
With superior subtle intellect following such knowledge, They search out the mental tangles of sentient beings: They search out the various tangles of mind And comprehend who can be taught, what the end and the beginning are.
They comprehend beginningless afflictions, in their interrelatedness of application, As well as the continuity of their courses through compulsive propensities, And in terms of the various differences in process of action, And the vanishing of effect with extinction of cause.
They comprehend which faculties are weak, middling, and strong, And continuity between past and future: Inclinations of various kinds, and whether or not they are pure, They comprehend, all, eighty-four thousand.
Worldly beings are developed into different dispositions, Gone into the tangles of afflictions and views, beginningless, endless, never cut off, Continually bound up with the mind Born together with and stuck to inclinations and propensities.
Those inclinations and propensities are not real things, They have no location and are not apart from mind; Hard to know, unconquerable by the states of meditation, They can be cut off only by the diamond thunderbolt of the Path.
Entering the variety of six courses of migration of life, Craving being the moisture, ignorance the shade, action the field, Consciousness the seeds, name and form the simultaneous sprouts— Thus do they see beings in the world, beginningless and endless.
Those beings’ minds are full of the action of afflictions, according to patterns of habit— Apart from this they have no desire for further continuation of transmigration. The enlightening beings know who are stabilized in truth, in error, and indeterminate, Who are those sunk in views, and who are those with knowledge.
With these reflections, stationed in this stage, Enlightening beings reveal the Teaching in different ways According to people’s dispositions, faculties, and inclinations, Versed in analytic knowledge, meanings, elocution, and expression.
They are in the position of preachers of the Teaching, Like lions, like bulls, like majestic mountains; They shower the sweet rain of the elixir of immortality, Just as the water spirits fill the sea.
Skilled in seeking out meanings, as well as the essence of things, Comprehending all expressions, they have mastered elocution; Having attained countless millions of decades of concentration spells, They hold the Teachings as the ocean holds the rain.
Thus having attained concentration by purification through spells, They see thousands of buddhas in one instant; And having gained the treasure of the Teaching, they expound it, Reaching each and every sphere with its purifying sound.
They set the various beings of the billion worlds Free by means of the three treasures, Satisfying all according to their faculties and dispositions, Like water spirits filling the ocean.
With even greater virtue they exert their energy And think how there are, in a minute point, Unthinkable numbers of buddhas teaching, and various beings; Hearing the teachings, they hold them as the earth holds seeds.
As many beings as there are in the ten directions, All sit in a single circle of assembly: Appearing to them all in a single instant, enlightening beings Will satisfy them all with a single utterance.
Stationed here, masters of the Teaching, highest of humans and gods, They become children of buddhas, moving by the teachings: Day and night they are in the company of the buddhas, Established in profound tranquillity, firm in knowledge and liberation.
They attend millions of buddhas And become purified, like the adornments of a monarch; Their light overcomes the obscurities of afflictions Like the light of Brahma illumining a million worlds.
In this stage they become Brahma gods, imbued with virtue, And satisfy beings with the teachings of the Three Vehicles. What they undertake is for the benefit of all beings; Following enlightened knowledge, they attain virtue and knowledge.
In a single instant they attain as many concentrations As atoms in immeasurable lands, steadfast: Seeing the buddhas of the ten directions, they hear the Teaching, And beyond that, by willpower, they work innumerable miracles.
'di ni sa rab dgu pa ste/ / ye shes chen pos rnam par spyod; ; zab cing blta dka' shin tu phra/ / rgyal ba'i sras kyis bstan pa yin/ /
“Thus has been told the ninth stage of those contemplating great knowledge, profound, hard to see, subtle, the ninth stage of enlightening beings, called Good Mind.”
legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya ba ste/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa dgu pa'o// //
bam po lnga bcu gnyis pa/

spyod pa bla na med pa 'di thos nas/ / gtsang gnas lha rnams bye ba rab tu dga'/ / dbang po tshim par bar snang mkha' la gnas/ / bde bar gshegs la rje sar mchod pa byed/ /
byang chub sems dpa' bye ba bsam yas pa/ / bar snang mkha' gnas rab tu dga' gyur cing / / spos sprin tshad med yid du 'ong ba dag / 'gro ba'i nyon mongs sel ba dri zhim bdug pa byed/ /
lha yi dbang po dbang sgyur rab dga' zhing / / bar snang gnas las lha 'khor khrag khrig dang / / rim gro bcas par gos rnams 'dor bar byed/ / yid 'ong gos brgya yongs su bskor ba byas/ /
lha yi bu mo mang po shin tu dga'/ / bde bar gshegs la rjes sa mchod pa byed/ / rol mo brdung ba bye ba khrag khrig byed/ / 'di 'dra'i sgra dbyangs kun las byung bar gyur/ /

Thus having heard of unsurpassed practice, millions of celestials of the Pure Abodes were delighted; they stood in the sky, their senses enraptured, and paid honor to the Buddha. Endless millions of enlightening beings hovering in the sky were gladdened; they burnt clouds of incense, incomparably delightful, destroying the afflictions of the world. The king of the heaven of power, pleased, was in the sky with a retinue of trillions, all respectfully showering vestments, beautiful, excellent, by the hundreds. Many goddesses, their senses delighted, honored the Buddha respectfully, playing trillions of musical instruments, uttering such words as these:

zhing mchog gcig na bde bar gshegs pa bzhugs/ / zhing rnams kun tu sku gzugs rab tu bstan/ / sku gzugs khrag khrig sna tshogs yid du 'ong / / chos dbyings rgya chen yongs su rgyas par gang / /
spu gcig rtse nas bde gshegs 'od bkye ba/ / 'gro ba'i nyon mongs yongs su zhi bar 'phro/ / zhing gi rdul khams zad par nus 'gyur gyi/ / de dag bgrang bas shes par mi nus so/ /
la las sangs rgyas mtshan rab mnga' bar mthong / / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i dam par la las mthong / / zhing rnams la lar spyod pa mchog mdzad cing / / dag cing zhi bar rkang gnyis dam pa mthong / /
dga' ldan gnas na mgon po bzhugs pa dang / / 'pho dang gshegs par de bzhin rab tu snang / / zhing rnams bye bar yum gyi skur bzhugs dang / / zhing rnams la lar skye ba de bzhin snang / /
'gro ba'i don du mgon po 'byung mdzad dang; ; byang chub dam pa mchog tu 'tshang rgya ba'i/ / chos kyi 'khor lo mya ngan 'da' ba dag / zhing mang khrag khrig kun na de bzhin snang / /
sgyu ma'i mkhan po mkhas par lobs gyur pa/ / ji ltar 'tsho phyir gzugs mang ston pa bzhin/ / de bzhin ston pa ye shes mchog mkhyen pa/ / sku gzugs kun tu 'gro ba rnams la ston/ /
stong pa zhi ba rang bzhin mtshan nyid med/ / chos nyid bar snang mkha' dang mnyam par yang / / sangs rgyas ston pa don dam de nyid du/ / sangs rgyas spyod yul mchog gis yang dag bstan/ /
bde gshegs spyod yul rang bzhin ci 'dra ba/ / sems can kun gyi chos nyid de 'dra ste/ / mtshan dang mtshan gzhi mnyam pa nyid kyis 'dra/ / mtshan nyid med pa chos rnams kun gyi mchog /
bde gshegs ye shes don du su gnyer bas/ / rtog dang rnam rtog yongs rtog yongs su spangs/ / dngos dang dngos med mnyam nyid shes par gyis/ / myur du mi yi gtso bo mchog tu 'gyur/ /

The Buddha, sitting in one land, Appears reflected in all lands; Bodies of millions of varieties, pleasing, Pervade the reaches of the cosmos.
From one hair of the Buddha light beams Emerge, annihilating the afflictions of the world; The elemental particles of the land may be counted, But the number of those light beams cannot be known.
Sometimes they show buddhas imbued with supreme characteristics Turning the wheel of the highest teaching; Sometimes there appears the lord of humans, pure and calm, With his most excellent, unsurpassed conduct, in other lands.
The Guide is seen in the abode of happiness, Dying there and so coming to earth, In the womb, thus in millions of lands, Or seen being born there in the land.
The Guide, going forth for the sake of the world And becoming supremely enlightened, So turning the wheel of the Teaching, Is seen in millions of lands.
Just as a magician versed in the arts of magic Shows many objects for people, So does the Teacher, versed in supreme knowledge, Show all bodies to people.
Empty, quiescent, essentially signless, The nature of things is equal to space— The enlightened Teacher, by ultimate truth, Shows the exalted sphere of buddhas.
As is the essence of the buddhas, So is that of sentient beings—found in the nature of things. Signs and signlessness are equal in that way— All things are ultimately signless.
Those who seek enlightened knowledge Abandon assumptions, notions, imaginations; Aware that being and nonbeing are the same in essence, They will quickly become supreme human leaders.

'di 'dra'i sgra skad stong snyed du/ / snyan pa'i dbyangs su brjod byas nas/ / lha yi bu mo mi smra zhing / / zhi la dga' bar bde gshegs lta/ /
'khor rnams zhi bar shes gyur nas/ / rnam thar zla ba 'jigs med pas/ / rdo rje'i snying po 'jigs med pa/ / rgyal sras de la yang smras pa/ /
bcu par yang dag 'phar ba yi/ / rnam pa yon tan spyod yul dang / / mtshan ma dag dang cho 'phrul rnams/ / mkhas pas kun kyang bstan par mdzod/ /

Having spoken thousands of such sweet words, the goddesses, looking at the Buddha, became silent and remained quiet. Knowing the assembly was settled, the fearless Moon of Liberation asked Diamond Matrix, the dauntless enlightening being, “Tell us, in order, all the characteristics, qualities, and sphere of those who come to the tenth stage, as well as their marks and miracles.”

byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos smras pa/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de ltar byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sa dgu pa'i bar du shes par bya ba tshad med pa yongs su brtags pa'i blos rnam par dbye ba shin tu rnam par phye ba/ chos dkar po shin tu rdzogs pa bsags par bya ba'i tshogs mtha' yas pa shin tu bsags pa/ bsod nams dang ye shes kyis tshogs yongs su zin pa/ snying rje chen po shin tu yangs pa thob pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par phye ba rnam pa tha dad pa la mkhas pa/ sems can gyi khams thibs pos nye bar spyod pa la rab tu zhugs pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul la 'jug pa dang ldan pa'i 'du shes dang / yid la byed pa can stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos la lhag par dmigs pa'i rjes su song ba ni/ rnam pa thams cad du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la dbang bskur ba'i sa thob pa zhes bya'o/ /

Diamond Matrix said, “Those enlightening beings who, having wisely reflected on the possibilities of knowledge up to the ninth stage, have made a thorough and discerning investigation, have thoroughly fulfilled pure practices, have gathered inexhaustible provisions, have acquired great stores of virtue and knowledge, have attained great, far-reaching compassion, are familiar with the distinctions and differentiations of worldly realms, have gone into the thickets of the realms of sentient beings, focus their perception and attention on approaching entry into the sphere of buddhas, and are intent on the powers, expertises, and other qualities of buddhahood, are said to have reached the stage of coronation with omniscience in all its aspects.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /byang chub sems dpa' ye shes de lta bu dang ldan zhing dbang bskur ba'i sa thob pa de la byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin dri ma med pa zhes bya ba mngon du 'gyur ro/ / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin chos kyi dbyings rnam par phye ba la 'jug pa zhes bya ba dang / snying po byang chub kyi rgyan rnam par phye ba zhes bya ba dang; 'od zer gyi me tog rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba dang / rgya mtsho'i snying po zhes bya ba dang / rgya mtsho'i rgya zhes bya ba dang / nam mkha'i dbyings ltar yangs pa zhes bya ba dang / chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa'i rjes su song ba zhes bya ba dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad mngon sum du bzhugs pa zhes bya ba mngon du 'gyur te/ de la de dag la sogs pa ting nge 'dzin brgya stong phrag grangs med pa phrag bcu mngon du 'gyur ro/ /

“Furthermore, enlightening beings who accord with this knowledge and have reached the stage of coronation realize a concentration called undefiled, one called entry into the analysis of differentiations of the cosmos, one called array of adornments of the pinnacle of enlightenment, one called flower of lights of all appearances, one called oceanic container, one called oceanic plenitude, one called vast as space, once called ascertainment of the intrinsic essence of all things, one called adjusting to the mental behavior of all beings, and one called appearing in the presence of all buddhas. Beginning with these, they realize incalculable millions of concentrations.

de ting nge 'dzin de dag thams cad la mnyam par gzhog cing rnam par ldang ngo/ / de ting nge 'dzin la mkhas pa dang ldan pa yin te/ ting nge 'dzin gyi dgos pa de dag thams cad la'ang rab tu spyod do/ / ting nge 'dzin brgya stong grangs med pa phrag bcu'i tha ma la thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi khyad par gyis mngon par dbang bskur ba zhes bya ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du 'gyur te/ de mngon du gyur ma thag tu stong gsum brgya stong phrag bcu'i tha gru dang mnyam pa'i rin po che'i pad+mo chen po rin po che thams cad kyis rnam pa thams cad du spras shing brgyan pa; 'jig rten thams cad kyi spyod yul las 'das pa/ 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bas byung ba/ sgyu ma'i rang bzhin dang spyod yul gyis yongs su grub pa/ chos kyi dbyings la shin tu gnas par snang ba/ lha rdzas kyi yul las shin tu 'das pa/ nor bu rin po che bai DU r+ya'i chu ba chen po can/ tsan dan gyi rgyal po mtshungs pa med pa'i snying po can/ a.asma gar+b+ha rab kyi ze ba can/ 'dzam bu chu klung gis gser ltar snang ba'i lo ma can/ 'od zer tshad med pas shin tu rgyas pa'i lhun can/ rin po che thams cad kyi nang yongs su spras pa/ rin po che mu med pa'i dra bas kun nas yog pa/ stong gsum brgya stong phrag bcu tshang ba'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi rin po che'i pad+mo chen po'i 'khor dang ldan pa 'byung bar 'gyur te/ byang chub sems dpa' de'i lus kyang de dang rkyen du 'tsham zhing / de'i tshul dang mthun par gnas so/ / de thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi khyad par gyis dbang bskur ba dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob ma thag tu rin po che'i pad+mo'i rgyal po chen po de la 'dug par snang ste/ rin po che'i pad+mo'i rgyal po chen po de la byang chub sems dpa' de 'dug ma thag tu rin po che'i pad+mo'i rgyal po chen po de'i 'khor rin po che'i pad+mo ji snyed byung ba de snyed kyi byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa' de yongs su bskor te/ rin po che'i pad+mo chen po de dag la 'khod nas/ byang chub sems dpa' de nyid la lta zhing / de dag re re yang ting nge 'dzin brgya stong phrag bcu bcu la snyoms par 'jug go /byang chub sems dpa' de dang / byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis mnyam par bzhag ma thag tu 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus par g.yo bar 'gyur ro/ / ngan song thams cad rtse zhil bar 'gyur ro/ / chos kyi dbyings thams cad snang bas rgyas par 'gyur ro/ / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad yongs su dag par 'gyur ro/ / zhing thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi sgra grag par 'gyur ro/ / skal ba dang spyod pa mthun pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyang 'du bar 'gyur ro/ / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi lha dang mi'i rol mo brdung ba dang / dkrol ba'i sgra yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro/ / sems can thams cad kyi bde ba yang skye bar 'gyur ro/ / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad la bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mchod pa dang / rim gro yang rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro/ / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor kyang rnam par dmigs par 'gyur te/

“They enter and emerge from all these concentrations, and, having attained skill in concentration, they experience all the effects of concentration. At the end of the incalculable millions of concentrations, one realizes a concentration of enlightening beings called bearing coronation by the special property of omniscient knowledge. At the moment one realizes this concentration, there appears an immeasurable lotus made of the finest jewels, as large as ten billion-world universes, inlaid with all kinds of jewels, beyond the range of all worlds, arisen from transmundane roots of goodness, existing in the realm of the essence of illusoriness, appearing based on the cosmos, beyond the range of the heavens, with a jewel stem, a pericarp of incomparable sandalwood, a fringe of huge emeralds, leaves of shining gold, its body flowering with innumerable rays of light, its interior filled with all the finest jewels, covered with a boundlessly vast net of jewels, surrounded by as many great jewel lotuses as atoms in ten billion-world universes.
“The enlightening being, in a corresponding form, stands by and, immediately upon attainment of the concentration bearing coronation with the special qualities of omniscience, appears seated on the great jewel lotus. As soon as the enlightening being is seated on this great jewel lotus, as many enlightening beings as there are surrounding jewel lotuses come from the ten directions, circle that enlightening being, and sit on those great surrounding jewel lotuses, and each of them enter a million concentrations, while gazing on the central enlightening being. Immediately upon everyone’s entry into concentration, all worlds quake, all ills cease, all universes are pervaded with revealing light, all worlds are purified, the names of all buddha-lands are voiced, all enlightening beings of the same practice gather, all celestial and human music and song sound forth, all beings become blissful, the inconceivable honoring and attendance of all the perfectly enlightened ones commence, and the circles of all the buddhas are made known.

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /byang chub sems dpa' de ni rin po che'i pad+mo'i rgyal po de la 'dug ma thag tu rkang pa'i mthil gnyis kyi 'og nas 'od zer brgya stong grangs med pa phrag bcu 'byung ngo/ / byung nas kyang phyogs bcur mnar med pa'i sems can dmyal ba chen po yan chad snang bar byas te/ sdug bsngal rnams kyang rab tu zhi bar byed do/ / pus mo'i lha nga gnyis nas 'od zer brgya stong grangs med pa phrag bcu 'byung ste/ byung nas kyang phyogs bcur byol song gi skye gnas kyi gnas thams cad snang bar byas nas/ sdug bsngal rnams kyang rab tu zhi bar byed do/ / lte ba'i dkyil 'khor nas 'od zer brgya stong grangs med pa phrag bcu 'byung ste/ byung nas kyang phyogs bcur gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad snang bar byas nas/ sdug bsngal rnams kyang rab tu zhi bar byed do/ / g.yas g.yon gyi rtsib logs gnyis nas 'od zer brgya stong grangs med pa phrag bcu 'byung ste/ byung nas kyang phyogs bcur mi'i gnas rnams snang bar byas te/ sdug bsngal rnams kyang rab tu zhi bar byed do/ / lag pa'i mthil gnyis nas 'od zer brgya stong grangs med pa phrag bcu 'byung ste/ byung nas kyang phyogs bcur lha dang lha ma yin gyi gnas rnams snang bar byas nas/ sdug bsngal rnams kyang rab tu zhi bar byed do/ / phrag pa gnyis nas 'od zer brgya stong grangs med pa phrag bcu 'byung ste/ byung nas kyang phyogs bcur nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams kyi gnas snang bar byas nas/ chos snang ba'i sgo yang nye bar bsgrub bo/ / rgyab dang mgul nas 'od zer brgya stong grangs med pa phrag bcu 'byung ste; byung nas kyang rang sangs rgyas kyi gnas thams cad snang bar byas nas/ zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul gyi sgo'ang nye bar sgrub bo/ / kha'i sgo nas 'od zer brgya stong grangs med pa phrag bcu 'byung ste/ byung nas kyang phyogs bcur byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ba yan chad sa dgu pa thob pa'i bar dag snang bar byas nas/ shes rab dang thabs kyi tshul gyi sgo yang nye bar bsgrub bo/ / smin mtshams kyi mdzod spu nas 'od zer brgya stong grangs med pa phrag bcur 'byung ste/ byung nas kyang phyogs bcur bdud kyi gnas thams cad zil gyi mnan te/ dbang bskur ba'i sa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams snang bar byas nas de dag gi lus su nub par 'gyur ro/ / yan lag dam pa'i spyi gtsug nas 'od zer stong gsum brgya stong grangs med pa phrag bcu tshang ba'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'byung ste/ byung nas kyang phyogs bcur de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad snang bar byas te/ 'jig rten lan bcur bskor ba byas nas steng gi nam mkha'i dbyings la 'dug ste/ 'od zer gyi dra ba'i dkyil 'khor du byas nas/ de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod cing rim gro bya ba 'od shin tu gsal ba zhes bya ba rab tu byed do/ / mchod pa dang rim gro de la sems dang po bskyed pa nye bar bzung ba yan chad sa dgu pa thob kyi bar du de bzhin gshegs pa mchod cing rim gro byas pas brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o/ / stong gi cha dang / brgya stong gi cha dang / khrag khrig gi cha dang / khrag khrig brgya'i cha dang / khrag khrig stong gi cha dang / khrag khrig brgya stong gi cha dang / bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o/ / grangs dang; cha dang / bgrang ba dang / dpe dang / rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro ba nas/ bsgrun pa tsam gyi bar du'ang mi chog go /'od zer gyi dra ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po de las phyogs bcu na me tog tu gdags pa dang / spos dang / bdug pa dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / rin po che'i rgyan dang / nor bu rin po cher gdags pa ci yod pa de dag thams cad las lhag cing 'jig rten gyi yul thams cad las 'das pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i dbang gis grub pa dag sprin chen po'i char bzhin du mngon par 'bab bo/ / mchod pa de dag sems can gang gis mthong ba de dag thams cad kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'gyur ro/ / mchod pa dang rim gro'i rnam pa de lta bu dag byas nas kyang 'od zer de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad snang bar byas nas/ 'jig rten lan bcur bskor ba byas te/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi zhabs kyi mthil gyi 'og tu nub par 'gyur te/ de nas de bzhin gshegs pa de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa che ge mo zhig tu de lta bu'i spyod pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dbang bskur ba'i dus la bab par thugs su chud do/ /

“What is the reason for that? As soon as the enlightening being sits on this great jewel lotus, from the soles of the enlightening being’s feet emerge countless millions of light rays, which illumine the uninterrupted great hells in the ten directions and extinguish the torments of the beings in the hells. From the circles on the knees of the enlightening being emerge countless millions of light rays which illumine all the animal realms in the ten directions and extinguish the sufferings of all the animals. From the sphere of the navel emerge countless millions of rays of light which illumine all the ghost realms in the ten directions and extinguish all the pains of all the beings in the ghost realms. From the left and right sides of the enlightening being emerge countless millions of rays of light which illumine the humans in the ten directions and extinguish human sufferings. From both hands emerge countless millions of light rays which illumine the abodes of celestials and titans, extinguishing their pains. From the shoulders emerge countless millions of rays of light which illumine all those in the vehicle of listeners, followers of the elementary teachings in the ten directions, and present to them a way of entry into the light of the Teaching. From the back of the neck emerge countless millions of rays of light which illumine all the individually awakened ones in the ten directions and present to them a method for quiescent concentration. From the face emerge countless millions of light rays which illumine all the enlightening beings in the ten directions, from those who have just been inspired for the first time up to those who have reached the ninth stage, and present to them the principle of wisdom and skill in means. From the circle of hair between the brows of the enlightening being emerge countless millions of rays of light which shine on the abodes of demons in the ten directions and eclipse them, and then illumine the enlightening beings who have reached the stage of coronation and disappear into their bodies. From the top of the head emerge as many rays of light as atoms in countless millions of billion-world universes, illumining the sites of congregation of all buddhas throughout the reaches of the space of the cosmos, then circling the world to the right in ten ways, then stopping in the sky and forming a great circular network of lights, and then proceeding to make a great offering called ‘blazing light’ to all buddhas. That offering is such that the offerings of all enlightening beings from the first inspiration up to the ninth stage cannot compare even to the smallest fraction of it.
“Furthermore, from that great circular network of lights there rain, in all universes in the ten directions, manifestations of flowers, incenses, garlands, perfumes, aromatic powders, robes, parasols, banners, pennants, clothing, ornaments, jewels, and more, all beyond the scope of all worlds, produced by the influence of stores of transmundane roots of goodness, complete in all their features and qualities, sustained by the inconceivable power of nirvana — rains of various arrays of great riches pour as from a great cloud on the places of assembly of each and every buddha. And whoever perceives those offerings becomes assured of perfect enlightenment.
“Then the lights, having made these offerings, again illumine the circles of assembly of all buddhas, then circle the world to the right in ten ways, and disappear into the soles of the feet of those buddhas. Thence it is known to those buddhas and those enlightening beings that in this world, this realm, this place, the enlightening being following such a practice has reached the time of coronation.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /der phyogs bcu nas byang chub sems dpa'i sa dgu la gnas pa'i bar gyi byang chub sems dpa' mtha' yas pa 'ongs te/ byang chub sems dpa' de la kun nas bskor nas mchod pa chen po byas te/ byang chub sems dpa' de nyid la lta zhing ting nge 'dzin stong phrag bcu bcu la so so nas mnyam par gzhog go /byang chub sems dpa' dbang bskur ba'i sa thob pa rnams kyi dpal gyi be'u dang / rdo rje dang / bkra shis las bdud kyi dgra las rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya ba'i 'od zer chen po gcig 'od zer gyi 'khor brgya stong grangs med pa phrag bcu dang ldan par 'byung ste/ byung nas kyang phyogs bcu snang bar byas nas/ cho 'phrul mu med par yang dag par bstan te/ byang chub sems dpa' de'i dpal gyi be'u dang / rdo rje dang / bkra shis su nub par 'gyur ro/ / 'od zer de dag der nub ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa' de'i stobs dang / mthu yang brgya phrag stong gyur pas kyang lhag par mngon par 'phel bar snang ngo/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /

Then, from incalculable lands in the ten directions, enlightening beings up to the ninth stage come to that enlightening being, encircle the enlightening being, make great offerings, and, while gazing on that enlightening being, enter a million concentrations.
“From the gloriously adorned thunderbolt symbols of well-being on the bodies of enlightening beings who have attained the stage of coronation emerges a great light ray called demon-conqueror, each ray accompanied by countless millions of light rays; having illumined the ten directions and shown countless miracles, the light rays again disappear into the enlightening beings’ thunderbolt symbols of well-being. As soon as those light rays of a hundred thousand higher qualities disappear, there appears an increase in the power and strength of the enlightening being.

de nas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gi smin mtshams kyi mdzod spu nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer gyi 'khor grangs med pa dang ldan pa 'byung ste/ de dag gis phyogs bcu thams cad du 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad ma lus par snang bar byas nas/ 'jig rten lan bcur bskor te/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa chen po bstan nas; byang chub sems dpa' brgya stong bye ba khrag khrig mang po yang dag par bskul nas/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'byams klas pa thams cad rnam pa drug tu bskyod de / ngan song thams cad kyi lam gyi rgyud dang / skye ba dang / shi 'pho rab tu zhi bar byas nas/ bdud kyi gnas thams cad zil gyis mnan te/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mngon par 'tshang rgya bar rnam par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gdan yang dag par bstan nas/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor brgyan pa'i mthu rab tu bstan te/ 'jig rten gyi khams chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa thams cad snang bar byas nas phyir log ste byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi steng nas bskor ba byas te/ rgyan chen po bstan nas 'od zer de dag byang chub sems dpa' de'i yan lag gi dam par nub bo/ / de'i 'khor gyi 'od zer rnams kyang de ltar tshogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mgor nub par 'gyur ro/ / 'od zer de dag gis phog ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis sngan chad ma thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin stong phrag bcu bcu rab tu thob bo/ / 'od zer de dag kyang dus gcig tu byang chub sems dpa' de'i yan chad dam pa la 'char bar 'gyur te/ byang chub sems dpa' de yang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yul la mngon par dbang bskur ba zhes bya'o/ / stobs bcu yongs su rdzogs nas ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su bgrang ba yang 'thob par 'gyur ro/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di lta ste/ dper na/ 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i bu thu bo gzhon nu btsun mo dam pa las btsas pa/ rgyal po'i mtshan dang ldan pa de 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal pos lha'i glang po rin po che la gser gyi khri dam pa'i steng du bzhag ste; steng du bla re bres shing gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / rol mo brdung ba dang / dkrol ba dang / glu'i dbyangs la sogs pa'i rgyan chen po byas te/ rgya mtsho chen po bzhi las chu blangs pa gser gyi bum pas bcus te/ chu des gzhon nu de'i spyi bo nas mngon par dbang bskur na dbang bskur ma thag tu de ni rgyal po rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o/ / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yongs su rdzogs nas ni 'khor los bsgyur bar bgrang ba rab tu 'thob bo/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis dbang bskur ma thag tu ye shes kyi dbang mngon par bskur bas mngon par dbang bskur ba zhes bya'o/ / stobs bcu yongs su rdzogs nas ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi grangs su 'gro'o/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di ni gang gi don du byang chub sems dpa' dka' ba brgya stong du ma rtsom pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par dbang bskur ba'o/ / de de ltar mngon par dbang bskur zhing yon tan dang ye shes rnam par 'phel ba ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin la gnas pa zhes bya'o/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de la byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni chos kyi khams yang dag par bsgrub pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so/ / 'dod pa'i khams yang dag par bsgrub pa dang / gzugs kyi khams yang dag par bsgrub pa dang / gzugs med pa'i khams yang dag par bsgrub pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams yang dag par bsgrub pa dang / sems can gyi khams yang dag par bsgrub pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams yang dag par bsgrub pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams yang dag par bsgrub pa dang / nam mkha'i khams yang dag par bsgrub pa dang / yang dag pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i khams bstan pa yang dag par bsgrub pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i khams yang dag par bsgrub pa dang / lta ba'i rnam pa dang / nyon mongs pa yang dag par bsgrub pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so/ / 'jig rten gyi khams 'jig pa dang 'du ba yang dag par bsgrub pa dang / nyan thos kyi spyod pa yang dag par bsgrub pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa yang dag par bsgrub pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yang dag par bsgrub pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / gzugs kyi sku dang / chos kyi sku yang dag par bsgrub pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yang dag par bsgrub pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / bzlog pa bstan pa yang dag par bsgrub pa dang / mdor bsdu na chos thams cad rnam par phye ba la 'jug cing shin tu brtag pa yang dag par bsgrub pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so/ / de de lta bu'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i blos gong du sems can rnams kyi sprul pa'i las yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so/ / nyon mongs pa'i sprul pa dang / lta ba'i rnam pa'i sprul pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sprul pa dang / chos kyi khams kyi sprul pa dang / nyan thos kyi sprul pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sprul pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa dang / sprul pa thams cad kyi rnam par dgod pa dang / rnam par mi dgod pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so/ / de sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so/ / chos kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / dge 'dun gyi byin gyi rlabs dang / las kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / nyon mongs pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang / dus kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / smon lam gyi byin gyi rlabs dang / mchod pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang / spyod pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang / bskal pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang / ye shes kyi byin gyi rlabs yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so/ / gang 'di de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi phra ba la 'jug pa'i ye shes 'di lta ste/ spyod pa phra ba la 'jug pa'i ye shes sam/ skye ba dang 'pho ba phra ba la 'jug pa'i ye shes sam/ sku tshe phra ba la 'jug pa'i ye shes sam/ mngon par 'byung ba phra ba la 'jug pa'i ye shes sam; mngon par byang chub pa phra ba la 'jug pa'i ye shes sam/ rnam par 'phrul pa phra ba la 'jug pa'i ye shes sam/ chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba phra ba la 'jug pa'i ye shes sam/ sku tshe'i tshad byin gyi rlabs pa phra ba la 'jug pa'i ye shes sam/ yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba phra ba la 'jug pa'i ye shes sam/ bstan pa gnas pa phra ba la 'jug pa'i ye shes de dag thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du des rab tu shes so/ /

“Then there emerges from the circle of hair between the eyebrows of the buddhas beams of light called possessors of omniscient superknowledge, accompanied by countless light beams; illumining all worlds in the ten directions, circling the worlds in ten ways to the right, inspiring many hundreds of quadrillions of enlightening beings, causing all buddha-lands to quake in six ways, stopping all death and rebirth in bad conditions, eclipsing all abodes of demons, showing the settings of enlightenment of all buddhas, and illuminating all worlds throughout the cosmos to the furthest reaches of space, then returning again, circling all assemblies of enlightening beings to the right and manifesting an immense array, those beams of light disappear into the top of the enlightening being’s head. The accompanying light beams in the same way enter into the heads of the enlightening beings assembled around that enlightening being who has reached the tenth stage, whereupon they attain a million concentrations that they have never attained before.
“At the same time as those light beams enter the enlightening being’s head, the enlightening being is said to be coronated; in the realm of perfectly completely enlightened ones, having fulfilled the ten powers, the enlightening being enters the ranks of the perfect buddhas. It is like the son of a universal ruler, the crown prince, borne by the principal wife, becoming imbued with the characteristics of a universal ruler: the universal ruler seats him on a magnificent golden elephant throne and, bringing water from the four seas, setting over the palace great arrays of flowers, incenses, lamps, garlands, perfumes, aromatic powders, cloths, parasols, banners, pennants, music and song, he takes the golden pitcher containing water from the four oceans and anoints the head of his son with the water, whereupon the son joins the ranks of the consecrated rulers. Then, when he has fulfilled the tenfold path of good action, he gains the name of universal ruler, the one who turns the wheel of the law. In the same way, as soon as the enlightening being is coronated by those blessed buddhas, the enlightening being is said to be anointed with great knowledge. And having fulfilled the ten powers by the anointment of complete buddhas, the enlightening being enters the ranks of the truly consummately enlightened ones. This is the enlightening being’s anointment, or coronation, with great knowledge, in quest of which the enlightening being undertakes many hundreds of thousands of difficult practices. Thus coronated, matured in immeasurable virtue and knowledge, the enlightening being is said to be established in the tenth stage, which is called Cloud of Teaching.
“Enlightening beings in this stage have accurate knowledge of the totality of the realm of reality, the realm of desire, the realm of form, the formless realm, the realm of worlds, the realm of all beings, the realm of consciousness, the realms of the created and the uncreated, the realm of space, and the teaching of being and nonbeing; they have accurate knowledge of the totality of the realm of nirvana, and of afflictions created by views; they have accurate knowledge of the totality of the becoming and decay of worlds, of the practice of followers of the elementary Buddhist teachings, of the practice of individual illuminates, of the practice of enlightening beings, of the buddhas’ powers, expertises, unique qualities of buddhahood, and material and spiritual bodies, of omniscience in all its aspects, of demonstration of attainment of enlightenment and turning the wheel of teaching—in sum, they have accurate knowledge of accomplishment of all the different ways of access to truth. They also have accurate knowledge of the projection of the world, the projection of the cosmos, the projection of Buddhist followers, the projection of individual illuminates, the projection of enlightening beings, the projection of buddhas, and the feasibility or unfeasibility of all projections.
“They also know the basis of all buddhas as it really is; they know, too, the basis of the Teaching, the basis of the Community, the basis of action, the basis of affliction, the basis of time, the basis of commitment, the basis of reverence, the basis of conduct, the basis of ages, and the basis of knowledge, all as they truly are.
“Also, all knowledge of the buddhas entering into subtleties—knowledge of details of practice, of death in heaven and rebirth on earth, of birth, of leaving home, of attaining enlightenment, of miracles, of setting the wheel of the Teaching in motion, of preaching the truth, of the full details of the Teaching, of the support of the life span, of the manifestation of the body of glorified form, of the orderly guidance of all beings, of manifestation in all worlds, of observing the mental behavior of all beings, of observing past, present, and future in a single instant, of the entire past and future, of the totality of mental actions of beings in all their variety, of the inconceivable powers, expertises, and special qualities of the enlightened, of the ultimate nirvana of the buddhas, of the lasting of the true Teaching based on instruction—beginning with these, they accurately know all the incalculable knowledges of buddhas entering into subtleties.

gang 'di de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi gsang ba la 'jug pa'i gnas 'di lta te/ sku'i gsang ba'am/ gsung gi gsang ba'am/ thugs kyi gsang ba'am/ dus dang dus ma yin pa thugs su chud pa'i gsang ba'am/ byang chub sems dpa' lung bstan pa'i gsang ba'am/ sems can bsdu ba dang / tshar gcad pa gsang ba'am/ theg pa tha dad pa gsang ba'am/ sems can gyi spyod pa dang / dbang po rnam par phye ba gsang ba'am/ las dang bya ba la 'jug pa gsang ba'am/ spyod pa dang mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i rang bzhin brjod pa thugs su chud pa gsang ba de dag thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du des rab tu shes so/ / gang 'di dag bskal pa la 'jug pa'i ye shes 'di lta ste/ bskal pa gcig la bskal pa grangs med par yang dag par 'jug pa dang / grangs med pa'i bskal pa la bskal pa gcig tu yang dag par 'jug pa dang / bskal pa grangs med pa la bskal pa grangs med par yang dag par 'jug pa dang / bskal pa gcig la bskal pa dang / bskal pa la skad cig tu yang dag par 'jug pa dang / bskal pa la bskal pa ma yin par yang dag par 'jug pa dang / bskal pa ma yin pa la bskal par yang dag par 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas dang bcas pa'i bskal pa sangs rgyas med pa'i bskal par yang dag par 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas med pa'i bskal pa sangs rgyas dang bcas pa'i bskal par yang dag par 'jug pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba la da ltar byung ba dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i bskal par 'jug cing / ma 'ongs pa dang / 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i bskal par yang dag par 'jug pa dang / bskal pa ring po la bskal pa thung ngur yang dag par 'jug pa dang / bskal pa thung ngu la bskal pa ring por yang dag par 'jug pa dang / bskal pa thams cad la ming du btags par yang dag par 'jug pa de dag thams cad kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du des rab tu shes so/ / gang 'di dag de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis thugs su chud pa'i ye shes 'di lta ste/ skra'i rtse mo la 'jug pa'i ye shes sam/ rdul shin tu phra ba la 'jug pa'i ye shes sam/ zhing mang po mngon par 'tshang rgya ba la 'jug pa'i ye shes sam/ sems can gyi lus dang / sems mngon par 'tshang rgya ba la 'jug pa'i ye shes sam/ thams cad du khyab pa mngon par 'tshang rgya ba la 'jug pa'i ye shes sam; snrel zhi'i spyod pa la 'jug pa yang dag par ston pa'i ye shes sam/ lugs dang mthun pa'i spyod pa yang dag par bstan pa la 'jug pa'i ye shes sam/ lugs dang mi mthun pa'i spyod pa yang dag par bstan pa la 'jug pa'i ye shes sam/ 'jig rten bsam du rung ba dang / bsam du mi rung ba dang / rnam par shes par rung ba dang / rnam par shes par mi rung ba'i spyod pa yang dag par bstan pa la 'jug pa'i ye shes sam/ nyan thos kyis shes par bya ba dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis shes par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpas shes par bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen par bya ba'i spyod pa yang dag par bstan pa la 'jug pa'i ye shes de dag thams cad kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du des rab tu shes so/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de ltar na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ye shes shin tu yangs pa tshad med pas sa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas khong du chud pa'i ye shes kyang tshad med do/ /

“They know all the secret matters of the buddhas, such as the secret of the body, the secret of speech, the secret of mind, the secret of consideration of right and wrong timing, the secret of giving enlightening beings predictions of enlightenment, the secret of taking care of sentient beings, the secret of encouragement and censure as means of guidance, the secret of impartiality in timely admonition and instruction, the secret of establishing a variety of vehicles of liberation, the secret of distinction of beings’ conduct and faculties, the secret of penetrating beings’ acts and deeds, the secret of distinction of enlightening beings’ practices and faculties, the secret of enlightenment through practice and realization of inherent power, the secret of the basis of realization of intrinsic essence, the secret of manifestation and liberation, the secret of attraction and expulsion, the secret of showing the attitudes of standing, walking, sitting, and reclining, the secret of provision of food and physical necessities, the secret of showing speech, silence, meditation, liberation, concentration, and attainment; they know all such secret matters of the buddhas as they really are.
“They also accurately realize all the buddhas’ knowledges of the interpenetration of ages, such as one age as containing incalculable ages, incalculable ages as containing one age, calculable ages as containing incalculable ages, incalculable ages as containing calculable ages, a moment of thought as containing ages, ages as containing moments of thought, ages as containing nonages, nonages as containing ages, ages with buddhas as containing ages without buddhas, ages without buddhas as containing ages with buddhas, past ages as containing future and present ages, present ages as containing past and future ages, future ages as containing past and present ages, long ages as containing short ages, short ages as containing long ages, the containment of what is made of preceptions in all ages, the containment of ages in all that is made of perceptions.
“They also accurately know all the complete buddhas’ penetrating knowledges, such as knowledge penetrating a point the size of a hairtip, knowledge penetrating atomic particles, knowledge penetrating realization of enlightenment in the body and land of a buddha, knowledge penetrating realization of enlightenment with the body and mind of a sentient being, knowledge penetrating the realization of enlightenment in all places, knowledge penetrating demonstration of preposterous actions, knowledge penetrating demonstration of conformist behavior, knowledge penetrating demonstration of unconventional behavior, knowledge penetrating demonstration of conceivable and inconceivable acts, acts that can be recognized by the world and acts that cannot be recognized, knowledge penetrating demonstration of acts that can be understood by buddhas’ disciples, acts that can be understood by self-enlightened people, acts that can be understood by enlightening beings, and acts that can be understood by buddhas. Just as such vast extent of knowledge of the buddhas is immeasurable, so also the penetrating knowledge of enlightening beings in this stage is infinite.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sa 'di dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba rab tu 'thob bo/ / bsgribs pa med pa zhes bya ba dang / rnam par dag pa rab tu 'byed pa zhes bya ba dang / sgo kun tu snang ba zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzod ces bya ba dang / 'khor lo thogs pa med pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba dang / dus gsum gyi rjes su song ba zhes bya ba dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi snying po zhes bya ba dang / rnam par thar pa'i dkyil 'khor snang ba zhes bya ba dang / yul ma lus pa zhes bya ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa rab tu 'thob bo/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di lta ste/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa bcu po de dag la sogs pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo brgya stong grangs med pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas rab tu thob ste/ de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin brgya phrag stong dang / gzungs brgya phrag stong dang / mngon par shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa brgya phrag stong yang rab tu 'thob bo/ / de ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pa'i blo dang / tshad med pa'i rjes su song ba'i dran pa mkhas pa dang ldan pa yin/ de phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das grangs med pa las skad cig yud tsam thang cig tu chos kyi snang ba chen po tshad med pa dang / chos kyi 'od chen po dang / chos kyi sprin chen po yang dag par 'dzin to/ / mos par byed do/ / yang dag par len to/ / bdag gir byed do/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rgya mtsho'i klu'i rgyal po'i sprin las rnam par bkye ba'i chu'i phung po chen po ni rgya mtsho chen po ma gtogs par sa'i phyogs gzhan gyis bzod pa'am/ bdag gir bya ba dang / blang ba'am/ gzung bar mi nus so; ; kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba la 'jug pa dang / chos kyi snang ba chen po dang / chos kyi 'od chen po dang / chos kyi sprin chen po de dag ni sems can thams cad dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / sa dang po nye bar bzung ba yan chad sa dgu pa'i bar la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis kyang bzod pa'am/ blang ba'am/ yang dag par gzung ba'am/ bdag gir bya bar sla ba ma yin te/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni de dag thams cad la mos par byed do/ / yang dag par len to/ / yang dag par 'dzin te; ; bdag gir byed do/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di lta ste/ dper na/ rgya mtsho chen po ni klu'i rgyal po chen po gcig gi sprin chen po yang bzod do/ / len to/ / 'dzin to/ / bdag gir byed do/ / klu'i rgyal po chen po gnyis dang / gsum nas tshad med pa'i bar gyi sprin chen po dag kyang skad cig yud tsam thang cig gis bzod do/ / len to/ / 'dzin to; ; bdag gir byed do/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ rgya mtsho chen po de tshad med par rgya che zhing yangs pa'i phyir ro/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang de bzhin gshegs pa gcig las kyang skad cig yud tsam thang cig tu chos snang ba chen po dang / chos kyi 'od chen po dang / chos kyi sprin chen po tshad med pa rnams bzod do/ / yang dag par len to/ / yang dag par 'dzin to/ / bdag gir byed do/ / de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis dang / gsum nas tshad med pa'i bar dag las kyang skad cig yud tsam thang cig tu chos kyi snang ba chen po dang / chos kyi 'od chen po dang / chos kyi sprin chen po tshad med pa bzod do; ; yang dag par 'dzin to/ / yang dag par len to/ / bdag gir byed do/ /
de ci'i phyir zhe na/ sa 'di yang chos kyi sprin ces bya'o/ /

“Furthermore, the enlightening beings following this stage attain the liberation of enlightening beings that is called inconceivable, and the liberations called unobstructed, pure discernment, all-sided illumination, treasury of realization of thusness, following the unhindered wheel, comprehending past, present, and future, matrix of the cosmos, radiance of the circle of liberation, and attainment of the realm of totality. Beginning with these, enlightening beings in the tenth stage attain countless hundreds of thousands of doors of liberation, and in the same way they attain hundreds of thousands of concentrations, mental controls, super-knowledges, and spiritual powers; they attain hundreds of thousands of lights of knowledge, mystical transformations, accomplishments of analytic knowledge, masteries of means and wisdom, floods of great compassion, and entries into the controlling powers of enlightening beings.
“By means of intellect in accord with such knowledge, they become imbued with infinite ability to recollect anything. They are able to receive, take in, and hold infinite great revelations, clarifications, and clouds of teachings from the buddhas of the ten directions in a single instant. Just as no place on earth except the ocean can bear, can receive, can take in, can hold the great mass of water showered by the clouds of the oceanic water spirit, in the same way the entries into the mysteries of the buddhas—great revelations, great clarifications, great clouds of teachings—cannot be born, received, taken in, or held by all sentient beings, listeners, or self-enlightened ones, or even by enlightening beings from the first to the ninth stages. It is the enlightening beings in the tenth stage, cloud of teaching, who bear, receive, take in, and hold it all. It is as the ocean bears, receives, takes in, and holds the great clouds of one water spirit, or two, or three, up to the innumerable great clouds of innumerable water spirits in a single moment, because of the immeasurable vast breadth of the ocean. In the same way, enlightening beings in this tenth stage, Cloud of Teaching, bear, receive, take in, and hold, in a single instant, immeasurable great revelations, clarifications, and clouds of great teachings from two, three, up to infinitely many buddhas. Thus this stage is called Cloud of Teaching.”

byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas smras pa/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin gshegs pa ji snyed cig las byang chub sems dpa' skad cig yud tsam thang cig tu chos kyi snang ba chen po dang / chos kyi 'od chen po dang; chos kyi sprin chen po bzod par byed pa dang / yang dag par 'dzin pa dang / yang dag par len cing bdag gir byed pa de dag bgrang bar nus sam/

The enlightening being Moon of Liberation said, “Is it possible to count how many buddhas the enlightening beings receive and hold the great revelations, clarifications, and clouds of teachings from in a single instant?”

byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos smras pa/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin gshegs pa 'di snyed cig las byang chub sems dpa' skad cig yud tsam thang cig tu chos kyi snang ba chen po dang / chos kyi 'od chen po dang / chos kyi sprin chen po bzod cing yang dag par len pa dang / yang dag par 'dzin cing bdag gir byed do/ / zhes grangs kyis shin tu bstan pa'i tshul du bgrang bar sla ba ma yin te/ 'on kyang dpe tsam du bstan par bya'o/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa; bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed na/ sems can gyi khams ma lus pa'i tshul du ji snyed cig yod pa de dag las sems can gcig cig thos pa 'dzin pa'i gzungs rab tu thob par gyur to/ / 'di lta ste/ dper na/ bcom ldan 'das rdo rje pad+mo'i bla ma de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi dge slong rnam par rgyal ba chen po zhes bya ba bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i zham ring ba nyan thos chen po thos pa 'dzin pa'i mchog tu phyin par gyur la; rnam pa de lta bu'i thos pa 'dzin pa'i stobs kyi shugs dang / sems can gcig po de ldan par gyur te/ sems can gcig po de ci 'dra ba de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams de dag thams cad kyi sems can thams cad dang ldan par gyur la/ gcig gis gang bzung ba de bzhin gyis bzung na/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras/ de la ji snyam du sems/ sems can de dag gi thos pa 'dzin pa'i shes pa de dag tshad med cing mang ba yin mod/ byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas smras pa/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras/ sems can de dag gi thos pa 'dzin pa'i shes pa de ni mang ste/ tshad kyang med do/ /

Diamond Matrix said, “It is not possible to give a numerical account of how many buddhas enlightening beings receive teachings from in a single instant. I will, however, make a simile. Suppose that in each of the ten directions, in worlds as numerous as atoms in untold quintillions of buddha-lands, and all the realms of beings found therein, there were one being with the mental command to retain whatever he heard, an attendant of buddhas, a great disciple, foremost of the holders of learning, and that being were endowed with such power of skill in learning. Now suppose all the beings in all those worlds were similarly endowed, and what was learned by each one was not learned by another. What do you think — would the learning ability of all those beings be immeasurable?” Moon of Liberation said, “Great, immeasurable would be the learning ability of those beings.”

byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos smras pa/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras/ khyod kyis khong du chud pa dang yid ches par bya na/ de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni de bzhin gshegs pa gcig las kyang skad cig yud tsam thang cig tu chos kyi snang ba dang / 'od dang / sprin chen po chos kyi dbyings dus gsum gyi mdzod ces bya ba bzod cing yang dag par len to/ / yang dag par 'dzin to/ / bdag gir byed do/ / chos kyi snang ba dang / 'od dang / sprin chen po yang dag par 'dzin pa'i shes pa de la thos pa 'dzin pa'i shes pa snga mas brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o/ / stong gi cha dang / brgya phrag stong gi cha dang / bye ba'i cha dang / bye ba brgya'i cha dang / bye ba stong gi cha dang / bye ba brgya stong gi cha dang / bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi cha dang / grangs dang / cha dang / bgrang ba dang / dpe dang; rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro ba nas/ bsgrun pa tsam gyi bar du yang mi chog go /de bzhin gshegs pa gcig las ji lta ba de bzhin du phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams snga ma dag na rdul shin tu phra ba ji snyed pa de snyed kyi yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang / de dag pas kyang ches mang zhing tshad med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams las skad cig yud tsam thang cig tu chos kyi snang ba dang / 'od dang / sprin chen po chos kyi dbyings dus gsum gyi mdzod ces bya ba bzod cing yang dag par len to/ / yang dag par 'dzin to; ; bdag gir byed do/ / de bas na sa 'di yang chos kyi sprin ces bya'o/ /

Diamond Matrix said, “I tell you, in an instant the enlightening beings in this stage of Cloud of Teaching bear, receive, take in, and hold from a buddha a great cloud of lights of revelation of teaching called ‘treasury of past, present, and future of the cosmos’—the aforementioned ability in learning cannot compare to the minutest fraction of this ability to hold the cloud of light of revelation of the teaching. And just as they receive this from one buddha, so also do they receive and hold the cloud of lights of revelation of great teaching called ‘treasury of the past, present, and future of the cosmos’ from as many buddhas as atoms in all the worlds of the ten directions, and from yet more, from infinite buddhas, all in a single instant. Hence this stage is called Cloud of Teaching.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rang gi smon lam gyi stobs dang shugs kyis snying brtse ba dang / snying rje chen po'i sprin chos kyi snang ba chen po rab tu sgrog pa'i 'brug sgra shin tu sgrog pa mngon par shes pa dang / rig pa dang / mi 'jigs pa'i glog rnam par 'gyur ba 'od zer chen po'i rlung gis shin tu bskyod pa/ bsod nams dang ye shes kyi sprin gyi dra ba stug pos kun nas khebs pa/ lus sna tshogs kyi sprin gyi glog yang dag par ston pa/ chos kyi sgra chen po rab tu sgrog pa bdud kyi 'khor thams cad shin tu tshar gcod pa yongs su bslang ste/ skad cig yud tsam thang cig tu phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten snga ma de dag na rdul shin tu phra ba ji snyed yod pa de snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyang bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong dang; de dag pas kyang ches mang zhing tshad med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong rgyas par bkang ste/ dge ba'i bdud rtsi'i rgyun gyi char chen pos bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams kyi mi shes pa las langs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rdul gyi me lce thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed do/ / de bas na sa 'di'ang chos kyi sprin ces bya'o/ /

“Furthermore, enlightening beings in this stage, by the power of their own vows, cause great clouds of compassion to arise, manifesting the thunder of the great Teaching, flashing the lightning of mystic knowledge, science, and expertise, whipping up a great wind of radiance, covering all with a dense cloud of virtue and knowledge, showing a dense swirl of various bodies, uttering the proclamation of the great Teaching, routing the horde of demons; and, in one instant, throughout as many quadrillions of worlds as atoms in the worlds in the ten directions mentioned above, and throughout yet more worlds, incalculable hundreds of quadrillions of worlds, they show great rains of goodness-bearing elixir of immortality and settle and extinguish all the dust and flames of afflictions of beings produced by ignorance. Hence this stage is called Cloud of Teaching.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu yang dga' ldan gyi gnas na bzhugs pa nas bzung ste/ 'pho ba dang / yum gyi skur bzhud pa dang / sku na bzhugs pa dang / tshe dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang / mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dang / gsol ba gdab pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo chen po bskor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa chen po bstan pa'i bar du sems can gyi bsam pa'i tshul dang / 'dul ba'i tshul ji lta ba bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'phrin las thams cad byin gyis rlob bo/ / de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams gnyis nas 'jig rten gyi khams snga ma de dag na rdul shin tu phra ba ji snyed yod pa de dag pas kyang ches mang ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong tshad med pa'i bar dag tu yang dga' ldan gyi gnas na bzhugs pa nas bzung ste/ yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po bstan pa'i bar du sems can rnams kyi bsam pa'i tshul dang / 'dul ba'i tshul ji lta ba bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'phrin las thams cad byin gyis rlob bo/ / de de lta bu'i ye shes dang ldan zhing shin tu brtags pa'i mngon par shes pa chen po thob pas/ 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams dog pa yangs par byin gyis rlob bo/ / yangs pa yang dog par byin gyis rlob bo/ / 'dod na kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par dag par byin gyis rlob bo/ / rnam par dag pa kun nas nyon mongs par byin gyis rlob bo/ / de bzhin du rgya chen po dang / shin tu yangs pa dang / tshad med pa dang / phra ba dang / tha gru chen po dang / snrel zhi dang / spyi'u tshugs dang / gzhi mnyam pa la sogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyang khyu mchog gi mthu phyung bas mngon par bsgrub pa de dang der byin gyis rlob bo/ / de 'dod na rdul shin tu phra ba gcig la 'jig rten gyi khams khor yug gi 'obs dang bcas pa rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa gcig kyang byin gyis rlob ste/ rdul shin tu phra ba de yang mi 'phel la/ bya ba de dag kyang yongs su rton to/ / rdul shin tu phra ba gcig la 'jig rten gyi khams gnyis dang / gsum dang / bzhi dang / lnga nas 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa'i bar du thams cad kyang khor yug gi 'obs dang bcas pa rnam pa thams cad dang ldan par byin gyis rlob ste/ rdul shin tu phra ba de yang mi 'phel la/ bya ba de dag kyang yongs su ston to/ / 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu 'jig rten gyi khams gnyis kyi rgyan yongs su ston to/ / 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa'i bar gyi rgyan yongs su ston to/ / 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams gcig gi rgyan 'jig rten gyi khams gnyis su yongs su ston to/ / 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa dag tu yang yongs su ston to/ / 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa dag na/ sems can gyi khams ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu sdud de/ sems can de dag la yang gnod par mi 'gyur ro/ / 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams gcig na/ sems can gyi khams ji snyed pa de dag 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med par sdud de/ sems can de dag la yang gnod par mi 'gyur ro/ / 'dod na skra'i rtse mo gcig la sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi rgyan rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa gcig ston to/ / 'dod na sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi rgyan rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa brjod du med pa'i bar du ston to/ / 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa dag na/ rdul shin tu phra ba ji snyed yod pa de snyed kyi lus skad cig yud tsam thar cig tu shin tu sprul pa byed do/ / lus re re la yang de snyed kyi lag pa yongs su ston to/ / lag pa de dag gis kyang phyogs bcur sangs rgyas mchod pa rab tu byed de/ lag pa re res kyang me tog gi phung po chu klung gang+gA'i bye ma snyed sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la mngon par 'thor ro/ / me tog ji lta ba bzhin du spos dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / de bzhin du rgyan thams cad kyang yongs su 'bul lo/ / lus re re la yang de snyed kyi mgo byin gyis rlob cing; mgo re re la yang de snyed kyi lce byin gyis brlabs te/ de dag gis kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi yon tan shin tu rjod pa byed do; ;

“Furthermore, the enlightening beings in this stage of Cloud of Teaching manifest all the works of buddhas in one world, beginning with abiding in the heaven of satisfaction, then descending to earth, abiding in the womb, birth, leaving home, attaining enlightenment, being requested to teach, setting in motion the wheel of the Teaching, and the stage of great ultimate nirvana, manifesting these to beings according to their dispositions and capacities for being guided. As they do this in one world, so also do they do the same in two worlds, up to unspeakable, untold numbers of worlds. Having attained such control of knowledge, with absolutely certain great knowledge and mystic knowledge, at will they show a defiled world as pure, show a pure world as defiled, show a narrow world as broad, show a broad world as narrow; in this way, by mystic power, they show magical transformations of all worlds—vast, measureless, minute, erroneous, deranged, inverted, upright, and so on. If they want they can put a whole world, including its peripheral mountains and seas, into a single atom, yet without expanding the atom or shrinking the world, displaying all functions therein. They put two, three, four, five, up to untold numbers of worlds into one atom, yet without expanding the atom, and still displaying all the functions in the worlds. At will they show in one world the arrays of two worlds or, as they wish, show the arrays of up to an untold number of worlds. As they wish, they show the array of one world in two worlds, or in up to an unspeakable number of worlds. As they wish they show in one world the beings in up to an unspeakable number of worlds yet without injuring or troubling those beings. As they wish they show the beings of one world in an unspeakable number of worlds, without injuring or disturbing the beings. As they wish they show the full array of a buddha-realm in a point the size of a hairtip; if they wish they show the full arrays of untold buddha-realms in one point. As they wish they instantly emanate as many bodies as atoms in untold worlds, manifest that many hands on each individual body, and make offerings to the buddhas of the ten directions with those hands; with each hand they sprinkle as many baskets of flowers on those buddhas as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River, and do likewise with fragrances, garlands, perfumes, aromatic powders, robes, parasols, banners, and pennants. They also manifest that many heads on each body, and manifest that many tongues in each head, telling of the glory of the buddhas.
